there a discussion about recumbent power on brol the extract make a brief aside about the need to pee in the standing position the lung can be roughly divided into three zone where there is ventilation but no perfusion the top of the lung there is no blood flow because the pressure head out of the right heart is not high enough to pump blood that high where there is ventilation and perfusion the middle part of the lung and where there is perfusion but no ventilation the bottom of the lung where the fluid pressure is higher than the opening pressure of the bronchiole and alveolus where gas exchange take place all this is dependent on gravity and fluid pressuresbasic physic the volume of the air in the airway that doesnt participate in gas exchange combined with the volume of air in zone is called the dead space and amount to about of your normal breath when you assume a supine or recumbent position thing change zone get a lot smaller but zone get bigger and there is a large individual variation secondly the volume of blood that resides in the lower extremity when upright get pushed back into the system when you are supine and the pulmonary circulation since it is a high volumelow pressure system end up being the receptacle for much of it that is why people in heart failure like to sleep sitting upthey can breathe much better lung function is the same but respiratory function ha changed that is also one of the reason why people riding recumbents tend to have to pee more after riding for a whilestretch receptor in the vessel signal the fluid load to the body which in turn signal the kidney to make more urine apr http forumcyclingukorg viewtopicphpftp

blood pressure is a measurement of the pressure in your artery during the active and resting phase of each heartbeat here what the number mean systolic pressure the first top number in a blood pressure reading this is the amount of pressure your heart generates when pumping blood through your artery to the rest of your body diastolic pressure the second bottom number in a blood pressure reading this refers to the amount of pressure in your artery when your heart is at rest between beat current guideline identify normal blood pressure a lower than mm hg although you can get an accurate blood pressure reading at any given time blood pressure isnt always the same it can vary considerably in a short amount of time sometimes from one heartbeat to the next depending on body position breathing rhythm stress level physical condition medication you take what you eat and drink and even time of day blood pressure is usually lowest at night and rise sharply on waking blood pressure how low can you go whats considered low blood pressure for you may be normal for someone else most doctor consider chronically low blood pressure too low only if it cause noticeable symptom some expert define low blood pressure a reading lower than mm hg systolic or mm hg diastolic you need to have only one number in the low range for your blood pressure to be considered lower than normal in other word if your systolic pressure is a perfect but your diastolic pressure is youre considered to have lower than normal pressure a sudden fall in blood pressure also can be dangerous a change of just mm hg a drop from systolic to mm hg systolic for example can cause dizziness and fainting when the brain fails to receive an adequate supply of blood and big plunge especially those caused by uncontrolled bleeding severe infection or allergic reaction can be lifethreatening athlete and people who exercise regularly tend to have lower blood pressure and a slower heart rate than do people who arent a fit so in general do nonsmoker and people who eat a healthy diet and maintain a normal weight but in some rare instance low blood pressure can be a sign of serious even lifethreatening disorder condition that can cause low blood pressure some medical condition can cause low blood pressure these include pregnancy because a woman circulatory system expands rapidly during pregnancy blood pressure is likely to drop this is normal and blood pressure usually return to your prepregnancy level after youve given birth heart problem some heart condition that can lead to low blood pressure include extremely low heart rate bradycardia heart valve problem heart attack and heart failurethese condition may cause low blood pressure because they prevent your body from being able to circulate enough blood endocrine problem thyroid condition such a parathyroid disease adrenal insufficiency addisons disease low blood sugar hypoglycemia and in some case diabetes can trigger low blood pressure dehydration when you become dehydrated your body loses more water than it take in even mild dehydration can cause weakness dizziness and fatigue fever vomiting severe diarrhea overuse of diuretic and strenuous exercise can all lead to dehydrationfar more serious is hypovolemic shock a lifethreatening complication of dehydration it occurs when low blood volume cause a sudden drop in blood pressure and a reduction in the amount of oxygen reaching your tissue if untreated severe hypovolemic shock can cause death within a few minute or hour blood loss losing a lot of blood from a major injury or internal bleeding reduces the amount of blood in your body leading to a severe drop in blood pressure severe infection septicemia septicemia can happen when an infection in the body enters the bloodstream this condition can lead to a lifethreatening drop in blood pressure called septic shock severe allergic reaction anaphylaxis anaphylaxis is a severe and potentially lifethreatening allergic reaction common trigger of anaphylaxis include food certain medication insect venom and latex anaphylaxis can cause breathing problem hive itching a swollen throat and a drop in blood pressure lack of nutrient in your diet a lack of the vitamin b and folate can cause a condition in which your body doesnt produce enough red blood cell anemia causing low blood pressure medication that can cause low blood pressure some medication you may take can also cause low blood pressure including diuretic water pill such a furosemide lasix and hydrochlorothiazide microzide oretic alpha blocker such a prazosin minipress and labetalol beta blocker such a atenolol tenormin propranolol inderal innopran xl others and timolol drug for parkinson disease such a pramipexole mirapex or those containing levodopa certain type of antidepressant tricyclic antidepressant including doxepin silenor imipramine tofranil protriptyline vivactil and trimipramine surmontil sildenafil viagra or tadalafil cialis particularly in combination with the heart medication nitroglycerin type of low blood pressure doctor often break down low blood pressure hypotension into different category depending on the cause and other factor some type of low blood pressure include low blood pressure on standing up orthostatic or postural hypotension this is a sudden drop in blood pressure when you stand up from a sitting position or if you stand up after lying downordinarily gravity cause blood to pool in your leg whenever you stand your body compensates for this by increasing your heart rate and constricting blood vessel thereby ensuring that enough blood return to your brainbut in people with orthostatic hypotension this compensating mechanism fails and blood pressure fall leading to symptom of dizziness lightheadedness blurred vision and even fainting orthostatic hypotension can occur for a variety of reason including dehydration prolonged bed rest pregnancy diabetes heart problem burn excessive heat large varicose vein and certain neurological disorder a number of medication also can cause orthostatic hypotension particularly drug used to treat high blood pressure diuretic beta blocker calcium channel blocker and angiotensinconverting enzyme ace inhibitor a well a antidepressant and drug used to treat parkinson disease and erectile dysfunction orthostatic hypotension is especially common in older adult with a many a percent of those older than age experiencing orthostatic hypotension but orthostatic hypotension can also affect young otherwise healthy people who stand up suddenly after sitting with their leg crossed for long period or after working for a time in a squatting position low blood pressure after eating postprandial hypotension postprandial hypotension is a sudden drop in blood pressure after eating it affect mostly older adultsjust a gravity pull blood to your foot when you stand a large amount of blood flow to your digestive tract after you eatordinarily your body counteracts this by increasing your heart rate and constricting certain blood vessel to help maintain normal blood pressure but in some people these mechanism fail leading to dizziness faintness and fall postprandial hypotension is more likely to affect people with high blood pressure or autonomic nervous system disorder such a parkinson disease lowering the dose of blood pressure drug and eating small lowcarbohydrate meal may help reduce symptom low blood pressure from faulty brain signal neurally mediated hypotension this disorder cause blood pressure to drop after standing for long period leading to sign and symptom such a dizziness nausea and faintingneurally mediated hypotension mostly affect young people and it seems to occur because of a miscommunication between the heart and the brainwhen you stand for extended period your blood pressure fall a blood pool in your leg normally your body then make adjustment to normalize your blood pressure but in people with neurally mediated hypotension nerve in the heart left ventricle actually signal the brain that blood pressure is too high rather than too low a a result the brain lessens the heart rate decreasing blood pressure even further this cause more blood to pool in the leg and le blood to reach the brain leading to lightheadedness and fainting low blood pressure due to nervous system damage multiple system atrophy with orthostatic hypotension also called shydrager syndrome this rare disorder cause progressive damage to the autonomic nervous system which control involuntary function such a blood pressure heart rate breathing and digestionalthough this condition can be associated with muscle tremor slowed movement problem with coordination and speech and incontinence it main characteristic is severe orthostatic hypotension in combination with very high blood pressure when lying down low blood pressure cause general hypotension low blood pressure without symptom is not generally a cause for concern longterm hypotension that doe not cause symptom is rarely serious in fact many athlete have low blood pressure and have a decreased risk of developing heart disease hypotension that cause symptom may be a sign of an underlying health condition sometimes hypotension may even indicate a serious and or lifethreatening problem such a a widespread infection below are some of the most common cause of hypotension allergic reaction anaphylaxis a lifethreatening allergic reaction called anaphylaxis often cause a sudden and dramatic drop in blood pressure additional symptom may include itching hive difficulty breathing swelling of the throat and tongue stomach cramp nausea and diarrhea this reaction may occur in response to medication herb supplement food such a peanut bee sting or other severe allergy blood loss sudden hypotension may occur if a person loses a lot of blood from a serious injury internal bleeding or complication during surgery the severity of hypotension depends on how much blood is lost endocrine problem endocrine disorder also called hormonal disorder may cause hypotension endocrine problem occur when the body release too many or too few hormone which are chemical that help regulate bodily function endocrine problem such a an underactive thyroid called hypothyroidism overactive thyroid called hyperthyroidism adrenal insufficiency called addisons disease low blood sugar level and in some case diabetes may lead to hypotension dehydration dehydration may lead to hypotension even mild dehydration may cause symptom such a lightheadedness dizziness and weakness severe dehydration may lead to a lifethreatening complication called hypovolemic shock this condition occurs when a decreased blood volume in the body cause a sudden drop in blood pressure a a result the body tissue and organ do not receive enough oxygen if left untreated hypoyolemic shock may be fatal within a few minute to hour heart problem several heart problem including an extremely low heart rate called bradycardia heart valve problem heart attack and heart failure may lead to hypotension these condition prevent the body from circulating enough blood to tissue and organ medication many drug can cause low blood pressure including diuretic blood pressurelowering drug heart medication such a beta blocker or calcium channel blocker drug used to treat parkinson disease tricyclic antidepressant erectile dysfunction drug such a viagra narcotic and alcohol other medication prescription and overthecounter may lower blood pressure when they are taken in combination with blood pressurelowering drug nutritional deficiency people who have low level of vitamin b and folate may develop anemia a condition that may cause low blood pressure people who have eating disorder such a anorexia or bulimia have an increased risk of developing nutritional deficiency that can lead to hypotension pregnancy a woman blood pressure often decrease during pregnancy this is because the mother circulatory system expands quickly during pregnancy during the first week of pregnancy it is common for a woman systolic blood pressure to drop five to point and for her diastolic pressure to drop point septicemia and septic shock a severe infection called septicemia may lead to hypotension septicemia occurs when an infection enters the bloodstream and spread throughout the body a the heart work extra hard to pump blood throughout the body it start to weaken and blood pressure drop when blood pressure drop to dangerously low level the condition is called septic shock feb http quranfruitzblogspotcom causesoflowbloodpressurehypotensionhtml

looknsee photography wrote when i wa living in the bay area california i had scheduled a session week in advance the day before the session wa the hottest day of the year it hit i didnt have a c just a ceiling fan i called the model the day before asked her whether she wanted to reschedule but she wanted to go ahead with the session during the session it wa exceedingly hot and the ceiling fan wasnt really helping much she wa posing nude and about minute into the hour session she wa acting dizzy i had a nightmare vision of a nude model fainting on me so i called it a day i made her sit drink some ice cold orange juice gave her a damp hand towel and made sure she got back to talking in full sentence then i sent her on her way back home her car had a c for the record i paid her in full it wa scary i am a survivor of a congenital heart valve problem ive suffered congestive heart failure and heat is not good for me extreme cold or high elevation are not either for that matter although im a fighter doing paper work sorting at my hospital bedside so that my sister to mail off the proof from a wedding i shot for example i have had to cancel a shoot hour in advance before and i nearly fainted during a shoot due to the warm weather and not enough hydration so i drank enough water until i felt i could continue the model were a couple and they were understanding im fortunate to live in the central coast area and have stanford hospital near by jul http wwwmodelmayhemcom forum post post

posted by christian goodman a new study reveals a devastating fact if youve been following dietary guideline for high blood pressure from the u food and drug administration or american heart association cutting down on one ingredient according to their guideline something almost nobody question will lead to stroke heart attack and death even if you succeed in lowering your blood pressure many organization including the u food and drug administration and the american heart association have warned that a high sodium intake cause high blood pressure accordingly the official dietary guideline set by the u department of health and human service and the u department of agriculture state that people should eat no more than milligram or gram of sodium per day and that they should keep it well below this if possible many researcher have now started questioning this recommendation the largest recent study of this kind wa recently published in the new england journal of medicine the scientist collected the information of more than people daily sodium consumption throughout the world by looking at the amount of sodium excreted in their urine they also collected those same people blood pressure reading their finding a large majority of those people who consumed or more gram of sodium per day had high blood pressure from this they concluded that such a massive sodium intake clearly caused high blood pressure a only a moderate number of people with a daily sodium intake between and gram suffered from high blood pressure they concluded that the relationship between sodium intake and blood pressure wa weaker for this group but that there wa still a relationship for the low intake group below three gram per day they found no relationship between sodium and blood pressure instead of falling a the popular theory would suggest these people blood pressure score were completely random this show that low sodium diet do not lower blood pressure this wa however not the study most interesting finding after following the participant for an average of year they discovered this of those who consumed le than three gram of daily sodium either died developed heart failure or suffered a heart attack or stroke with an intake between three and six gram experienced these outcome with an intake between six and seven gram did with an intake above seven gram did that is those with the lowest sodium consumption consistent with governmental guideline were the most likely to die and suffer harmful cardiovascular event perhaps this should not be surprising sodium is an essential mineral sodium is critical for all of this maintains normal blood pressure and blood volume generates nerve impulse for normal nerve function contributes to muscle contraction help to balance electrolyte play a part in the metabolic process that supply you with energy ensures that your body maintains a good balance between retaining necessary water and dumping surplus water another interesting finding wa that people with a high sodium intake were le likely to have high blood pressure if they also consumed plenty of potassium repeated study have in fact proven that loading up on foodbased potassium is more important than cutting out salt so stock up on dark leafy green white bean salmon squash avocado and banana and then you can add your healthy himalayan pink salt to your food if you like regardless of how much salt you consume if your blood pressure is high you must take action to lower it feb http blueheronhealthnewscom site by steven reinberg healthday reporter monday march healthday news keeping track of your blood pressure at home may provide a better indicator of your risk for heart disease and stroke than waiting to have it taken by your doctor japanese researcher report the study found the risk for heart disease and stroke wa greater for patient whose morning systolic blood pressure the top number measured at home wa mm hg compared with reading of le than mm hg in clinical practice morning home blood pressure may predict heart disease and stroke better than office blood pressure and be more effective in managing high blood pressure said lead researcher dr kazuomi kario he a professor and chairman of the division of cardiovascular medicine at jichi medical university school of medicine in tochigi japan few report have investigated the predictive ability of home blood pressure for heart disease and stroke kario said this largest home blood pressure study is the first to demonstrate that morning home blood pressure may be superior to clinic pressure he said for the study kario and his colleague followed more than patient with high blood pressure for a little over two year the mean age of the study volunteer wa during the study followup patient had stroke and developed heart problem the finding showed stroke were significantly higher among those patient with a morning home systolic blood pressure of mm hg or higher compared to those patient whose systolic blood pressure wa le than mm hg the comparable number for stroke risk measured in a doctor office were and higher and le than respectively the researcher found the risk for heart disease wa also higher among patient whose athome systolic blood pressure wa over mm hg compared to those who had blood pressure of mm hg or le at home for the inoffice reading risk for heart disease wa greater when blood pressure wa or higher compared to le than the investigator found the report wa published online march in the journal of the american college of cardiology elevated blood pressure remains a leading cause of stroke heart attack heart failure kidney failure and premature death said dr gregg fonarow he a professor of cardiology at the university of california los angeles and a spokesman for the american heart association taking your blood pressure at home is relatively simple using a blood pressure measuring device device are available in drugstore and other store and range in price from around to more than the american heart association aha recommends an automatic cuffstyle upperarm monitor for use at home wrist and finger monitor are not recommended because they yield le reliable reading monitor for the elderly or pregnant woman should be validated specifically for those purpose and be sure the cuff fit properly the association say blood pressure responds to many factor and will vary throughout the day so a single high blood pressure reading is not an immediate cause for alarm the aha point out but if you get a high reading you should take your blood pressure several more time and consult your doctor to make sure you dont have a problem and that your monitor is working properly the heart group recommends controlling your blood pressure should be a partnership between you and your doctor the aha suggests taking your blood pressure at home is one step and should be done with the advice and help of your doctor there is increasing interest and guideline recommendation toward using blood pressure reading taken at home to as risk and guide treatment of hypertension high blood pressure fonarow said the lower the morning home blood pressure reading the better the outcome he explained men and woman with a morning systolic blood pressure reading of le than mm hg had the lowest rate of cardiac event and stroke fonarow said this study lends further support for integrating morning home blood pressure reading a a component of the routine clinical assessment and treatment of high blood pressure he added more information for more about blood pressure and why it important visit the american heart association mar http newshealthcom according to new york time columnist professor and physician aaron e carroll few thing to improve your health and fitness level provide a much benefit a physical activity in the academy of medical royal college out a report calling exercise a miracle cure randomized controlled trial examined the effect of exercise therapy on outcome in people with chronic disease researcher found trial looking specifically at the effect of exercise in pain and function of patient with osteoarthritis of the knee alone exercise improved those outcome ten more study showed over all that exercise therapy increase aerobic capacity and muscle strength in patient with rheumatoid arthritis for people mostly middle aged men who had a heart attack exercise her apt reduced all cause of mortality by percent and cardiac mortality by percent fourteen additional study showed physiological benefit in those with heart failure exercise ha also been shown to lower blood pressure in patient with hydrate soon and improve cholesterol and triglyceride level twenty randomized controll d trial have showed that patient with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease can walk farther and function better if they exercise multiple study have found that exercise improves physical function and health related quality of life in people who have parkinson disease six more study showed that exercise improves muscle power and mobility related activity in people with multiple sclerosis mr carroll went on to mention his own struggle with maintaining an active lifestyle which resulted in him trying a few workout program that didnt seem to work for him he decided to scale it back and started walking more in an attempt to complete the recommended minute of exercise in one week he walked to lunch and when cold outside he used the elliptical machine each totaling minute i strongly encourage reader to take from this article what relates to their individual situation and use it to motivate you failing at exercise is inevitable so do not base your entire fitness program on result from one or two workout trend or fad instead work with a professional fitness instructor to develop a program specifically for you and what you enjoy doing a exercise your body need some form of resistance training in order to truly maximize weight loss or improve your over all health you can use light weight or even body weight regardless do not settle for a routine that only includes cardio however yes i agree with the author when he say anything is better than doing nothing at all jun http eliteathletictrainingblogspotcom a little more than a year ago my colleague and i started the streetcred police killing in context data project there were already several project tracking police shooting including fatal encounter and new project at the washington post and the guardian but we felt that they left out crucial context why did the police become involved in these incident in the first place wa their use of force something that most people would consider reasonable such a the police response after mohammad youssef abdulazeez opened fire on military personnel at a chattanooga tenn recruiting station or wa it unreasonable a with the shameful killing of walter scott the most common criticism i received wa that it wa an attempt to demonstrate that police arent the problem im a white texas cop so thats not an unreasonable presumption but i hope youll see that what we found can steer the conversation toward more productive and meaningful reform we began a others did with the fatal encounter database where the post pulitzer prizewinning effort focused on police shooting we focused on all policerelated death and where the guardian included killing by for example prison guard or traffic accident or personal dispute between officer we focused only on official act on or offduty by police officer ultimately we gathered more than contextual data point from the mundane middle name to the specific if the person wa listed a mentally ill wa it a previously diagnosed serious mental illness or merely suspected we eventually identified case in which unarmed civilian had died after an encounter with police in we now had a wealth of contextual data that we believed could add a lot to the ongoing dialogue about police shooting we think the context for these shooting transcends both race and politics we have assembled our finding in a book in context understanding police killing of unarmed civilian which we believe is instructive for activist police officer and useofforce trainer the context behind these shooting can also help reader understand how police and trainer approach these case and the applicable law they use to determine when different level of force are justified we tried to be objective but true objectivity is of course impossible everyone ha inherent bias instead weve tried to be a open and transparent a we can we included more than sourcefootnotes in the book a well a an open update system to track when we got something wrong the data methodology and schema on which we based our conclusion are all open and available under the creative common share alike license so please feel free to check our work from my interpretation of the data there are some relatively easy change police and policymakers can make that will go a long way toward improving policing in the united state here are what you might call the lowhanging fruit police must release more data and do it sooner when agency delay public suspicion and speculation fill the void every time police choose transparency it a deposit in the bank of goodwill it build community trust la vega ha shown that a police department can be transparent and forthcoming after a police shooting without disrupting the integrity of the investigation honesty begin with a timely release of the earliest available information that might include a timeline recording of call a narrative and any video without video or call the public ha nothing but the word of the police and a we have seen police do sometimes lie not always not even a lot according to our research but consider the walter scott shooting and the apparent lie told by officer michael slager a highprofile case like that can quickly make citizen lose faith in the system sunlight is the best disinfectant while the medium and activist group often focus on race the data show a greater disparity in deadly engagement with drug addict and the mentally ill in nearly half percent of the death of unarmed civilian after a police encounter involved someone suffering from serious mental illness overdosing on drug or both we tend to think of both mental health and drug addiction to be issue at the margin of society these issue need far more social legal and policy attention than theyre getting one approach gaining popularity is the memphis model crisis intervention team cit for first responder under the cit model police officer are trained how to recognize the symptom of a mental illness crisis how to communicate with people experiencing a mental health crisis and how to intervene without escalating the model ha been widely praised and should continue to be adopted around the country but it is clear that the problem is bigger than just crisis management the work need to start before a mentally ill person go into crisis in the first place were also seeing new program to address that problem with promising result a program in the midcities between dallas and fort worth for example ha been successful in training cop on new way to liaise with the mentally ill by focusing on wellness check in addition to crisis management the area ha seen a reduction in acute mental health crisis hospitalization such creative program stress regular visit and include outreach to friend and family it a really smart way to work it save life and money and arguably make the community more strongly supportive of all it resident many state police academy have also been adding more training in mental health and disability in my opinion we need more of these program and with an even broader focus but even with new training we must remember that the police should be the last line of defense from mentally ill people who potentially pose a threat to the community instead police are too often the first the federal government ha long passed the buck on mental health to the state under both democratic and republican administration state government have also dropped the ball mental illness is a societywide issue it cant just be a police issue the buck can be passed down but cop cant pa the buck back up and if we are going to insist on asking cop to respond to mentalhealth crisis the least we can do is give them the proper training and support look at all disability not just mental illness when we add physical disability such a pulmonary emphysema enlarged heart hypertensive or atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease thyroid disorder to that statistic the number of unarmed citizen who died after a police encounter suffering from drug mental illness and or physical disability is percent that of course is more than half we need to consider a a society the effect our national healthcare policy can have on policing we also need to be make sure police are properly trained to interact with people with disability such a deafness or autism health care and policing arent unrelated issue cop alone cant change this it should be part of the larger conversation among activist healthcare professional journalist and law enforcement leader while it true that fixing the american healthcare system isnt exactly lowhanging fruit one fix that would go a long way is better coordination among police healthcare provider and advocacy group for people with disability the american with disability act isnt a suggestion it a mandate it time our society face the fact that when it come to the cop it cannot be a mandate that is unfunded and unsupported we need more police video but it must be used correctly video wa available only in percent of the case in which an unarmed person died after an encounter with police in two case eyewitnessshot video wa crucial in showing that officer had lied to investigator in two other case video exonerated officer but in all four of these case the video wa taken by bystander or surveillance camera not by policeoperated video here another metric first observed by san jose independent police auditor walter katz last year there were zero indictment of police officer in case that did not involve video in every case in which an officer wa indicted video wa available and became an important part of the evidence supporting indictment thats an important metric we need more officer video in more place right now i believe proliferation of body and dashcam camera will mostly demonstrate that police usually get it right and perform their job with professionalism but it will also show when we are at our worst that too is important i am a strong proponent of bodyworn video but it not a easy a merely handing out the camera a weve already seen there are significant challenge to developing practical policy and procedure that bring transparency while still protecting citizen privacy and police officer due process rankandfile officer union representative where appropriate and community leader and activist should be consulted during the policybuilding process so that there are no surprise sometimes policy can be counterintuitive for a truly surprising read have a look at the how the los angeles sheriff department handled the thorny issue of whether officer should be permitted to view video before writing their report there are also logistical technological and financial barrier that need hashing out death in police custody arent always from shooting police shooting get most of the medium coverage but in nearly half of the case in which cop killed an unarmed citizen in no shot were fired at all the decedent wa killed in another manner in most of these case autopsy report found that the deceased had an abnormal reaction or complication after officer deployed tool or technique with the intent of using of nondeadly force such a stun gun or chemical spray many of these case include the drugrelated mentalhealthrelated death described previously a well a other incident in which decedent with chronic health condition or a physical disability attacked or resisted officer or others in of the case percent in which there were shooting officer deployed a taser prior to shooting to my colleague and me this is a good indication that officer were attempting to subdue suspect who ultimately died by first using nondeadly force that would be consistent with current best practice that conclusion ha frustrated some observer because activist and reformer have pointed to tasers a weapon that cause too many death part of the problem is that there a lot of confusion in the general public about a weapon potential to cause death and whether it should be considered deadly force by law practice and training without devolving into a festival of scholarly citation the law is quite clear about this deadly force is force that pose a significant risk of death or serious bodily injury legal expert have tended to agree that significant risk mean more likely than not some people have indeed died proximate to taser exposure but the number are very small independent nontaserfunded research ha repeatedly shown that the percentage of people exposed to a taser who die soon after that exposure is minuscule and even among those case it difficult to establish a causal link see for example this arizona state university study or this nij study there have been million of taser exposure and very few death in definition and in practice taser is nondeadly force our data show that in nearly a third of the case in which officer used deadly force they first attempted nondeadly force yes there have been awful example of taserproximate injury suffered when an officer used the weapon not because a suspect wa fighting but to gain control or out of anger that is generally a fireable offense and sometimes a criminal act but thats a separate issue from the case my team studied in which police officer faced a real threat and deployed a taser to stop a potentially deadly incident by using nondeadly force consider if you will the death of omar lopez last year lopez had been fighting a passenger on the septum train in philadelphia when a police officer intervened lopez bit and violently fought with the officer the officer armed with a sig sauer pistol and a baton continued to struggle and ultimately used his taser alone lopez died but the autopsy showed his cause of death to be an overdose of pcp that officer like officer in many of the incident we studied showed tremendous restraint when we credit officer who first opt for nondeadly force others are le likely to reach first for their gun i think reasonable people would agree each of these reform is individually actionable none is dependent on the others and few seem all that divisive or controversial with a couple of exception the solution for each is relatively inexpensive relatively uncomplicated and relatively understandable once we can see beyond the how many of policeinvolved killing and look instead to the why we can start to have meaningful conversation about how to reduce them http wwwwashingtonpostcom news thewatch wp indication of the health credential of a person overall diet researcher obtained data on more than people diet from the national health and nutrition examination survey nhanes result showed that people who regularly ate grape and nonalcoholic grape product such a raisin and grape juice typically had healthier dietary pattern and better nutrient intake than those who did not grape consumer warning sign can vary wildly between men and woman both men and woman can experience chest pain when they are having a heart attack but other symptom can significantly vary according to the university of alabama dr joseph fritz if you think of someone having a heart attack chance are you will picture a scene where a man gasp clutch his chest and fall to the ground but in reality a heart attack victim could easily be a woman and the scene not be so dramatic while men and woman share some of the same symptom the university of alabama dr joseph fritz explains they can also have wildly different one both men and woman can suffer chest tightness and pain or pressure in the chest neck jaw arm or back unusual fatigue shortness of breath coughing feeling sick and vomiting are among the unpleasant symptom experienced by both gender other major symptom for men include weakness breaking out into a cold sweat dizziness major symptom for woman include sleep disturbance indigestion anxiety however dr fritz also urged people to remember each heart attack is different and symptom may not always exactly fit the mould never ignore any possible symptom of a heart attack and get medical attention immediately woman heart attack symptom can include indigestion and sleep disturbance which can be mistaken for sign of something else woman are likely than men to die within a year of their first attack woman are more likely than men to die within a year of their first heart attack according to the american heart association that is because while both gender experience chest pain a the primary symptom woman often have atypical vague symptom a well such a back or jaw pain nausea or a sense of dread earlier this year dr laxmi mehta of ohio state university said these symptom can be very challenging for the patient and the medical profession woman tend to under recognise or deny them when they do present to the emergency department it is important for these symptom to be triaged appropriately a potential heart problem otherwise the consequence are misdiagnosis delayed treatment and higher death rate even thing considered more minor health problem such a sexual health bleeding gum and even snoring could be a sign of poor heart health when the heart and artery begin to fail symptom manifest in otherwise unrelated part in the body revealed dr john erwin a cardiologist from texas am health science center dr erwin revealed six of the most common and most surprising symptom of heart disease that people need to be aware of keeping an eye out for these problem can lead to earlier detection of the disease and help save life symptom sexual dysfunction many people think of sexual dysfunction a a problem of the reproductive organ or the brain however especially in male sexual dysfunction is a common symptom of arterial disease erectile dysfunction is typically thought to be a problem of the brain or reproductive system however it can also occur because of a buildup of plaque in the artery which can lead to cardiovascular disease a buildup of plaque in the artery can cause men to have a hard time achieving or maintaining erection but for woman a drop in libido usually signal a postmenopausal state yet woman who are postmenopausal rapidly increase their risk factor for developing heart disease menopause itself doesnt cause cardiovascular disease dr erwin said while menopause doesnt cause cardiovascular disease certain hearthealth risk like change in blood pressure and cholesterol level begin around the time of menopause furthermore many woman develop a more sedentary lifestyle in that phase of their life a a result this symptom should not be ignored symptom snoring or sleep apnea few thing are more frustrating in life than trying to sleep next to a snoring person however on top of the annoyance of snoring dr erwin revealed it can actually be a sign of heart disease snoring is a common sign of sleep apnea a is morning sleepiness after a full night sleep dr erwin said sleep apnea period of time during sleep where you stop breathing is associated with many physiological change that increase the risk of both heart attack and stroke snoring may be annoying but it is a symptom of sleep apnea which can often signify heart disease snoring can also be a sign of atrial fibrillation which is an irregular often rapid heart rate that cause poor blood flow therefore detection and treatment of sleep apnea can lower a person risk of heart problem so next time you hear the person next to you snoring perhaps suggest they see a doctor instead of just complaining about the noise symptom bleeding sore or swollen gum few people would ever think that gum problem could be linked to heart disease however unhealthy gum are a symptom of periodontis that is a serious gum infection that damage the gum and can destroy the jawbone periodontis can actually lead to an increase in inflammation across the body according to dr erwein and overactivity of inflammatory pathway is a strong risk factor for the development of atherosclerotic heart disease and heart attack thus it recommended that people follow up regularly with their dentist for oral hygiene they should also regularly brush and floss their teeth symptom shoulder or neck constriction or aching many people feel like an elephant is sitting on their chest during a heart attack and many others experience a squeezing sensation in their arm however not all people go through those classic heart attack feeling constriction or aching in the shoulder or neck or swollen and bleeding gum may appear to be minor health problem but in reality they can be symptom of heart disease and should be checked out by a doctor instead many heart attack sufferer feel an uncomfortable sensation achiness pain or pressure in their neck jaw or shoulder for some that discomfort is the only sign of heart pain or a heart attack symptom puffy foot and leg foot and leg can swell for a variety of reason including something a minor a heat however puffy leg and foot can also be a marker of congestive heart failure thats particularly true in case where a person ha unusual shortness of breath with activity or when trying to sleep while it also true that some swelling occurs naturally throughout the day and tends to resolve overnight persistent swelling is problematic people who have constant or worsening swelling of the foot or leg should see a doctor for an evaluation of heart failure symptom indigestion or heartburn heartburn and indigestion are quite common and rarely serious but in some instance those seemingly benign burning or aching sensation in the upper abdomen can be a sign of heart pain or heart attack additionally persistent gastrointestinal distress such a intractable hiccup can also be a precursor and so when heartburn indigestion or hiccup are mixed with nausea sweating shortness of breath or lightheadedness people should seek medical attention dr erwin said it not uncommon to see people come into the emergency room after chewing on antacid for hour before they realize the pain is something more written by kate selenium is a trace element and mineral that is essential for human life it is critical to many of our basic physiological function including protecting cell from oxidative stress and helping the thyroid produce hormone it is found in many seleniumrich fruit and vegetable and some animal product to say that selenium is important is an understatement low selenium level are actually linked to condition such a keshan disease heart disease and infertility let look at what selenium mean to your health selenium is a powerful antioxidant selenium work a a powerful antioxidant in the body antioxidant are substance that slow or prevent cell damage by neutralizing free radical selenium protects against free radical and oxidative stress it an active immunomodulator and a more potent antioxidant than vitamin a c or e selenium combine with other protein to create selenoproteins such a glutathione peroxidase and thioredoxin reductase these protein act a antioxidant to support health at the cellular level thyroid support the thyroid is a gland in the throat that produce hormone the hormone produced by the thyroid affect growth and metabolic process compared to other tissue in the human body the thyroid contains the most selenium per gram like iodine selenium play an important role in the synthesis of thyroid hormone there have been many study on selenium and thyroid disease often with mixed or contradictory result one study linked low selenium level to thyroid problem in the elderly unfortunately in that instance selenium supplementation did little to help however another study found that selenium supplementation during pregnancy reduced hypothyroidism and inflammation yet another study found selenium supplementation decrease the negative effect of hashimotos thyroiditis more research is needed to draw conclusion but the potential of selenium a it relates to thyroid health is encouraging antiaging property of selenium free radical damage cause the cellular degeneration we know a aging a a powerful antioxidant selenium neutralizes the damaging effect of free radical one study revealed that selenium level decline with age and low selenium contributes to cognitive decline in older adult there is great interest in determining whether selenium supplementation can slow agerelated mental impairment hopefully we learn more soon encourages metal detoxification metal are among the most toxic of pollutant effective way to detoxify the body of toxic metal are few and far between the good news data suggests that supplementing with organic carbonbound selenium support mercury excretion cardiovascular support it clear that there is a relationship between selenium concentration and cardiovascular health some heart attack patient show low selenium level and incidence of heart failure caused by selenium deficiency have been reported since a early a not only is selenium itself important for cardiovascular support it work with other nutrient such a vitamin e and betacarotene to help promote normal cholesterol level reproductive health selenium is critical for both male and female reproductive health it enables sperm locomotion and a selenium deficiency can lead to male infertility study have found that low selenium can also have a negative impact on female fertility and fetal growth there seems to be a link between selenium deficiency and miscarriage but more research is necessary to determine the exact mechanism selenium and cancer study have observed a trend in which lower concentration of selenium correlated with an increased risk of certain type of cancer although this is an interesting tidbit of information it shouldnt be interpreted a an implication that selenium is a treatment or method of prevention for cancer while selenium ha many benefit there is not conclusive evidence to call it a viable treatment option how selenium benefit your health we do know that selenium is an essential mineral thats crucial to many bodily function natural source like fruit and vegetable are the best way to incorporate selenium into your diet selenium supplementation may also be appropriate for people who are experiencing a selenium deficiency if youre concerned that youre not getting enough selenium talk to your nutritionist and see if selenium supplementation is right for you reference office of dietary reuters a stem cell therapy developed by vericel corp helped reduce death and hospitalization in advanced heart failure patient according to data from a midstage study potentially providing a treatment that could delay the need for heart transplant the data compared vericels bone marrowderived ixmyelocelt stem cell with placebo in welltreated patient with advanced ischemic heart failure who had exhausted optimal medical and device therapy after one year the vericel treatment led to a percent reduction versus placebo in a composite of adverse event that included death heartrelated hospitalization and unplanned clinic visit related to heart failure vericel last month reported that the study succeeded detailed result were unveiled on monday at the american college of cardiology scientific meeting in chicago and in the lancet medical journal the result wa primarily driven by the difference in death of percent in the placebo group or death compared with percent or death for those who received ixmyelocelt therapy in addition percent of stem cell patient required hospitalization versus percent for the placebo group this is strong evidence in a welldesigned trial that we can decrease event said dr timothy henry the study lead investigator and chief of cardiology at cedar sinai heart institute in los angeles for patient this is a really hopeful thing the stem cell treatment failed to lead to a significant improvement in heart pumping efficiency or sixminute walking distance which were among secondary goal of the trial henry who presented the data at the acc meeting stressed the need for larger trial to prove the benefit of ixmyelocelt for the treatment bone marrow is taken from the patient and enhanced over two week to increase two type of cell associated with healing they are then injected directly into the patient heart with advanced heart failure a leading cause of hospitalization bloodpumping ability is diminished a the heart left ventricle becomes enlarged and weakened virtually all those in the study were taking medicine to lower cholesterol and blood pressure and had an implantable device to regulate heart rhythm if the disease worsens despite all available medicinal and interventional therapy the only option are heart transplant or a pumping assist device the idea is to find a treatment for this group of people before they get to that stage henry said editing by bernadette baum apr http wwwchannelnewsasiacom news health vericelstemcelltherapy htmlcidcnaflip

nocturia is a frequent urge to urinate frequent urination at night so it make people have to wake up several time during sleep at night nocturia is different from enuresis which in enuresis urination occurs unconsciously during sleep or in everyday term is often referred to a the wetting nocturia is one of the common cause of sleep disorder and usually experienced by people who are elderly nearly twothirds of adult aged to year of experience nocturia for a few night each week although nocturia generally occur in people who are elderly but basically nocturia could happen to anyone whether male or female old or young nocturia a relatively light will cause the person experiencing woke up at least time throughout the night for nocturia were classified a severe usually will cause those who experience awakened a much a to time a night the impact in addition to disrupt the quality of sleep nocturia especially those classified a heavy will lead to other complaint such a dizziness drowsiness and fatigue the next day and even depression cause of nocturia the cause of nocturia in woman and men are usually different woman generally experience nocturia a a consequence of childbirth menopause and uterine prolapse descent of the uterus or also called down while in men nocturia can be caused by enlargement of the prostate other cause of nocturia is likely due to the use of medication especially those that are diuretic and may also be due to health problem such a heart failure diabetes urinary tract infection infection cause a burning sensation and desire for frequent urination all day and night high blood pressure liver disorder sleep apnea syndrome oab overactive bladder kidney infection tumor of the bladder prostate or pelvic area and a a result of neurological disorder such a multiple sclerosis m and parkinson some case of nocturia are also caused or exacerbated by excessive fluid intake after dinner especially fluid from beverage containing caffeine and alcohol which is a diuretic while the elderly nocturia occurs because the elderly le body produce antidiuretic hormone a hormone that is useful to hold urine urine along with age antidiuretic hormone level in the body will decrease and with the decreasing level of antidiuretic hormone then your kidney produce more urine at night and thus the frequency of urination will increase in addition nocturia may also be due to the decreased ability to accommodate the urinary bladder where it is usually also influenced by health condition ha also decreased in the elderly older which in turn influence bladder function and the ability to accommodate and hold urine jun http wwwphilpotforcongresscom whatisnocturia

star and president pay homage to mr reagan at presidential library posted friday march pm hollywood star and political powerbroker past and present gathered to hear glowing tribute to former first lady nancy reagan before her burial beside her husband at the reagan presidential library friday reagan died on sunday of heart failure at the age of at her home in the bel air suburb of los angeles year after ronald reagan who served two term in the white house in the s representative of presidential family stretching back to the kennedy attended with first lady michelle obama and former first lady and exsecretary of state hillary clinton joining former president george w bush in the front row james baker chief of staff under reagan and george hw bush described nancy a a woman without whom ronald wilson reagan would never have become the th president of the united state or succeeded a well a he did she had an instinct for reading people that the president knew he lacked nancy he wrote see the goodness in people but she also had an extra instinct that allowed her to see the flaw baker said the reagan were former actor and many of the s hollywood glitterati including thensex symbol bo derek oscar winner anjelica huston magnum pi actor tom selleck and the ateams mr t were were expected among around guest who began arriving under sunny sky several hour ahead of the ceremony the former first lady funeral opened with a musical prelude by the santa susana high school advanced woman choir and abbe road a cappella and an instrumental section by the first marine division band marine corp camp pendleton love letter stuart kenworthy the vicar of washington national cathedral presided over the minute program which opened with battle hymn of the republic and included rendition of ave maria and pie jesu by soprano ana maria martinez the reagan wrote passionate love note to each other over the decade and former canadian prime minister brian mulroney read out a letter the president wrote to nancy on their first christmas in the white house in reagan quote from sonnet elizabeth barrett browning love letter to her future husband the poet robert browning better known by it opening line how do i love thee let me count the way for me there is no way to count i love the whole gang of you mommy first lady the sentimental you the fun you and the peewee powerhouse you reagan wrote a fierce protector of her husband and his political legacy reagan had outsized influence during their white house year from to the couple wed in after ronald divorced his first wife actress jane wyman the marriage ha been described a a love story to rival any that the couple acted out on the silver screen the pair had two child patti davis born in and ron junior born in both of whom delivered eulogy that along with a tribute from former nbc news anchor tom brokaw had the guest laughing at fondly recounted anecdote challenging relationship davis wa also searingly honest about her memory of her mother recalling a challenging and often contentious relationship when i wa a child i imagined having warm comfortable conversation with her the kind of conversation that feel like lamp light the reality wa far different she said i tried her patience and she intimidated me we were never mild with one another while in the white house nancy reagan actively participated in her husband campaign approved member of the president cabinet and wa the face of the administration just say no drug campaign ronald reagan suffered from alzheimers disease after leaving office and went into a long decline his wife took care of him until his death and became a tireless advocate for alzheimers research president barack obama and his wife praised nancy reagan proud example in a statement after her death saying she redefined the role of first lady a a mark of respect obama ordered that flag be flown at halfstaff at federal building military post u naval vessel and diplomatic mission until sunset friday spcft pst mar http bhcouriercom starsandpresidentspayhomagetomrsreaganatpresidentiallibrary

originally posted on common medicine including cold and flu tablet heartburn drug and sleeping pill shrink the brain and slow down thinking dr leonard coldwellcom ingredient promethazine and diphenhydramine slowed brain function block chemical acetylcholine involved in transmitting electrical impulse researcher said the drug had an effect for a month after treatment a full list of implicated medication can be viewed at ageing brain care or scroll down for a full list of the medication listed in the study common overthecounter medicine should be avoided by older people a they have been linked to memory loss and problem in thinking scientist have discovered treatment for cold and flu hay fever allergy and heartburn tablet containing anticholinergic drug had the effect for one month after treatment a study found effect associated with taking the drug included having slower brain processing time and smaller brain overall well known treatment including the heartburn medicine zantac night nurse liquid containing promethazine and the sleeping tablet nytol containing diphenhydramine are included among drug that may result in the effect the research said over the counter treatment for cold flu heartburn and sleeping tablet were found to block the chemical acetylcholine which is involved in the transmission of electrical impulse between nerve cell the drug block the chemical acetylcholine which is involved in the transmission of electrical impulse between nerve cell the treatment are prescribed for a wide range of condition including parkinson disease overactive bladder chronic obstructive pulmonary disease nausea and vomiting sleeping problem high blood pressure depression and psychosis but the author warn use of ac anticholinergic medication among older adult should likely be discouraged if alternative therapy are available previous study have linked the drug with cognitive impairment increased risk of dementia and fall however the new study by indiana university school of medicine is the first to explore their impact on brain metabolism and atrophy through brain scan dr shannon risacher the university assistant professor of radiology and imaging science said these finding provide u with a much better understanding of how this class of drug may act upon the brain in way that might raise the risk of cognitive impairment and dementia given all the research evidence physician might want to consider alternative to anticholinergic medication if available when working with their older patient the impact of these drug have been know about for over a decade with a study finding drug with a strong anticholinergic effect cause cognitive problem when taken continuously for a few a day drug with a weaker effect could cause impairment within day many over the counter medicine have been linked to slower brain processing time and smaller brain the new study involved participant of whom were taking at least one medication with medium or high anticholinergic activity the participant were drawn from a national alzheimers research project the alzheimers disease neuroimaging initiative and the indiana memory and ageing study to identify possible physical and physiological change that could be associated with the reported effect researcher assessed the result of memory and other cognitive test positron emission test pet measuring brain metabolism and magnetic resonance imaging mri scan for brain structure patient taking anticholinergic drug performed worse than older adult not taking the drug on shortterm memory and some test of executive function which cover a range of activity such a verbal reasoning planning and problem solving anticholinergic drug user also showed lower level of glucose metabolism a biomarker for brain activity in both the overall brain and in the hippocampus a region of the brain associated with memory and which ha been identified a affected early by alzheimers disease the researcher also found significant link between brain structure revealed by the mri scan and anticholinergic drug use with the participant using anticholinergic drug having reduced brain volume and larger ventricle the cavity inside the brain professor risacher added these finding might give u clue to the biological basis for the cognitive problem associated with anticholinergic drug but additional study are needed if we are to truly understand the mechanism involved the study wa published in the journal jama neurology john smith chief executive of the proprietary association of great britain which represents maker of over the counter medicine said the medicine linked to the study were not intended to be used on a daily basis anticholinergic medicine include some overthecounter allergy and cold and flu product however they are intended for short term relief of symptom only he said it is important to note that the jama study only involved people with a mean age of in what the researcher conceded wa a small sample the study followed people who took medicine that were low medium or high in anticholinergic activity and concluded that the use of medication with medium or high anticholinergic activity should be discouraged in older adult if alternative therapy are available however due to the study limitation the researcher propose that further and more advanced study are needed anticholinergic medicine include some overthecounter allergy and cold and flu product but these are intended for short term relief of symptom and not for continuous use a in the research if anyone ha any concern about their medicine we would advise them to talk to their pharmacist there is a range of different allergy cold and flu product on the market which contain different ingredient many of which were not considered in this study and a pharmacist will be able to recommend a suitable product all overthecounter medicine in the uk have been approved by the medicine and healthcare product regulatory agency mhra and are rigorously assessed for safety and efficacy once on the market their safety is continually monitored in light of any emerging evidence full list of implicated description cardiac arrhythmia and heart failure remain the killer without effective drug therapy despite decade of research why the heart is a dynamic organ the cardiomyocytes excitationcontraction is controlled by dynamic system the electrical the ca signaling and the contractile system previous research and drug development often targeted a single molecule or a single system however because of the feedback interaction between these nonlinear dynamic system a change in one system can engender unexpected change in all system causing the drug effect to be unpredictable we envision that development of effective antiarrhythmic drug therapy require a paradigmatic shift from targeting a single molecule or a single system to a new strategy that embrace the integrated behaviour of the dynamical system our interdisciplinary team combine modelling with experimental investigation using molecular and cellular cardiology chemistry physic and mathematics to advance research in aspect developing innovative technology studying the fundamental mechanism of mechanochemoelectrotransduction in cardiac muscle developing new drug therapy to combat heart disease http wwwbmeucdavisedu izulab tag published tue feb est feb http youtubecom watchvqbelvjfeugq

for smoker smoked cigarette can be done at any time morning afternoon and night but did you know that smoking at night can disrupt and make sleep soundly cigarette not only make people le sleep but is also responsible for changing the pattern of sleep that make sleep wa not restful smoking can interfere with sleep in many way the most dramatic effect of smoking is the reduction of time spent sleeping in which is known to create a fresh feeling when you wake up in the morning in the journal chest reported that chronic smoker spend more time sleeping lightly do not sleep soundly especially in the early part of the night a reported by livestrong the culprit is nicotine which ha a stimulating effect on the nervous system ironically because the nicotine in the bloodstream is reduced throughout the night the withdrawal symptom increased symptom include anxiety and insomnia difficulty sleeping smoking is also a risk factor for sleep disorder dangerous known a obstructive sleep apnea osa according to the mayo clinic smoker are three time more likely to suffer from osa compared to people who never smoked during osa the airway will be narrowed or blocked preventing enough oxygen from reaching the brain during sleep snoring very loud and woke gasping are two common symptom of osa which if left untreated can lead to pulmonary hypertension heart failure and premature death smoking increase the risk for osa because the habit irritate the lining of the throat and cause clogged at night the good news quit smoking immediately can improve sleep health mar http yuukamaedablogspotcom smokingatnightcanmakesleepnothtml

some of the following fooddrug interaction need to be avoided while on med coffee avoid if you take bronchodilator for asthma these help patient to breathe more easily by relaxing the muscle in the lung and widening airway common side effect of these include palpitation nervousness and excitability when mixed with caffeine these risk are increasedtoo much caffeine can also limit their effectiveness in an emergency so speak to your gp if you are taking them but need caffeine too banana avoid if you take blood pressure medicine banana are high in potassium a good thing but for those taking medication like captopril ace inhibitor or angiotensin receptor blocker avoid large quantity of potassiumrich food like leafy green and orange too mixed with these drug these food can cause high potassium levelswhen consumed in excess it can also cause irregular heartbeat and palpitation it best to inform your gp if youre taking potassium or diuretic alongside blood pressure medication alcohol avoid if you take antihistamine diabetes medicine or painkiller medicine often come with a warning to avoid alcohol this is due to the pressure booze put on your liver alcohol paracetamol and codeine are metabolised by the liver and it will have to work harder to break down alcohol and medication at the same time this can increase the risk of side effect from the medication including drowsiness also overworking your liver can eventually increase your risk of liver damage leafy green avoid if you take anticoagulant leafy green are part of a healthy diet but when youre taking antibloodclotting medicine like warfarin you need to be careful not to suddenly up your leafy green intake they are high in vitamin k and a a result help blood to clot warfarin is designed to prevent the production of vitamin k so if you suddenly eat more green this will interfere with the medicine black liquorice avoid if you take heart medication liquorice lower potassium in your body which can be dangerous for those with certain heart condition low level of potassium can increase side effect associated with digoxin used to treat congestive heart failure and abnormal heart rhythm diuretic to treat high blood pressure glaucoma heart failure and liver and kidney problem also lower potassium so taken with liquorice they cause level to fall this cause weakness cramp and irregular heart rhythm grapefruit avoid if you take statin if you are taking statin to lower blood pressure then grapefruit or it juice wont provide a healthy breakfast grapefruit contains a chemical that stop the body breaking down statin this will lead to raised level in your body which mean you will be at risk of sideeffects patient might experience muscle ache and pain a a result milk avoid if you take antibiotic ciprofloxacin and tetracycline should be taken with a glass of water one hour before a meal or two hour after you have eatenfood will interfere with the way these medication are absorbed by your body and dairy product such a milk will have the same effect so while it might be tempting to take antibiotic with a glass of milk dont lime avoid if you take cough medicine be careful with lime or seville orange if youre taking cough medicine with dextromethorphan citrus food can interfere with the process that break down the drug causing more of it to get in your body this can lead to sideeffects like hallucination or drowsiness the fruit effect can last for hour or more so avoid them while you need the cough medicine smoked salmon avoid if you take antidepressant check with your gp if your antidepressant come under the monoamine oxidase inhibitor maoi category before you indulge in smoked meat such a salami smoked salmon or chicken liver pate the problem is that these food are rich in tyramine a compound caused by the breakdown of amino acid when mixed with maoi it can cause tyramine level to spike leading to dangerously high blood pressureother food on the risk list include strong or aged cheese and other smoked or processed meat and fish apr http drugsinformationsblogspotcom dangerousfooddruginteractionhtml

thursday april healthday news having more muscle and le fat reduces the risk of early death in people with heart disease a new study suggests doctor should encourage patient to do resistance exercise a part of a healthy lifestyle rather than emphasizing and monitoring weight loss the study author advised for the study dr preethi srikanthan of the university of california los angeles and colleague analyzed data gathered from more than american with heart disease the investigator found that people with higher amount of muscle and lower level of body fat were le likely to die of heart problem or any other cause than those in three other group based on body composition the group were low muscle high fat low muscle low fat or high muscle high fat because people with more muscle were more likely to have a high body mass index bmi a measurement based on height and weight the finding could explain whats called the obesity paradox where people with a higher bmi have lower death rate the researcher suggested the study result show the importance of maintaining muscle mass in order to reduce the risk of premature death even in people with a higher heart risk the study author said in a university news release according to the american college of sport medicine resistance training also called strength training can be done with common household product for example milk jug filled with sand or people can use traditional free weight and dumbbell weight machine elastic tubing or medicine ball but consult your doctor before starting any exercise program the expert say the finding were published this month in the american journal of cardiology more information the american academy of family physician ha more on heart failure apr http newshealthcom buildingmusclecouldboostthebodysmostimportantmuscle

segui cimuncol the fda food and drug administration issued an alert last april in which he reported on the risk of heart failure associated with the use of drug used for treating diabetes containing saxagliptin and alogliptin this wa determined based on two study in patient with heart disease clinical trial the result showed a higher number of hospitalization in patient receiving these drug versus placebo patient saxagliptin and alogliptin are indicated in the treatment of type diabetes mellitus since both are inhibitor of dipeptidyl peptidase dpp thus slowing the inactivation of incretin hormone glp and gip glucagonlike peptide and gastric inhibitory peptide respectively which stimulate insulin release from pancreatic cell which regulates glucose homeostasis blood level importantly in patient with type diabetes heart failure is a common complication why it wa vital to establish whether the use of therapeutic agent employed for this pathology reduced or increased adverse effect risk of developing heart failure currently saxagliptin it ha existing health record in colombia while alogliptin both feature are indicated to improve glycemic control in adult with type diabetes mellitus in complement with diet and exercise heart failure is a possible adverse effect reported for saxagliptin while speaking of fulminant hepatic failure to alogliptin based on the above it is recommended that patient taking these drug and heart failure also present see a doctor to as the possible suspension of such drug patient who for any reason must leave the medication without consulting the doctor is highlighted additionally if you have fatigue weakness fatigue shortness of breath unusual shortness of breath or weight gain swollen ankle foot leg or stomach you
