share this article share rory now month ha recovered from the operation and much to his mother delight ha said mama for the first time mr godfrey who work in marketing said his tongue kept growing bigger and bigger it got to the point where he could touch his nose without trying and his mouth wa always in an open position because his tongue wa so large it wa so long and wide that it wa blocking his airway and could have been quite dangerous he would gasp and choke while feeding and then while he slept i could hear him snore and stop breathing it wa quite a frightening time his parent holly and ben were terrified when they heard rory choking while eating and stop breathing she added his tongue wa folding backwards into his mouth and because it wa so long and wide it had no other place to go but to rest in his throat which a choking him every night i heard him struggle for air and wa too scared to go to sleep in case i woke up to a blue baby who had died during the night rorys oversized tongue also meant his jaw wa starting to widen and deform during the operation doctor sliced a large chunk of his tongue off in a wshaped cut before stitching it back together his mother said he wa still very swollen at the time but now he can smile perfectly and put his tongue inside his mouth for the first time he so happy now he more vocal than he wa before and ha definitely compensated for the sound he couldnt make before back then he would try to make an m sound but could never say mama now he can and it pretty amazing it really sweet seeing him progress so much weve been on quite the rollercoaster but now hopefully we are out the other end of it two month ago he went for reduction surgery to slice off part of his tongue and his life ha been transformed rory wa diagnosed with beckwithwiedemann syndrome at three month old after his mother pushed doctor to ascertain why her baby wa struggling to breathe and his tongue wa continuing to grow mr godfrey added a soon a i heard him choke and gasp for air i knew something wa horribly wrong but wa reassured he wa fine i kept pushing for more test to be done and eventually we were referred to a geneticist where he wa diagnosed with bw i suppose it wa just mother intuition tricia surley of the support group how big bw said the condition can cause the tongue tonsil and adenoid to grow much larger than a normal child and create airway restriction approximately per cent of child have an enlarged tongue that can lead to moderate to severe breathing feeding and speech problem many child with bw are diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnoea if it is graded moderate to severe most physician will look at surgical intervention to help free up space in the airway for more information or support visit wwwhowbigbwscom one in born with the rare genetic overgrowth disorder beckwithwiedemann syndrome is a congenital overgrowth disorder which can affect all part of the body bw is a rare genetic condition affecting around one in every birth worldwide the figure is likely to be higher in reality with mild case rarely diagnosed case have been reported in most developed country and in the majority of case it appears to be an isolated case with no known relative suffering the disorder in some case there is evidence the condition can be inherited child with bw are often born prematurely but are larger and heavier than expected given their early arrival typically a child born with bw will have an enlarged tongue which can cause breathing feeding and speaking difficulty a well a excessive dribbling it can also cause respiratory problem and result in a protruding lower jaw some child with this condition are born with an opening in the wall of the abdomen an omphalocele that allows the abdominal organ to protrude through the bellybutton child with the condition are also likely to suffer enlarged abdominal organ overgrowth of one half of the body liver tumour and an enlarged heart or heart defect bw is diagnosed genetically in per cent of case with the remainder being diagnosed after a clinical examination jun http wwwdailymailcouk health article we tend to associate eating disorder with primarily affecting a person emotional and mental health but these are also lifethreatening condition an eating disorder should not be taken lightly it is not just a fad or phase that can be easily cured these are complex and harmful condition that cause strain on health relationship and productivity since these condition pose serious consequence it is important that anyone who is struggling with an eating disorder seek professional help in order to begin their road to recovery the first step toward recovery is identifying the problem below we breakdown three of the most prevalent eating disorder affecting million of american each year please take a few minute to review and learn how these disorder affect the sufferer anorexia nervosa anorexia nervosa is a cycle of selfstarvation where those who suffer from it constantly deny their body of essential nutrient it need to function because of this the body slows down significantly slowing down all of it process to conserve energy which result in serious medical consequence such a reduction of bone density which result in frail and brittle bone muscle loss and weakness abnormally slow heart rate and blood pressure this result in the flux in the heart muscle and patient risk heart failure severe dehydration which lead to kidney failure chronic fatigue and weakness which can cause fainting and dizziness dry hair and skin on occasion the body will grow a downy layer of skin known a lanugo in order to keep the body warm due to depravation of nutrient bulimia nervosa unlike anorexia nervosa where the body is constantly denying itself of nutrient bulimia nervosa is a chronic binging and purging cycle that can be harmful to the entire digestive system causing electrolyte and chemical imbalance this can lead to complication that affect the heart and other vital organ some consequence of bulimia include inflammation and possible rupturing of the esophagus from frequent vomiting tooth decay from stomach acid irregular bowel movement due and constipation due to possible abuse of laxative electrolyte imbalance that can cause irregular heartbeat and lead to heart failure or death stomach ulcer and pancreatitis binge eating disorder eating disorder are not exclusive to undereating and nutrient deprivation they can go both way and binge eating disorder is characterized by consuming an abnormally large amount of food in a short period to time associated with a loss of control during these episode bing eating disorder includes several of the same consequence a obesity including high cholesterol and blood pressure heart disease due to elevated triglyceride level type ii diabetes gallbladder disease the post an eating disorder can be life threating appeared first on feb http rameynutritioncom aneatingdisordercanbelifethreating

i dont particularly like the other answer so ill chime in for background im a th year medical student sitting in a cardiologist office ill elaborate on what u chewylewisandthenews said first off is to realize how conduction in the heart work it is a very complex system but i will attempt to simplify an impulse is generated in the sa node by special cell that automatically polarize and depolarize at a certain rate this signal is sent from the sa node atrium av node purkinje fiber ventricle epinephrine and norepinephrine can modulate this automaticity by binding b receptor in addition the av node between the atrium and ventricle ha adrenergic receptor which will allow the time that the is needed to conduct an impulse through the av node to be decreased faster repolarization with these two basic principle we can move forward the way that bb work is by competing with adrenaline for a spot on the receptor when adrenaline is bound hr increase when le adrenaline is bound hr decrease if you are strictly talking about cardiac receptor then if you expose the patient to the bb their heart rate will decrease because it is blocking the adrenaline from binding the receptor but keep in mind there are thousand and thousand of receptor and not all are going to be blocked only a portion so the others can be bound by adrenaline so net effect the heart rate will decrease when you exercise your body release more adrenaline think fight or flight and thus the proportion of bb to adrenaline decrease so more adrenaline is binding to the receptor this will cause your hr to be elevated from baseline however your hr could potentially be higher w o the bb depending on how high it is for this reason your body is not able to appropriately deal with your muscle increased o demand and you will get decreased exercise tolerance very common side effect can get lactic acidosis due to increased anaerobic activity in addition to increased soreness post exercise there are more than one type of beta blocker some are cardioselective eg atenolol and these exhibit the majority of the action on the b receptor then there are other type that are nonselective propanolol b selective albuterol that are used for all sort of diseaseswhen giving a beta blocker for heart failure after a heart attack or atrial fibrillation the reasoning is not always the same for atrial fibrillation for example the electrical impulse that are being sent from the atrium to the ventricle are being generated in an abnormal pattern somewhere in the atrium and conducted through the av node to the ventricle the cardioselective bb slow the conduction of the impulse through the av node allowing the atrium to essentially send more blood into the ventricle prior to it being pumped into the aorta im not sure if by sit up you mean standing from sitting or doing sit ups but either way bb can cause you to lose consciousness if you are elderly and try to stand too quickly due to decreased perfusion of the brain orthostatic hypotension and is a common reason to take select patient off of bb i know this is a long response but i hope it helped mar http wwwredditcom r askscience comment ja howdobetablockerslowerrestingheartratebut limitdmdaj

view more job additional lead size and electrode spacing option are designed to more effectively meet the need of each patient unique anatomy expanding advanced option for physician looking to tailor therapy to their patient need st paul minn business wire st jude medical inc nysestj a global medical device company today announced ce mark approval and launch of three new quartet left ventricular lv lead offering additional electrode spacing option and one new lead shape the additional spacing combination are aimed to more effectively target the individual cardiac anatomy of patient who need support from cardiac resynchronization therapy pacemaker crtp and defibrillator crtd the expanded selection of quadripolar pacing lead reinforces st jude medical leadership in quadripolar pacing and heart failure treatment option heart and blood vessel anatomy vary from patient to patient so having multiple size and spacing option with the quartet quadripolar lead help me to treat all of my patient in need of cardiac resynchronization therapy we are now able to place the quadripolar lead in the best possible location for that patient capturing more cardiac tissue to give heart failure patient the best opportunity to respond said dr sami pakarinen a cardiologist from helsinki university central hospital in finland study have shown that crt can improve the quality of life for many patient with heart failure crt resynchronizes the beating of the heart lower chamber ventricle which often beat out of sync in heart failure patient the addition of multipoint pacing technology enables physician to program a single quartet lv lead to pace multiple site on the left side of the heart giving the clinician more choice to improve patient response to therapy and reducing the likelihood of costly and invasive lead revision through a second intervention procedure these lead choice allow physician to identify what lead spacing option will work best for each patient so they can individualize care said philip b adamson md medical director and vice president of medical affair at st jude medical the expanded selection of quadripolar pacing lead reinforces st jude medical leadership in quadripolar pacing and heart failure treatment option the newlyapproved additional quadripolar lead option are used with nextgeneration multipoint pacing technology which enables physician to pace multiple location on the left side of the heart and provide physician a new option for patient who havent responded to crt the expanded selection of quadripolar pacing lead make the st jude medical quadripolar lead portfolio the broadest on the market and allows for enhanced individualization of crt the new lead are designed based on the company firsttomarket proven quadripolar lv lead technology and include additional spacing option on two new sshape and one new doublebend lead design some of the newly approved product are also magnetic resonance mr conditional including the quadra assura crtd and quadra assura mp crtd with multipoint pacing additionally physician will be able to quickly customize therapy using the auto vectselect quartet test which is designed to automatically guide programming of the most appropriate therapy option available and streamline workflow about heart failure more than five million american and about million people worldwide suffer from heart failure which occurs when the heart is unable to pump enough blood to the body when this happens blood pressure eventually rise leading to shortness of breath fatigue swelling and other symptom cardiac resynchronization therapy is a treatment option for symptomatic heart failure quadripolar pacing technology from st jude medical st jude medical introduced the industry first quadripolar pacing system featuring four pacing electrode the quadripolar pacing system offer physician the ability to effectively and efficiently manage the everchanging need of patient with heart failure the system integrates multiple pacing configuration and tailoredtherapy feature that enable physician to optimize the system at implant and followup a well a better manage common pacing complication without having to surgically reposition the lead the quartet lead design allows the physician to implant the lead in the most stable position without making tradeoff in electrical performance this includes pacing closer to the base of the left ventricle which study associate with better patient outcome and which may be more difficult with traditional bipolar lead the quadripolar pacing electrode also provide physician more option to optimize crt performance such a pacing around scar tissue in the heart and avoiding the most common pacing complication the morecrt prospective randomized clinical trial of more than patient demonstrated a percent relative risk reduction of leadrelated complication for patient implanted with the quartet lv lead to date more than clinical publication have provided broad clinical evidence supporting the advantage of quadripolar technology from st jude medical about st jude medical heart failure business st jude medical is aarhus university many dane are prescribed nsaid for the treatment of painful condition fever and inflammation but the treatment also come with side effect including the risk of ulcer and increased blood pressure a major new study now gather all research in the area this show that arthritis medicine is particularly dangerous for heart patient and also that older type of arthritis medicine which have not previously been in focus also appear to be dangerous for the heart it been wellknown for a number of year that newer type of nsaid what are known a cox inhibitor increase the risk of heart attack for this reason a number of these newer type of nsaid have been taken off the market again we can now see that some of the older nsaid type particularly diclofenac are also associated with an increased risk of heart attack and apparently to the same extent a several of the type that were taken off the market say morten schmidt md and phd from aarhus university who is in charge of the research project he add this is worrying because these older type of medicine are frequently used throughout the western world and in many country available without prescription each year more than per cent of the western country collect a prescription for nsaid this figure increase with age sixty per cent of the adult population in denmark collect at least one prescription for an nsaid within a tenyear period heart patient are no exception and previous study have shown that up to forty per cent of danish patient with heart failure or previous heart attack are prescribed nsaid the study which wa carried out in collaboration between european university and hospital including a number of leading european heart specialist is today being published in the most prestigious european journal of heart medicine european heart journal new guideline in the study the researcher have gathered all research on the use of nsaid in patient with heart disease the survey mean that the european society of cardiology ha now for the first time formulated a number of recommendation about what doctor should consider before prescribing painkiller to their patient when doctor issue prescription for nsaid they must in each individual case carry out a thorough assessment of the risk of heart complication and bleeding nsaid should only be sold over the counter when it come with an adequate warning about the associated cardiovascular risk in general nsaid are not be used in patient who have or are at highrisk of cardiovascular disease say another of the author professor in cardiology christian torppedersen aalborg university denmark consumption should be reduced even more for a number of year danish researcher have made significant contribution in the field one result of this work ha been a reduction in the use of diclofenac in denmark however according to morten schmidt there is still room for improvement many european country consume more of these drug than denmark but we can still do better and it often the case that paracetamol physiotherapy mild opioids or other type of nsaid with le risk for the heart would be better for the patient of course the recommendation that have been introduced following our study and it review of the heartrelated risk are a big step in the right direction in relation to patient safety say morten schmidt fact about arthritis medicine nsaid nsaid is an abbreviation for nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug and is used to treat a wide range of disease in particular disorder in the muscular and bone system where the drug counteracts swelling pain and limitation in movement associated with inflammation nsaid are not antibiotic and therefore do not help to fight infection caused by bacteria nsaid are in denmark sold both in low do ibuprofen mg tablet without a prescription and in higher do and other type with a prescription read the scientific article http eurheartjoxfordjournalsorg content early eurheartjehv contact information aarhus university and aarhus university hospital department of clinical epidemiology london school of hygiene tropical medicine noncommunicable disease epidemiology telephone mar http clinicalnewsorg amino acid in order to repair damaged tissue within joint that suffer due to ongoing free radical damage glycine is essential for the formation of stretchy flexible cartilage help heal damaged joint and bacteria inside the gut where they belong rather than allowing tiny opening to form that pa particle to the bloodstream where they trigger inflammation glycine help form two of the most important cancerous cell by cutting off their energy supply and help turn down inflammation which is linked to numerous other chronic condition besides cancer calm the nerve and feed the brain glycine is invention the creator never lived to see by emilios manolidis toptenz april throughout history the work of inventor engineer polymath and entrepreneur have advanced mankind in both small step and giant leap forward but not all of those design came to life while the heart of their creator were still beating sometimes it wa an abrupt death other time it wa lack of funding or public interest some invention were even vague or hastily scrawled design in the originator notebook but many of them were finally built sometimes hundred of year after that person died viola organista leonardo da vinci notorious for being cryptic and vague the polymath leonardo da vinci included in his codex atlanticus around the design of an organ able of producing string sound like a violin but which operated with a keyboard like a piano leonardo having the attention span of a true genius which is to say none at all never bothered building it however his design although not extremely detailed gave a good idea to future craftsman about how to go about creating one around an instrument called geigenwerk wa built by the german han haiden it resembled leonardo original idea but operated on a slightly different mechanical principle the most faithful interpretation of da vincis schematic so far is the organ finished in by slawomir zubrzycki year after it intellectual father passed away a truly unique organ it ha raised no small amount of musician eyebrow about how existing musical arrangement can be played with it typewriter henry mill henry mill wa an english new river company engineer in he obtained a patent for an artificial machine or method for the impressing or transcribing of letter singly or progressively one after another although vaguely described mill conception ha been regarded a a first clear proposal of creating what later came to be known a a typewriter mill died in but the potential existence of such a machine got the attention of among others people trying to facilitate communication for blind people in charles thurber constructed a machine for this purpose finally in year after mill death the american christopher sholes and carlos glidden put together what can be recognized today in form and function a a typewriter revolutionizing the way people put their thought into paper clifton suspension bridge isambard kingdom brunel one of britain most revered figure isambard kingdom brunel is considered the founding father of modern civil engineering he wa only year old when in he wa appointed project engineer for constructing a bridge above the river avon in bristol after several rejection and conflict with the committee tasked to approve submitted design the clifton suspension bridge wa not an easy project at the time of construction it had the longest span of any bridge in the world further delay and setback left the bridge unfinished at the time of his death being a heavy smoker brunel died of a stroke in construction wa continued based on brunels design and the bridge wa finally finished in a fitting memorial for the late engineer a well a an impressive landmark in it own right today standing meter long between it two meter high tower and meter above the river it core infrastructure remains unaltered brunel had to push the limit of civil engineering to the point that even modern calculation leave engineer in awe of how perfectly accurate and balanced his design were lear fan bill lear in the late s bill lear inventor and founder of the lear jet corporation had an idea for a unique aircraft type made almost entirely of composite material like carbon graphite it would have the same durability at about half the weight of typical aluminum alloy it twin engine and rearmounted propeller would make it about a fast a other jet at that time the u federal aviation administration having reservation about gearbox and aerodynamics performance refused to give the project the green light for production lear didnt live long enough to perfect his dream dying of leukemia in his desire to have the jet completed wa so great that a a dying wish he told his wife moya to finish it with the help of british government funding the prototype made it maiden flight in never having entered commercial production three finished model are now in display at the museum of flight in seattle washington at the frontier of flight museum in dallas texas and in the back lot of faa facility in oklahoma city demologos steam warship robert fulton the first warship ever to be propelled by a steam engine the united state navy design for the u demologos began in robert fulton a renowned engineer and inventor imagined a ship unlike any other heavily armed and armored and it twin hull had a paddlewheel between them the engine wa on one hull while the boiler were on the other a floating fortress wellsuited for local defense it weighed displacement ton and wa meter long in before the ship wa completed fulton jumped in the icy water of the hudson river to save a friend who fell in struck by pneumonia which quickly developed into pulmonary tuberculosis he died the same year shortly after the demologos wa fully finished and the navy renamed it the fulton to honor the inventor the warship never saw any real action due to the end of the war of and it wa destroyed in due to a gunpowder explosion omnia dir airship enrico forlanini there wa a time where airship were considered a good idea for passenger transport after the great war italian inventor and aeronautical pioneer enrico forlanini sought to put into air traffic a new airship type with unprecedented maneuverability in he presented the design of omnia dir a meter long dirigible with cubic meter capacity what made it special aside from forlaninis already established expertise wa the addition of jet propulsion to the classic engine and propeller scheme highpressure air jet installed at the ship bow and stern offered the ship unbelievable for the time maneuvering speed both on ground and in the air forlanini died in before the ship wa completed and aside for a test flight it never entered mass production it innovative design however became a point of reference and helped study and develop auxiliary thrust technology in aircraft automatic computing engine ace alan turing by the time world war ii had ended building a computer wa entirely possible anyone with half a million dollar and a really big room could have one what wa missing from the greater picture wa a generalpurpose computer existing model were very limited in what they could do they could very specific task and nothing more it wa no wonder that the mathematical genius alan turing wa summoned to build the very first electronic storedprogram generalpurpose digital computer in he presented his design to the uk national physical laboratory work began in ace operated nothing like modern system do a it logic resembled more biological neuron function rather than the boolean logic all modern computer are based on turing stayed a few month on the project leaving npl technician baffled about how to carry on the pilot model finished in wa pretty fast for the time though not exactly what turing had envisioned turing died of cyanide poisoning in and the first fullscale ace model wa completed in pendulum clock galileo galilei when he wa not being bullied by the inquisition galileo observed and recorded physical phenomenon one of them wa the back and forth motion of a suspended weight the physic behind pendulum motion is no small deal it study paved the way for an entire branch of physic namely the harmonic oscillator a model that ha helped represent and explain problem ranging from planetary motion to quantum mechanic galileo wa the first to notice that contrary to common intuition the period of swing of a pendulum is independent of it swinging arc in galileo wa year old and blind he had fully described the inner work of a pendulum clock and his son vincenzo tried to the food and drug administration fda issued a drug safety communication stating that it ha revised the warning label of sglt inhibitor including invokana to include information about acute kidney injury according to a press release from the fda between march and october the agency received report of confirmed case of acute kidney injury some of which required dialysis and hospitalization related to invokana invokamet canagliflozin janssen pharmaceutical and farxiga xigduo xr dapagliflozin bristolmyers squibb astrazeneca the communication advised health care professional to consider factor that may predispose patient to acute kidney injury prior to starting them on canagliflozin or dapagliflozin these include lower blood volume chronic kidney insufficiency congestive heart failure and taking medication such a diuretic ace inhibitor angiotensin receptor blocker and nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug continue reading jun http rssjustiacom r dallasfortworthinjurylawyerblogcom siwvjkj fdaissuesinvokanawarningshtml

i wa diagnosed with m in and put on avonex inj for almost a year then the mri showed brain lesion and the report said no m pattern or demylinization my pcp said get another opinion so i am waiting to see another neuro dr march i have recently had a left leg dvt and pe enlarged heart and atrophy of the left ventricle i had several other clot a well in my lung now i am confused a to what is going on my rdw is high and my ldh i am to have another ct again in week i am on welfarin i am not taking the avonex anymore is this possibly a cancer not showing up yet i do have fibrosis of the lung a well can you give me some help here mary answer hi mary sorry but we are not allowed to give specific medical advice on this site but i will help a much a i can how old are you the suggestion to get an opinion by a neuro expert is a good one i think it highly unlikely that the brain lesion is cancer the circulatory and cardiac symptom are certainly of concern ha a cardiologist discussed them with you i can also see no connection between m and the lung fibrosis did you have a history of other condition before the m diagnosis did they rule out lupus or another autoimmune disease do you have any occupational exposure to lung damaging agent or a smoking history i hope this is of some help i am happy to answer more question or help you interpret what your doctor tell you all the best michael followup hi michael i am a prior smoker but quit yr ago i do have copd and i have not been tested for lupus is it possible to have lesion with that i just want to know what to ask this new neurologist what would be good for mw i wa told to get another mri of the spinal canal seeing it ha been nearly yr now he wa an m specialist and he said that if the lesion are on the brain they are most likely on out and suggested i do see one seeing i do have cardiomegaly and left v hypertrophy maybe caused from the clot i cant get my walfarin stableized yet i will find out more when i go for my visit march the copd would explain the fibrosis in the lung but i dont understand shat is causing your clotting problem or the cardiac condition so it is good that you see a cardiologist regularly and the spine hi there are several cause for fatigue you reported some linked to copd and others to heart the copd is a progressive disease that make it difficult to exit air from the lung and need quite strict treatment not to worse the treatment can be done with medication smoking cessation and in advanced case to the use of home oxygen therapy the cardiac cause are related to losswhen there is loss of contractile function of the heart loses some of it ability to pump blood forward and liquid become accumulated in various part of the body especially the lung causing pulmonary edema this fluid accumulation in the lung is responsible for the sensation of breathlessness this condition is known a heart failure and there are several treatment for this problem including cardiopulmonary rehabilitation medication and visit by multidisciplinary team i suggest you contact your cardiologist for further information and determine which therapy are needed to solve the problem hope i have answered your question if you have any further question i will be happy to help you wish you good health mar http wwwhealthcaremagiccom question whatcausesfatiguewhilesufferingfromcopd answer

cardiologist and doctor usually recommend ventricular assist device vad a type of mechanical pump for individual who have weakened heart or suffer from severe heart failure patient awaiting a heart transplant or undergoing a longterm treatment find these device useful these mechanical pump are surgically placed to support heart function and blood flow in people with heart failure hf the equipment is used in combination with other specialized treatment such a mechanical circulatory support system the device doe not replace the native heart but prolongs it life the device take blood from the lower chamber of the heart and pump it to the vital organ of the body basically two type of vad are usedleft ventricular assist device lvad and right ventricular assist device rvad the former being most commonly used for treating hf rvads are usually used after lvad surgery or other heart surgery particularly for shortterm support function rvad also called a bridge to transplant is often used in longerterm therapy it help the right ventricle to pump blood to the pulmonary artery increasing incidence of advanced hf across region is a key factor boosting the growth of the vad market growing use of the device in destination therapy where it is surgically inserted for longterm support in patient who cannot undergo transplantation is expected to create ample growth opportunity in the market in the developed region know more http wwwbigmarketresearchcom globalvadindustrydeepresearchreportmarket a per scientific registry of transplant recipient approximately of all patient undergoing transplantation have a heart device a majority of such device consist of vads increasing approval by fda for new vad device and advancement in technology used for heart therapy are expected to foster the growth of the market across major region such a europe and the u furthermore the incidence of transplant is limited mainly due to the scarcity of acceptable donor which will create more demand for vads device leading provider for vad implantation offer service related to superior management of the vad equipment that help in containing postsurgical maintenance cost and boost surgical hi everyone well the temperature ha been up in the low s a few day this week and the humidity ha been extremely high yesterday and today if you havent figured it out yet i am not liking this type of weather i can not be outside in weather like this because of my chronic congestive heart failure and i hate feeling stuck in the house all the time i am so grateful that we have central airconditioning because i need the air all summer i can remember when i could go out in this weather i loved going to the swimming pool or to laurel lake most of the time id sit in the sun and visit with family or friend but a much a i hate to say this all that time in the sun took it toll on me ive had numerous carcinoma removed from my face and neck area i wa born a blue eyed blond and the sun wasnt good for me i remember a a child whenever wed go to laurel lake for the day my mom would put sun tan lotion on me and also shed make me wear a tshirt over my swimming suit i used to burn so quickly and i recall that on our drive home my skin would be burning and hurting me youd think that having those memory a a child that a an adult id stay out of the sun yeah that didnt happen that is until about ten year ago i guess we all have to learn the hard way in some thing anyway im year old and im still learning thing but im happy to say that most of those thing i dont learn the hard way what have you all been up to lately i do hope youre doing something creative anything at all thats creative is good maybe you lady have made a new fancy tasty dessert for your family thats being seem to be getting tired so much lately i suppose it partly my health and partly my age i guess im an old lady now no that doesnt really bother me at all tomorrow is sunday the lord day so whatever dr hyman my father ha heart disease his father did too and im obviously concerned about my own heart writes this week house call what can i do to prevent heart disease most importantly please know while genetics contributes to some degree many other factor completely within your control can contribute to or reverse heart disease genetics load the gun but environment pull the trigger the way you eat how much you exercise how you manage stress and your exposure to environmental toxin all contribute to thing like high cholesterol high blood pressure high blood sugar and of course heart disease the current way doctor treat heart disease is misguided because they treat the risk factor not the cause to think we can treat heart disease by lowering cholesterol lowering blood pressure and lowering blood sugar with medication is like mopping up the floor while the sink overflow instead we need to ask what cause these risk factor like high blood pressure high blood sugar or abnormal cholesterol in the first place spoiler alert these are not medication deficiency we treat these problem with medication but study have increasingly shown that treating these risk factor ha only little benefit or none at all research show changing your lifestyle can be a more powerful intervention to prevent heart disease than any medication the epic study published in the archive of internal medicine studied how people adhered to four simple behavior not smoking exercising hour a week eating a healthy diet and maintaining a healthy weight adhering to those four behavior alone prevented percent of diabetes percent of heart attack percent of stroke and percent of all cancer likewise the interheart study published in the lancet in followed people in country researcher found changing lifestyle could prevent at least percent of all heart disease other research show lifestyle intervention becomes more effective than almost any other traditional medical intervention to reduce cardiovascular disease hypertension heart failure stroke cancer diabesity and death from all cause your environment in turn change gene expression subsequently modulating inflammation oxidative stress and metabolic dysfunction these are the reason we get sick and develop heart disease along with other problem thats actually good news addressing and fixing the root cause benefit most chronic disease these modification will make you feel alive and healthy without the side effect of medication occasionally i will use medication if i feel a patient show a strong genetic predisposition for heart disease or if significant heart disease already exists under those circumstance i carefully weigh a medication risk and benefit at the same time most patient can achieve the benefit of most medication through lifestyle change dr david jenkins from the university of toronto compared treatment with statin drug the number one cholesterol medication with a diet rich in viscous fiber almond soy and plant sterol researcher in this study found that while they created almost equal benefit diet became more effective to lower inflammation and homocysteine a risk marker for heart disease ive likewise had patient lower their cholesterol sometimes over point simply by incorporating positive dietary and lifestyle change simply put preventative medicine becomes the best form of medicine these simple modification can go a long way to preventing or reversing heart disease eat a healthy diet increase healthy whole food rich in nutrient and phytonutrients plant molecule aim for at least to serving of colorful fruit and vegetable every day these food are loaded with diseasefighting vitamin mineral fiber antioxidant and antiinflammatory molecule steady your blood sugar study show blood sugar imbalance contribute to heart disease stabilize your blood sugar with protein healthy fat and healthy carbohydrate at every meal never eat carbohydrate alone and avoid processed sugar with carbohydrate i discus this more indepth in the blood sugar solution day detox diet increase your fiber work your way up to gram of fiber per day highfiber food include vegetable nut seed and lowersugar fruit like berry if that becomes a challenge try a fiber supplement such a pgx konjac fiber or glucomannan avoid processed junk food that includes soda juice and diet drink which adversely impact sugar and lipid metabolism research show liquidsugar calorie become the biggest contributor to obesity diabetes and heart disease dont be fooled that percent fruit juice is healthy juice are essentially pure liquid sugar because processing strip away the fruit fiber increase omega fatty acid eat antiinflammatory food like coldwater fish including salmon sardine and herring a well a flaxseed and even seaweed healthy fat actually benefit your heart by improving your overall cholesterol profile it also lower the small dangerous ldl particle that contribute to heart disease by converting them into light fluffy safe ldl particle i discus how healthy fat can help you achieve and maintain good health in my new book eat fat get thin eliminate all hydrogenated fat hydrogenated fat lurks in margarine shortening processed oil and many baked good and processed food like cooky and cracker even when the label state no trans fat the word hydrogenated indicates that the product contains trans fat in one or more of the ingredient use healthy oil instead like coconut oil rich in mediumchain triglyceride or mcts extravirgin organic coldpressed olive oil organic sesame oil and other nut oil you can now find mct oil in my store avoid or reduce alcohol intake alcohol can raise triglyceride contribute to fatty liver and create sugar imbalance reducing or eliminating alcohol intake lower inflammation which contributes to heart disease and nearly every other chronic disease take quality supplement combined with a healthy diet and exercise program supplement can dramatically improve cardiovascular health take a good multivitamin mineral along with a purified fish oil supplement that contains to milligram a day of epa dha you might need higher do if you have low hdl and high triglyceride i also recommend a fiber supplement such a pgx konjac fiber or gluccomanan to lower cholesterol and balance blood sugar level you can find these and other supplement in my store get out and move research show to minute of cardiovascular exercise at least five time a week can benefit your heart after all your heart is a muscle and muscle need exercise if you feel stronger and more capable highintensity interval training also called burst training and strength training help build muscle reduce body fat composition and maintain strong bone you simply cannot age successfully without sufficient optimal exercise manage stress level stress alone can cause a heart attack sadly chronic stress often trigger a cascade of event that cause that final fatal heart attack among it problem stress increase inflammation raise your cholesterol and blood sugar increase blood pressure and even make your blood more likely to clot find your pause button to manage stress and relax yoga tai chi meditation breathing technique and guided imagery can lower stress many patient find my ultracalm cd help dial down stress level very effectively i want to hear from you have you improved your heart health with diet and lifestyle change comment below or on my facebook page and share your story to inspire others to get healthy wishing you health and happiness mark hyman md new detail possible treatment in the link between heart disease and sleep apnea people with obstructive sleep apnea are at significantly increased risk for cardiovascular disease the relationship between the two condition is complex and the mechanism by which they may trigger or exacerbate one another are not yet well understood but the fundamental connection between osa and cardiovascular disease is strong study indicated that obstructive sleep apnea is time more prevalent among people with cardiovascular disease than those without research show that the mortality rate for cardiovascular disease is higher among older adult who also have osa sleep apnea is linked to several cardiovascular condition including high blood pressure arrhythmia heart disease heart failure and stroke two common condition cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death among adult in the united state obstructive sleep apnea affect an estimated million or more u adult with the great majority of case remaining undiagnosed and untreated deepening our understanding of the relationship between sleep apnea and cardiovascular disease is critical to public health how osa may trigger heart disease recent research reveals new detail in the relationship between heart disease and sleep apnea and also point to a possible treatment for lowering cardiovascular risk for people with osa scientist at columbia university medical center found that statin a type of drug used to treat cholesterol may reverse the damage done to the cardiovascular system that appears to occur a a consequence of sleep apnea the scientist also identified new information about the process by which obstructive sleep apnea may inflict cardiovascular damage according to the study people with osa exhibit abnormality in a protein that help to limit cellular inflammation the dysfunction with this particular protein known a cd appears to leave people with obstructive sleep apnea more vulnerable to inflammation which is regarded a a significant contributor to cardiovascular disease the study included people including with a diagnosis of sleep apnea and who did not meet the diagnostic criterion for osa scientist analyzed blood sample from all participant looking in particular at endothelial cell cell that line the interior wall of blood vessel the protein cd is normally found in these cell lining blood vessel wall from within the cell lining cd work to prevent the buildup of inflammatory protein on the surface of cell scientist found that among people with obstructive sleep apnea cd level were elevated compared to those without osa researcher found something else both surprising and significant in people with sleep apnea cd protein wa found primarily within the interior section of blood vessel cell rather than in the cell lining a would have been expected and wa the case among people without sleep apnea at a greater distance from cell wall the cd protein wa le able to exert it protective effect against inflammation the result a greater buildup of inflammatory protein on the cell of people with obstructive sleep apnea researcher found statin a solution included in the study were a small number of subject with osa who were already being treated with statin among this subgroup of sleep apnea sufferer researcher discovered that cd remained in place in the lining of cell in a position to inhibit inflammation similar to people without osa additional research found that in people with osa the inward migration of cd is influenced by cholesterol this finding is important opening the possibility of statin use a a therapy to prevent cardiovascular damage in people with obstructive sleep apnea further study need to take place before well know whether statin can serve a a viable treatment to prevent or reverse the cardiovascular damage from osa but this is a promising lead more broadly this study also provides some much needed insight into the process by which obstructive sleep apnea affect cardiovascular health and function the disrupted breathing of osa obstructive sleep apnea involves repeated interruption to normal breathing during sleep during sleep the airway temporarily narrow or close altogether compromising or fully interrupting breath flow these episode of shallow or paused breathing can last a few second or more than a minute in case of mild sleep apnea breathing is interrupted between time an hour in case of moderate to severe sleep apnea breathing is interrupted time an hour or more people with osa are at higher risk for cardiovascular disease a well a other serious medical condition including type diabetes and depression they are also at significantly greater risk for accident and injury in large part because of the tiredness and fatigue that accompany this sleep disorder undiagnosed and untreated why do so many case of obstructive sleep apnea go undiagnosed often people with sleep apnea arent aware of their most obvious symptom since they occur during sleep snoring and other sound of disrupted breathing during sleep can be sign of sleep apnea bed partner are frequently the people who are aware of these symptom before the sleeper themselves even when people are aware they snore or breathe with difficulty during sleep they too often dont address these issue with their physician and physician themselves often dont make the topic of sleep and question about sleepdisordered breathing a priority during physicals and check ups whats more many people arent aware of the symptom of obstructive sleep apnea that exist in addition to snoring dry mouth or sore throat upon waking headache especially in the morning severe tiredness during the daytime trouble with concentration memory problem mood issue including depression anxiety and irritability the regular presence of any of these symptom even in the absence of snoring warrant conversation with a physician treatment work for osa sleep apnea can wreak havoc with nightly rest undermining health and daily performance the good news is that osa can be treated effectively with a number of different therapy cpap continuous positive airway pressure therapy is highly effective in reducing or eliminating sleep apnea and is generally the recommended treatment for more severe case of osa other form of pap or positive airway pressure are also used to treat osa oral appliance device worn inside the mouth during sleep can also significantly improve sleep apnea and are increasingly recommended for mild and moderate sleep apnea a well a for people who have difficulty using cpap therapy positional therapy switching sleeping position is the simplest form of sleep apnea treatment and can be effective particularly in case of mild osa airway obstruction and disrupted breathing are more likely to occur when sleeping on one back moving to a sidesleeping position can reduce the frequency of interruptedbreathing episode and may even resolve mild sleep apnea in some case lifestyle modification including losing weight also help to alleviate osa we need to improve our diagnosis rate osa and get more people into treatment for sleep apnea and the other health complication that often accompany the disorder this latest research provides some significant new insight into how sleep apnea work to undermine heart health and may indicate a new way to treat and protect people with sleep apnea against cardiovascular risk sweet dream michael j breus phd the sleep doctor wwwthesleepdoctorcom this feed and it content are the property of the huffington post and use is subject to our term it may be used for personal consumption but may not be distributed on a website apr http wwwhuffingtonpostcom drmichaeljbreus statinsforsleepapneabhtml

carpe diem it never hurt to be reminded of that just last week one of my beach guest recovering from chest pain while overlooking the ocean had received that very reminder from her husband hysterically responding to him with who are you and what have you done with my husband but it wa sage advice today rainy road trip took me far enough into mathews county that i wa within spitting distance of gwynn island to interview a successful business owner about his past present and future standard stuff right except no anything but imagine a year old man having a heart problem misdiagnosed and now six year later his heart is in such bad shape a a result that in two day he will have a batterypowered mechanical pump implanted to stave off endstage heart failure followed by his name going on the heart transplant list turn out that last week while i wa reveling in my annual week in kitty hawk he wa a few mile away in nag head relishing his last trip frolicking in the ocean at least until he get a new heart because pump and swimming are incompatible it almost too difficult to get my head around the idea of going in the ocean last week a i did without knowing if youll ever be able to go in again i look back now with cosmic gratitude for his sake for the degree water the thing is he only year old now and his life is already drastically changed and thing are about to undergo even more adjustment postsurgery so while ill be flying across the pond thursday hell be holed up at mcv a few block from my house undergoing eight hour of surgery and spending three week there recovering from it all because someone made a bad call and now he paying with his health perhaps even his life i know i know plenty of people have terrible thing happen to them while others blithely move through life with nothing more serious than the usual bump and scrape that all human experience when i shared my own great tragedy from a couple decade ago he teared up in empathy but we found common ground in a shared philosophy when bad thing happen good people have two choice curl up in a ball and give up or deal and move on which brings u back to carpe diem so i seized the day by making the most of a wet foray to the bay loving up on two personable beagle an old one at his house and a young one in the hallway of my apartment building walking twice morning and evening simply because i could and seeing genius a geeky literary movie based on a geeky literary bio i read over a decade ago dont mind me im just over here gathering my rosebud while i may with by the way enormous gratitude for the ability to do so jun http icouldgoonandonblogspotcom moonflowersbloomingonbalconyhtml

you need to see asap because your med arent a safe a youve been led to believe some of them can hurt you and some might even kill you im sure you remember vioxx and bextra the deadly painkiller pulled some of these older and supposedly safer drug can cause the same kind of heart problem a vioxx and bextra especially if you already have heart disease the worst of the bunch unfortunately is one of the drug used most often diclofenac the new study ha shocked some doctor but it right in line with research published in which found that prolonged use of common nsaid painkiller such a ibuprofen and diclofenac can double your risk of heart failure and increase overall heart risk by about a third the scary part about that of course is thats exactly how arthritis patient use the med over the long run some folk cant even get through a day without hitting the pill bottle and if youre one of them it time to make some change before you pay the ultimate price dont swap your nsaid for tylenol acetaminophen is only barely better than a placebo for both pain and function in osteoarthritis patient and it doe absolutely nothing to slow the progression of the disease itself i know it sound like chondroitin can ease knee pain due to osteoarthritis a effectively a the painkiller celebrex even better it can also slow the progression of the disease itself something celebrex ha never even claimed to do but why stop there chondroitin work well for many people but there something thats been proven to work even better an allnatural form of collagen called ucii learn more in this free report from my house call archive apr http wwwhealthrevelationscom arthritispainkillerspackseriousheartrisks

by ashish jha md reducing hospital use because hospital are expensive and often cause harm there ha been a big focus on reducing hospital use this focus ha been the underpinning for numerous policy intervention most notable of which is the affordable care act hospital readmission reduction program hrrp which penalizes hospital for higher than expected readmission rate the motivation behind hrrp is simple the readmission rate the proportion of discharged patient who return to the hospital within day had been more or le flat for year and reducing this rate would save money and potentially improve care so it wa big news when a the hrrp penalty kicked in government official started reporting that the national readmission rate for medicare patient wa declining rising use of observation status but during this time another phenomenon wa coming into focus increasing use of observation status when a patient need hospital service there are two option that patient can be admitted for inpatient care or can be admitted to observation when patient are admitted to observation they essentially still get inpatient care but technically they are outpatient for a variety of reason weve seen a decline in patient admitted to inpatient status and a rise in those going to observation status these two phenomenon a drop in readmission and an increase in observation seemed related i and others spoke publicly about our concern that the drop in readmission wa being driven by increasing observation admission an analysis by david himmelstein and steffie woolhandler in the health affair blog suggested that most of the drop in readmission could be accounted for both by increase in observation status and by increase in return to the emergency department that did not lead to readmission two month later a piece by claire noelmiller and keith lund also in the health affair blog found that the hospital with the biggest drop in readmission appeared to have big increase in their use of observation status it seemed like much of the drop in readmission wa about reclassifying people a observation and administratively lowering readmission without changing care new data now come a terrific high quality study in the new england journal of medicine that take this topic head on the author examine directly whether the hospital that lowered their readmission rate were the same one that increased their observation status and find no correlation none if youre ever looking for a scatter plot of two variable that are completely uncorrelated look no further than figure of the paper the best reading of the evidence prior to the study did not turn out to be the truth it reminds me of the period we were all convinced based on excellent observational data that hormone replacement therapy wa lifesaving for woman with cardiovascular disease and that became the standard of care until someoneconducted a randomized trial and found that hrt provided little benefit to these patient thats why we do research it move our knowledge forward where are we now so where doe this leave u is the acas readmission policy a home run here what we know the hrrp ha most likely we have no control led to fewer patient being readmitted to the hospital second the hrrp doe not seem responsible for the increase in observation stay here what we dont know is a drop in readmission a good thing for patient it may seem obvious that it is but if you think about it you realize that readmission rate is a utilization measure not a patient outcome it a measure of how often patient use inpatient service within day of discharge utilization measure unto themselves dont tell you whether care is good or bad so the real question is ha the hrrp improved the underlying quality of care it might be that we have improved on care coordination communication between hospital and primary care provider and ensuring good followup that likely happened in some place alternatively it might be that we have just made it much harder for that older frail woman with heart failure sitting in the emergency room to get admitted if she wa discharged in the last day that too ha likely happened in some place but how much of it is the former versus the latter until we can answer that question we wont know whether care is better or not beyond understanding why readmission have fallen we also dont know how hrrp ha affected the other thing that hospital ought to focus on such a mortality and infection rate if your parent wa admitted to the hospital with pneumonia what would be your top priority most people would say that they would like their parent not to die the second might be to avoid serious complication like a healthcare associated infection or a fall that lead to a hip fracture another might be to be treated with dignity and respect yes avoiding being readmitted would be nice but for me at least it pale in comparison to avoiding death and disability we know little about the potential spillover effect of the readmission penalty on the thing that matter the most so here we are a good news study that say readmission are down because fewer people are being readmitted to the hospital not because people are being admitted to observation status thats important but the real challenge is in figuring out whether patient are better off are they more likely to be alive after hospitalization do they have fewer functional limitation le pain and suffering until we answer those question itll be hard to know whether this policy is making the kind of difference we want and thats the point of science using data to answer those question because we all can have our opinion but ultimately it the data that count ashish jha md mph ashishkjha is the c boyden gray associate professor of health policy and management at the harvard school of public health he blog at an ounce of evidence where this post originally appeared he is also the senior editorinchief for healthcare the journal of delivery science and innova feb http thehealthcareblogcom blog readmissionsobservationandimprovinghospitalcare

yahoo a study involving people with diabetes ha shown that belly size is a stronger predictor of a dangerous kind of heart disease than body mass index researcher said on saturday the study released at the american college of cardiology conference in chicago wa based on people with diabetes who had not shown any symptom of heart disease researcher found that those with larger waist circumference were more likely than smallerbellied people to have problem with the heart left ventricle which pump oxygenrich blood to the brain and the rest of the body we specifically found that waist circumference appears to be a stronger predictor for left ventricle dysfunction than total body weight or body mass index said principal investigator boaz rosen a doctor at john hopkins university in maryland previous research ha shown that the higher a person body mass index bmi a measure of a person height and weight the greater their risk of heart disease having excess belly fat or having an appleshaped figure ha already been linked to high blood pressure high sugar level elevated cholesterol coronary artery disease and heart failure our research examined patient with diabetes who are considered high risk for developing heart disease already and found that the shape of your body determined if you were at a greater risk to develop left ventricular dysfunction said brent muhlestein codirector of research at the intermountain medical center heart institute in salt lake city this study confirms that having an appleshaped body or a high waist circumference can lead to heart disease and that reducing your waist size can reduce your risk problem with the left ventricle can lead to congestive heart failure researcher said more study is needed to see if diabetic patient with large waist and sign of heart problem go on to develop heart failure or artery disease in the future apr http muninaaradblogspotcom heartdiseaseriskrevealedbywaisthtml

track it movement whenever in transit this technology ha been used in several sector to protect and keep a record of precious good product and machinery with a consistent growth and elevation in technology researcher of the world have able to combine nfc near field communication technology with rfid nfc is communication between compatible device within a short range compilation of nfc with rfid tag ha enabled user to utilize feature like bluetooth pairing device authentication connection handover and wifi protected set up nfc is actually a subcategory or a branch of rfid both of which operate at mhz frequency rfid tag operate and function on three different frequency range low frequency lf khz tag high frequency hf mhz tag ultra high frequency uhf mhz to mhz tag the high frequency mhz tag is eminently used in the logistics and transport sector so a to trace object it is a resourceful device that ha nfc feature with it in healthcare sector these tag are useful in storing patient information previous health record medication prescribed and surgery undergone if any these tag can be read from a considerable range and can be connected to gadget like smart phone tablet laptop etc on which information can be read easily once the patient is discharged from the hospital the tag are removed and destroyed their range is about inch and when connected with accordant reader their range is up to ft rfid mhz tag are not used only in high power industry and organization with high turnover it is also used in laundry identification in the hospitality sector where a large number of people come for a luxury stay laundry service is provided to them for convenience but it is difficult to identify that which cloth belongs to whom rfid technology is an effective solution for it the vitamin d improves cardiac function in heart failure patient study find the heart pumping function increased from to of eighty patient who took vitamin d daily for a year following a fiveyear research project a team of scientist ha found that vitamin d can be beneficial to patient with chronic heart failure the finding were presented at the american college of cardiology th annual scientific session expo in chicago usa scientist from the university of leeds uk have found that taking a vitamin d supplement can improve the pumping action of the heart in patient with heart muscle weakness the majority of such patient are aged and over and produce le vitamin d naturally from exposure to sunlight than younger people the team studied patient who were already following treatment for heart failure such a betablockers which regulate heart rate aceinhibitors which improve heart function and keep blood pressure down and pacemaker the study found that in the patient who took vitamin d every day for a year the heart pumping function increased from to those who took a placebo saw no improvement in heart function note that the patient were given noncalcium based supplement to avoid further complication the cardiologist evaluated heart function by measuring whats known a the ejection fraction the amount of blood pumped by the heart with each heartbeat for a healthy person this is usually between and for patient in the study the average ejection fraction wa in conclusion the researcher consider that heart failure patient may be able to start taking a vitamin d supplement on a regular basis this may reduce the need for fitting implantable cardioverter defibrillator icds in certain patient this costly operation implant a device that detects irregular heart rhythm and shock the heart to restore a normal rhythm heart failure affect million people worldwide and more than half of sufferer are aged or older natural source of vitamin d include egg dairy product oily fish sardine mackerel calf liver and cod liver oil apr http nationalaffairsinindiablogspotcom vitamindimprovescardiacfunctioninhtml

i wa readmitted to the hospital when my th baby wa day old and i wa in full blown congestive heart failure it wa super scary and no one could figure out why it happened i lost pound of fluid in hour in the hospital thankfully i recovered without any damage about month later i started having joint pain having kid age and under i ignored it and went on with my life assuming it wa my hormone normalizing after delivery then i went on vacation for a week with my mom and she wa shocked at my limping and being unable to open thing every day she insisted she would take me to the doctor when we got home so the following week i made an appt and my mom literally picked me up from my house and took me to the doctor to make sure i would go the doc agreed that it wa likely just hormone related after pregnancy by ordered lab and my rf factor came back high then i saw a rheumatologist and still wasnt convinced that everything else wa ruled out so before starting the methotrexate i waited to get a second opinion from a harvard trained rheumatologist in miami he ordered a ton of more blood work but in the end agreed with the diagnosis and the starting methotrexate and so that is what i did that wa almost year ago i took my first dose of enbrel day ago and i may feel a little improved today i wont believe it till it continues but your story give me hope thank you jun http communitybabycentercom post a justtookmyfirstdoseofenbrelc

there currently no treatment for cardiac fibrosis a leading cause of heart failure but new research suggests there may be a way to prevent it the study found specific trigger that activate the development of fibrosis blocking the trigger through the use of a bile acid prevented cardiac fibrosis from occurring according to result in a preclinical model the bottom line is that this show for the first time that cardiac fibrosis is preventable this is something that nobody ha ever seen before say marek michalak coprincipal investigator and a professor in biochemistry at the university of alberta cardiac fibrosis is considered a permanent remodeling of the heart inevitably it lead to heart failure and eventually death the bottom line is that this show for the first time that cardiac fibrosis is preventable luis agellon coprincipal investigator and a professor at mcgill university school of dietetics and human nutrition say the finding offer hope to those who are living with heart failure prevention of fibrosis will extend the ability of the heart to continue to function even if at a reduced capacity currently patient with heart failure have poor quality of life and a dismal prognosis improving their quality of life will do wonder for these individual say agellon fibrosis is an early step on the path to heart failure once a person is diagnosed with heart failure about percent will die within the first year next step clinical trial cardiac fibrosis itself is caused by a variety of factor including high blood pressure overwork of cardiac muscle and longterm consumption of a diet that is high in both saturated fat and sugarall cause increased stress to heart cell individual with diabetes cancer patient undergoing chemotherapy and heart transplant recipient are also known to be at high risk it almost like building a scar say michalak it exactly the same type of biological activity but it happening in the tissue in the heart it destroys the ability of the heart to function normally heart risk spike after week of sugary drink the team is now pushing forward with additional study to see if the same therapeutic effect can be achieved in human they also aim to gain a better understanding of exactly how bile acid can prevent cardiac fibrosis from occurring we dont yet have a full understandingnobody doesof how the bile acid actually doe what it doe in heart cell explains michalak so another phase of the work is to find out what actually happens within heart cell at the molecular level how can this bile acid affect the heart in such a dramatic way once that occurs the team hope to work with cardiologist to quickly move the research into clinical trial involving chemotherapy and heart transplant patient if cardiac fibrosis can be stopped then that could substantially improve the outcome for people at risk say agellon this would be a significant advance in the fight against heart disease the canadian institute of health research funded the study which appears in plo one source mcgill university the post bile acid might prevent deadly heart scar appeared first on futurity jul http wwwfuturityorg cardiacfibrosisbileacid

by jovonni spinner mph ches every february we celebrate black history month a time to reflect celebrate and honor the contribution of africanamerican to our society we know that achieving and maintaining good health is a longstanding issue for this group many of whom may experience worse health outcome in critical area like heart disease and diabetes but we want to focus on the positive and provide consumer with health education material to support healthy behavior change it true that the health equity gap ha narrowed over time but there is still significant room for improvement here are few thing that the fda and the office of minority health omh have done over the past year to reduce health disparity public engagement more than million black africanamericans are on social medium and we want to meet consumer where they are so were using facebook twitter and other social medium platform and electronic communication eg our newsletter and eblasts to educate african american on issue such a heart disease diabetes and sickle cell disease among others and also provide tangible solution to help manage these chronic condition for example to mark american heart month in february we developed a social medium toolkit to help our stakeholder engage with their member and partnered with the association of black cardiologist to spearhead an ilovemyheart social medium campaign stakeholder engagement we have cultivated relationship with a core set of partner to better understand their health need aligned our priority to meet those need and worked together to leverage each others resource for the common good by doing so weve increased our stakeholder capacity to communicate with the agency on regulatory issue for example multicultural stakeholder are now better able to make their voice heard in fdasponsored public meeting and on open docket minority health research we worked with academia to fund africanamericanbased research project eg hiv aid and triple negative breast cancer and research fellow working on topic like genomics and digital communication this allows u to increase the knowledge base on these issue and ensure a diverse workforce is in place to solve these complex health problem resource we have taken care to tailor our health education resource such a infographics and fact sheet to african american our website ha valuable information on sickle cell disease and lupus both of which affect african american more than any other racial ethnic group clinical trial diversity did you know that sometimes minority population may respond differently to medical product one example is an fdaapproved heart failure medication that reduces the risk of death and hospitalization in people with certain type of longlasting chronic heart failure during clinical trial it wa found there wa an increased risk of an allergic reaction called angioedema in black in this trial only of the participant were black even though black represent of the u population and experience heart failure at rate higher than the rest of the population this is why we continue to work toward increasing clinical trial diversity to ensure that medical product are safe and effective for everyone president obama ha said if youre walking down the right path and youre willing to keep walking eventually youll make progress omh will continue walking down the path to improving health equity and we want you to join u because this work cannot be done alone visit fda omh at wwwfdagov minorityhealth follow u on twitter fdaomh jovonni r spinner mph ches is a public health advisor in fda office of minority health feb http blogsfdagov fdavoice indexphp whatisfdadoingtoimprovethehealthofafricanamericans
