hospital pharmaceutical refer to medication and drug that are primarily sold at clinic hospital and other healthcare facility rising incidence of acute and chronic disease all over the world is the main factor that drive the market for hospital pharmaceutical hospital pharmaceutical do not include any type of skilled nursing facility such drug that fall within the hospital pharmaceutical category could be anything from pain killer or drug prescribed for easing minor ache and pain to drug that are prescribed for chronic and serious disease such a cancer blood pressure and diabetes in the united state an approximate u million is spent annually on purchase of several pharmaceutical product via pharmacy besides hospital and clinic hospital pharmaceutical are also sold through several other distribution channel such a mail order and retail outlet browse full report with toc http wwwtransparencymarketresearchcom hospitalpharmaceuticalsmarkethtml according to a report published by transparency market research the global hospital pharmaceutical market is expected to decline at cagr between and thereby reporting a value of u million by from u million in why are anticholinergic agent losing market share the global hospital pharmaceutical market is segmented on the basis of key therapeutic case indication and geography on the basis of therapeutic case the global hospital pharmaceutical market is categorized into infection pain neurology nephrology and urology oncology and cardiology the market for neurology is further classified into antipsychotic drug antianxiety agent antidepressant drug and antimigraine drug based on indication the global market for hospital pharmaceutical is also segmented into nephrology and urology oncology cardiology pain infection and neurology the nephrology and urology segment cover illness such a acute kidney failure diabetes glomerular disease and chronic kidney disease oncology segment cover different type of cancer such a prostrate colorectal lung and breast the cardiology segment is categorized into heart failure high blood pressure and stroke cancer pain neuropathic pain rheumatoid arthritis fibromyalgia and osteoarthritis are the different category under the pain segment the segment for infection is further subsegmented into amebiasis tuberculosis candida infection fungal meningitis and others in the oncology segment held the highest share in the overall hospital pharmaceutical market followed by the segment for cardiovascular disease with the cardiovascular segment the anticholinergic agent is exhibiting a rapidly declining rate of growth this can be attributed to the loss of exclusivity of fast selling medication and drug such a enablex and vesicare what drive the hospital pharmaceutical market in emerging economy geographically the global hospital pharmaceutical market is segmented into asia pacific north america europe and rest of the world the largest market share in the global hospital pharmaceutical market is held by north america however a per industry trend and market forecast it is anticipated that asia pacific will witness robust growth during the forecast period the anticipated expansion of this regional market can be attributed to factor such a rising incidence of cardiovascular anomaly and cancer case and rapidly growing population in emerging economy of asia pacific the hospital pharmaceutical market of latin america asia pacific the middle east and africa are essentially propelled by substantial growth of medical tourism it is expected that these region will also be driven by other factor such a greater awareness about branded medication and drug and greater proliferation of hospital in the forthcoming yearsthe leading company operating in the global hospital pharmaceutical market are sanofi aventis bayer ag eli lilly and company pfizer inc astrazeneca plc glaxosmithkline plc johnson johnson and merck co inc download report brochure http cheese or why the french were right the command say cheese is a phrase so commonly used to elicit a smile that today it is understood from the simple imperative cheese but prior to the s such photographic cajolery wa unknown indeed in the preceding victorian era the desirable beauty standard wa considered a tightly pursed orbicularis oris muscle whether because of poor dentition or the prim and proper societal norm of the time or some combination of both smile were only for child peasant and drunk and until very recently the prevailing conventional wisdom for healthy eating relegated consuming cheese to a failing of the ignorant simple or misguided from the late s through the s there wa a mandate from the expert and power that be to consume le fat and particularly saturated fat principally those derived from animal source such a meat poultry and dairy that admonishment ha continued to echo and drive our poor culinary choice over the ensuing halfcentury like an unresolved daddy issue an uncomplicated historical glance would have revealed that a modest living fermented food like real cheese had helped sustain and advance human kind across civilization and across the globe while a large portion of the world population is lactose intolerant and therefore unable to consume or potentially benefit from raw or fresh milk product cheese and particularly aged cheese are an exception the milk sugar or lactose is utilized by beneficial bacteria lactobacillus come to mind along with the fat most of which are saturated and protein and through the process of fermentation raw milk undergoes the transformation from raw milk product to cheese a certain cheese age there is often le lactose present so much so that for many even those who are lactose intolerant and unable to tolerate fresh milk such delicious pillow of probiotic loaded goodness can be enjoyed for the last half century real cheese have been discounted a part of a healthful approach to eating primarily because of their saturated fat and cholesterol content while the mediterranean diet wa promoted a an ideal dietary model the dairy aspect of this gastronomy wa shoved into a corner where it lingered and mouldered often unappreciated is the historical fact that fermented dairy had a long and prominent place in ancient diet such a the mediterranean this is because while fresh milk can be consumed it is quite perishable and much more valuable a a raw material raw milk can be turned into several product like cream butter yogurt kefir whey and cheese all of which have a substantially longer shelf life cheese reemerged from the shadow with the insight gleaned from the french paradox of the s the french who drank wine and consumed butter cream and over different kind of cheese most of which are ohsostinky good all these tasty bit that were verboten in the u at the time had significantly le cardiovascular disease it turn out it wa more than the wine a dietary approach like mediterranean style cuisine rich in natural wholesome and fermented food ha been shown to reduce generalized inflammation and stress oxidative stress and inflammation play major role in the onset and development of the diabetes and it precursor metabolic syndrome metabolic syndrome is diagnosed by the presence of central obesity and at least two of the following four additional factor high triglyceride low hdl or good cholesterol high blood pressure or increased fasting plasma glucose concentration data from the recent european prospective investigation into cancer and nutrition epic study examined healthy and diabetic participant from european nation the researcher found an inverse association between cheese fermented dairy consumption and the incidence of diabetes eating only g d total of cheese and or yogurt wa associated with a reduction in the incidence of type diabetes a new study just released revealed that just g daily of a parmesanlike italian cheese grana padano lowered blood pressure a effectively a the typically prescribed antihypertensive pharmaceutical this occurred even though the cheese contained the equivalent amount of sodium that would be found in consuming a ounce serving of potato chip previous study had isolated some particular tripeptides in certain type of cheese and demonstrated a relationship to being able to lower blood pressure these particular compound are formed through the interaction of human gastrointestinal enzyme and the gut microbiota these peptide complex have angiotensinconverting enzyme inhibiting property such ace inhibitor constitute an important class of medication that not only lower blood pressure but are a foundation of therapy from those suffering from cardiomyopathy or congestive heart failure from a variety of cause another study examined almost participant it examined the association between cheese consumption in various age group and circulating concentration of hdl or good cholesterol and triglyceride a negative risk factor for cardiovascular disease the more cheese consumed the higher the hdl and the lower the triglyceride the researcher suggested that this wa the result of the particular fatty acid composition of cheese and it inherent probiotic bacterial content the high protein and probiotic content of cheese is also believed to contribute to it almost neutral effect on plasma cholesterol even though cheese is high in cholesterol and saturated fat like so many other such natural foodstuff it impact on blood lipid and total cholesterol is negligible some kind of cheese namely those infected with penicillium such a roquefort stilton or gorgonzola exhibit high concentration of andrastins a b c and d these are potent inhibitor of the enzyme farnesyltransferase this enzyme play a key role in cholesterol synthesis and it inhibition decrease cholesterol production in fact while the total cholesterol is overall minimally unchanged some study suggest that consuming these type of food shift the cholesterol towards the le inflammatory le atherogenic type an interesting observation arises from these study the decrease in oxidative stress and inflammation marker is independent of body weight eating fat doe not make you fat nor are the benefit simply the result of losing weight or caloric consideration the healthful effect also occur quite rapidly which suggests not just a correlation but a causation oligosaccharide which are also present in cheese are prebiotics this is the food that sustains a healthy gut microbiota it is what feed the wee beasties cheese which contain both prebiotics and probiotic become that gut microbiome superfood a synbiotic another recently completed study demonstrated the cheese consumption directly altered the gut microbiome in an extremely favorable way certain gut bacteria are associated with the production of a compound known a trimethylaminenoxide or tmao the bacteria produce this compound in response to the dietary ingestion of choline level of tmao have been found to correlate and are directly predictive of cardiovascular risk the consumption of cheese rapidly altered the composition of the gut microbiome there wa significantly le tmao produced the positive change to the gut microbiome associated with the regular consumption of such a powerful wholesome naturally fermented synbiotic food a cheese may explain the relatively low incidence of cardiovascular disease in high cheese consumption country canned smile and canned cheese dont cut it for that unique stinky goodness and real wellbeing only real cheese is the real deal smile and cut the cheese http wwwpsychologytodaycom graham may http thelowcarbdiabeticblogspotcom forgoodhealthsaycheesepleasehtml

aka rock bottom hello world im jay bee this is the me against me project blog get ready for runon sentence should you look around youll notice that this isnt the first blog entry for my project but it will be my final attempt a last doover if you will to overcome my many issue while chronicling my journey in an effort to showcase the seriousness of these issue the reality of what binge eating disorder look like that it real the physical repercussion of having bed the confusion of trying to figure out the best way to get healthy the overpowering stress of it all and the sometimes lack of available help to treat and defeat my particular form of mental physical illness see i warned you about runon sentence get ready for more i am completely worn out mentally physically spiritually from my dealing with mental illness for what feel like forever ive tried so many time to get healthy and having ultimately failed every single time another failure will most like result in well let not think of that right now considering how young i am it crazy to think of just how sick weak and old i feel some of the stuff i am dealing with physically doesnt usually occur in people until they are much older and have lived a long life of beating themselves up with poor diet drinking and smoking with my mental health issue and the resulting physical problem that stem from never overcoming those issue i exist within an incredibly dangerous combination of crap perfect for an early death the great list of issue binge eating disorder bed panic disorder kinda like having anxiety problem but this version is constant and relentless in it pursuit to rob you of any sort of peace and happiness you become a distant sort of robot chronic depression when youre happy youre normal when youre sad youre very sad morbidly obese weighing a much a lb massive list of physical issue due to so many year of battling food addiction extreme weight change the constant stress from everything mentioned above type diabetes the only time im happy to settle for not being number one sleep apnea slightly enlarged heart due to the sleep apnea morbid obesity and diabetes high blood pressure constantly dizzy lightheaded highly inflammatory body in the danger zone for heart attack stroke extreme acid reflux weakened and inflamed throat esophagus sinus airway lung from choking on acid in my sleep super fun way to wake up in the middle of the night skin disorder developed from poor diet high sugar in blood psoriasislike vision issue high blood pressure and diabetes are making my vision fade quickly bone joint issue hip popping out randomly tightness everywhere straight neck compressed lower back it all cause lot of numbness inability to move without pain or just not being able to move at all back muscle issue lower back get strained pulled constantly cant move cant walk constantly winded feeling sick im always out of breath and feel dizzy or sick just talking make me winded sometimes flushed face feel hot face always look oddly red and flushed in comparison to the rest of my body around my eye and my face always feel hot and somewhat numb to the touch persistent liver gallbladder pain something is going on in my liver gallbladder pancreas area the area is painful most of the time now and i have symptom of some scary stuff going onhonestly there are probably more issue than that but whatever you get the idea at this point the deck is definitely stacked against me the odds of a full recovery are not in my favor im sure if youre of a more rational and sane mind youre probably thinking how the hell did you let yourself get that sick that fat that unhealthy well thats what make all of this so tricky it the necessary part of bed food addiction which mental health professional still wont officially say exists that make them bonafide mental illness you cant overcome them alone and or you have to reach your own version of rock bottom to truly be able to get better even if you have moment where you can kinda see it like that guy in the predator movie there something in those tree you can try to get healthy lose weight work out but ultimately you fail you usually gain even more weight than before along with new accompanying physical problem that make a sedentary lifestyle feel most comfortable and your bed food addiction gain a much greater hold over you you fall into an even deeper and darker hole and you feel almost powerless to try and overcome yourself your disease i have tried so many time to figure out this puzzle up until almost two year ago there wa virtually no help for someone with binge eating disorder it wa just recently officially recognized a a mental illness important side note doctor can be really dumb so beware if you were going to get any help at all you had to be assigned an illness you didnt actually have they diagnosed me a bulimic even though i told them i never vomit or you had to pay out of pocket for an extremely expensive treatment facility but the chance of that fancy facility accepting male wa virtually zero so if you were a guy with bed you were basically screwed now thing are a little different since bed wa officially claimed a a mental illness there are a couple commercial about bed one of which is specifically trying to sell you some poisoned pill ill get into that another time there a nice website called neda that offer some assistance to those looking to find help for bed though there wa no place near me when i last checked and health insurance ha to accept your claim of being mentally ill now thus provide you with assistance getting help a for me i am at a place where ive finally accepting that i can not in any way overcome my illness without serious help from mental health professional ive actually always known that but until recently i never had a way to get the help that i so desperately needed where i mean im finally accepting that i am helpless is in the following ive been trying to get myself clean by getting on a healthy cleanse diet and overcoming the intense physical withdrawal i feel when i stop eating sugary and badcarb food for me food addiction is no joke i get very sick for nearly a week with some wicked physically mental withdrawal for the last four month each time ive attempted this diet i have failed i have allowed that failure to hold myself back from admitting myself into an eating disorder clinic this is where i am giving in i see that the selfsabotage part of my mind ha been holding me back with this need to get clean before entering treatment it been kind of a convenient excuse for the repetitive bingeinducing diet failure ive been repeating for the last few month now no more prepping for my admittance to treatment tomorrow i will be in contact with an eating disorder clinic to set up my admittance asap so there it is now were all basically on the same page you know exactly what all im dealing with over the next however long it take to get healthy ill be posting daily blog regular vlogs on my youtube channel and random thought update etc on facebook twitter ill include the link to everything on this page so feel free to follow along like subscribe and all that good stuff if you or anyone you know is struggling with binge eating disorder be sure to go to neda to find some helpful info and a free hotline to call a for following along with my project maybe youll discover something that help you find your own way toward getting healthy or at least youll realize that bed and food addiction are both very real and very dangerous im definitely not doing any of this for popularity it actually quite humiliating to share all of this i hope to be an example for the million of people that knowingly or unknowingly struggle fda approves valsartan sacubitril entresto combination for heart failure michael oriordan july bethesda md the u food and drug administration fda ha now approved the combination tablet valsartan sacubitril entresto novartis for the treatment of patient with heart failure the combination drug formerly known a lcz is the first approved agent in the angiotensin receptorneprilysin inhibitor arni class and exerts it effect within and beyond the reninangiotensin system chemically the agent consists of the angiotensinreceptor blocker valsartan affixed to the neprilysin inhibitor sacubitril the u approval is based on result of the prospective comparison of arni with acei to determine impact on global mortality and morbidity in heart failure paradigmhf trial a study reported by heartwire from medscape when it wa presented at the european society of cardiology congress in barcelona spain in paradigmhf a study that included more than chronicheartfailure patient treatment with the valsartan sacubitril combination significantly reduced cardiovascular death or heartfailure hospitalization the study primary end point by compared with treatment with the ace inhibitor enalapril alone allcause mortality a secondary end point wa also significantly reduced with the arni when compared with enalapril entresto wa reviewed under the agency priority review program the expedited review process is intended for new drug developed to treat a serious disease or those that provide a significant improvement over existing therapy in addition the agency awarded the drug a fasttrack designation a process reserved for new drug that treat a serious condition such a heart failure and filled an unmet medical need a reported by heartwire heartfailure expert are enthusiastic about the prospect of the arni believing it represents the future cornerstone of chronicheartfailure therapy the new canadian heart failure guideline have already been updated and include recommendation on when and how to use the new agent in clinical practice reference food and drug administration fda approves new drug to treat heart failure press release july available here medscape llc cite this article fda approves valsartan sacubitril entresto combination for heart failure medscape jul p this product should not be taken with ace inhibitor such a captopril enalapril since your risk of serious side effect may increase do not take this product for at least hour before or after taking an ace inhibitor consult your doctor or pharmacist for more detail apr http wwwicdsupportgrouporg board viewtopicphpftp

newswise april low level of total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d can help predict a person risk of major adverse cardiovascular event such a a heart attack stroke heart failure or death according to a firstofitskind study from the intermountain medical center heart institute in salt lake city our study found that low level of both total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d appear to be associated with poor cardiovascular outcome said lead author heidi may phd msph a cardiovascular epidemiologist with the intermountain medical center heart institute the study evaluated participant between the age of and a quarter of the study participant were diabetic and percent had coronary artery disease clinician tested participant vitamin d metabolite level which included component of vitamin d that are formed during metabolism to determine the metabolite association with future major adverse cardiovascular event bioavailable vitamin d result from vitamin d being absorbed into the blood stream without binding to surrounding protein during metabolism only percent of total vitamin d is available in the body to act on target cell a most are bound to vitamin d binding protein therefore evaluating whether the proportion of vitamin d that can be used may be important a only unbound vitamin d such a bioavailable vitamin d is available to act on target cell the study tested many different type of vitamin d but found that measuring total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d were the most accurate in predicting harmful cardiovascular event this study is the first research that evaluates the association of vitamin d metabolite with cardiovascular event said dr may and evaluating usable vitamin d could mean the difference on the amount of vitamin d prescribed if it prescribed at all the study expands on the result of several observational study including some performed at intermountain healthcare but researcher recommend conducting more study on noncaucasian population because past research show vitamin d metabolite affect caucasian and noncaucasian race differently other member of the intermountain medical center heart institute research team included oxana galenko phd john f carlquist phd lindell k weaver md stacey knight phd tyler barker phd and brent j muhlestein md intermountain medical center is the flagship facility for the intermountain healthcare system which is based in salt lake city apr http todaysseniorsnetworkseniorhealthblogspotcom lowlevelsoftwocomponentsofvitaminhtml

a daily dose of natural vitamin d known a vitamin d improves heart function in people with chronic heart failure research by the university of leeds ha found dr klaus witte from leeds teaching hospital nh trust led the study known a vindicate he said this is a significant breakthrough for patient it is the first evidence that vitamin d can improve heart function of people with heart muscle weakness known a heart failure these finding could make a significant difference to the care of heart failure patient vitamin d can be boosted by exposure to sunlight but heart failure patient are often deficient in it even during the summer because older people make le vitamin d in response to sunlight than younger people the study author said vitamin d production in the skin is also reduced by sunscreen the study which wa funded by the medical research council involved more than patient from leeds who were already being treated for their heart failure using proven treatment including betablockers aceinhibitors and pacemaker participant were asked to take vitamin d or a dummy placebo tablet for one year those patient who took vitamin d experienced an improvement in heart function which wa not seen in those who took a placebo change in heart function were measured by cardiac ultrasound heart specialist measure heart function by taking an ultrasound scan of the heart known a an echocardiogram and measuring how much blood pump from the heart with each heartbeat known a ejection fraction the ejection fraction of a healthy person is usually between and in heart failure patient the ejection fraction is often significantly impaired in the patient enrolled into the vindicate study the average ejection fraction wa in the patient who took vitamin d the heart pumping function improved from to in the others who took placebo there wa no change in cardiac function this mean that for some heart disease patient taking vitamin d regularly may lessen the need for them to be fitted with an implantable cardioverter defibrillator icd a device which detects dangerous irregular heart rhythm and can shock the heart to restore a normal rhythm icds are expensive and involve an operation said dr witte if we can avoid an icd implant in just a few patient then that is a boost to patient and the nh a a whole one key aspect of this study is that the researcher avoided using a calciumbased supplement a calcium can cause further problem for heart failure patient heart failure affect about people in the uk and more than million worldwide the condition can affect people of all age but it is more common in older people more than half of all people globally with heart failure are over the age of this feed and it content are the property of the huffington post and use is subject to our term it may be used for personal consumption but may not be distributed on a website apr http wwwhuffingtonpostcouk left to right tommie deitz uncle danny deitz terry deitz father kayla deitz sister pam deitz aunt and trish deitz mother in september simsbury connecticut high school junior danny deitz had a heart transplant after a few month of rest and recovery he now back at school returned to the gym and is spending quality time with his friend danny share what he learned throughout his experience with cardiomyopathy and heart failure all in all life been really great i went back to school four week ago getting back into the work wa a bit tough at first i had been doing one hour of tutoring a day and now im in school six hour a day but im getting used to it im basically doing everything i used to and it nice to be back in that routine it got kind of boring sitting at home all the time while my friend were at school but i had friend over on the weekend and it made me appreciate the little thing more being at home with family thats really important a new normal life pretty much back to normal but it a new normal i have to take medication every day which is new but not too complicated i just bring a water bottle with me to school and take my pill after class we all have alarm on our phone the whole family so i see the alarm and then a few second later i get a text from my mom a for followup appointment in boston ive gotten used to the long drive i sleep most of the way we have to leave the house around am for a am appointment in boston at first the appointment were twice a week then once a week then twice a month and now i go once a month people ask me lot of question one i get a lot is have your taste bud changed at all apparently that can happen a lot to transplant recipient but i havent noticed any strange new craving yet i also am restricted from drinking alcohol and eating grapefruit since im not old enough to drink that doesnt really affect me much and i dont really like grapefruit although now that i cant have it anymore i kind of want one looking ahead it great to be working up a sweat again but i know i can never play football all out again like i used to i may be able to be a kicker on our team next fall though and im discovering new sport to try like golf paddle tennis and basketball ill be a senior next year so im just starting to look at college im not sure what i will study just yet but im pretty artistic so im thinking about architecture im not tied down to this region which is great because ive been looking a far out a california my doctor say i can go to college anywhere i want i want to give back throughout this whole process ive learned a lot about cardiomyopathy heart failure and organ donation this spring i will attend the donate life gala and am also working with the american heart association on promoting awareness of heart disease in young people when most people think about heart disease they think about older adult but it can really affect all age in a variety of way my family also started a fund called danny strong that raise money for cardiomyopathy research and patient care at the boston childrens heart center i just found out that my heart is in the basement of boston childrens hospital now a a specimen it made me feel good because the people there dr kevin daly dr betsy blume all of the nurse in the cardiac intensive care unit theyve given me the best treatment i want to give back learn more about the cardiomyopathy program the post a new normal life after pediatric heart transplant appeared first on thriving blog feb http thrivingchildrenshospitalorg newnormallifepediatrichearttransplant utmsourcefeedburnerutmmediumfeedutmcampaignfeedachildrenshospitalblogthrivingcchildrenshospitalbostonspediatrichealthblog

i have known my entire life that i would one day adopt a little asian girl god put it in my heart when i wa just a child it wasnt until year ago that he turned that tiny inkling in to a burning desire and we starting looking for her i had been receiving email from our adoption agency regularly with bios and picture of waiting kid in china but it wasnt until late one saturday night that i saw her face i opened up an email fully expecting to glance at it and then hit delete when i saw her her name wa audrey she wa year old and had a congenital heart defect thats all i knew that at moment and thats all i needed i immediately sent the email to my husband who wa working rdshift he answered right away with a simple cute a a button let go get her i requested more info from our agency and tried to understand her condition a best i could she wa born with tetralogy of fallot and had surgery to repair it at around year she had some delay but other wise seemed fine little did we know god wa just protecting u and giving u just enough info at the time he knew just what we needed to say yes to this child and im so glad we did day after bringing her home we went to the cardiologist for a checkup however that checkup turned into a month long hospital stay we found out that day that she wa in heart failure and needed surgery immediately her heart wa so bad that our doctor were not even sure how thing would go but god knew she came through that surgery like a champ and never even needed the ecmo machine which they told u she would it wa the coming day turned into week turned into month that were the hardest her heart had been so bad for so long that the rest of her body had no idea how to respond cvicu became out new home im not going to lie it sucked there were day when we wondered if she would ever open her eye again but even in the midst of that i knew she wa worth it if she never walked out of that hospital again i knew she wa worth it all looking back now i can see just how god wa with u each step of the way and more importantly how he wa with audrey he kept her alive for year while she waited for her family he kept that desire burning in my heart until i found her people often say to me you saved her life but i can honestly say no she saved mine my faith is stronger than it ha ever been she ha shown me what it mean to be an overcomer she is brave she is mighty she is stubborn a all get out and i wouldnt trade her for the world she is our daughter god knew long before i ever did he wa just waiting on me to step out of the boat dont let the fear of the unknown keep you from saying yes to a child god is bigger than all of it and all you have to do is trust him wwwlaurastoutphotographycom feb http daysofheartsblogspotcom dayaudreystouthtml

chennai frontier hospital to make artificial heart city hospital frontier lifeline medical science park frontier mediville is all set to manufacture mechanical artificial heart in association with a firm in russiawe have signed a memorandum of understanding with a russian manufacturer who make the device sputnik to manufacture artificial heart these heart also known a left ventricular assistive device are generally used in case of heart failure where patient are awaiting a transplantthey help pump blood from the heart to the rest of the body the latest such device the heartmate manufactured in the united state cost around r lakh we are hoping to manufacture such a device within r lakh making it affordable for people in india said k m cherian chairman frontier lifeline at a press meet on wednesday at present dr cherian said the committee for the purpose of control and supervision of experiment on animal had given their facility permission to conduct trial so that manufacture of the device can beginthe artificial heart will be an implantable device which mean the patient can leave the hospital while awaiting a transplant or in some case may not need a transplant at all if the heart recovers dr cherian said the hospital will also soon begin phase iii of it clinical trial to evaluate the safety and efficacy of xenograft valve for the heart valve sourced from animalsabout heart valve replacement are performed annually in the country said dr cherian most of these he said use imported mechanical valve with price ranging from r ttk chitra an indigenous mechanical heart valve which is cheaper is used too but mechanical valve dr cherian said require lifelong anticoagulation necessitating frequent blood testingthe hospital heart valve trial involves biological and bioprosthetic valve which do not require anticoagulation and do not have sudden failure like mechanical valve making them more desirable he said the biological prosthesis are of three kind the porcine pulmonary artery the bovine jugular vein and the bovine pericardium said dr cherian these valve are harvested from abattoir in hyderabad and kerala with sterile precaution and have now been used in patient in phase ii of the hospital clinical trial he said over per cent of them are alive and doing well he said phase iii of the trial will be multicentric with the valve supplied by the hospital used in surgery at aiims new delhi and pgi chandigarh involving a total of trial subject if all go well the hospital will begin commercial manufacture of these valve and they will cost around r said dr cherianthe hospital is also in collaboration with georgia institute of technology u to develop an indigenous bioprosthetic heart valve scientist from the institute will train mediville staff to manufacture this prof john kurakar jun http profkurakarblogspotcom chennaifrontierhospitaltomakehtmlutmsourcefeedburnerutmmediumfeedutmcampaignfeedawindowofknowledgewindowofknowledge

metformincontaining drug drug safety communication revised warning for certain patient with reduced kidney function audience pharmacy nephrology internal medicine patient issue fda is requiring labeling change regarding the recommendation for metformincontaining medicine for diabetes to expand metformin use in certain patient with reduced kidney function the current labeling strongly recommends against use of metformin in some patient whose kidney do not work normally fda wa asked to review numerous medical study regarding the safety of metformin use in patient with mild to moderate impairment in kidney function and to change the measure of kidney function in the metformin drug labeling that is used to determine whether a patient can receive metformin fda concluded from the review of study published in the medical literature that metformin can be used safely in patient with mild impairment in kidney function and in some patient with moderate impairment in kidney function fda is requiring change to the metformin labeling to reflect this new information and provide specific recommendation on the drug use in patient with mild to moderate kidney impairment fda is also requiring manufacturer to revise the labeling to recommend that the measure of kidney function used to determine whether a patient can receive metformin be changed from one based on a single laboratory parameter blood creatinine concentration to one that provides a better estimate of renal function ie glomerular filtration rate estimating equation egfr this is because in addition to blood creatinine concentration the glomerular filtration rate take into account additional parameter that are important such a the patient age gender race and or weight see the fda drug safety communication for additional information including a data summary and a list of metformincontaining drug background metformincontaining medicine are available by prescription only and are used along with diet and exercise to lower blood sugar level in patient with type diabetes when untreated type diabetes can lead to serious problem including blindness nerve and kidney damage and heart disease metformincontaining medicine are available a singleingredient product and also in combination with other drug used to treat diabetes the current drug labeling strongly recommends against metformin use in some patient whose kidney do not work normally because use of metformin in these patient can increase the risk of developing a serious and potentially deadly condition called lactic acidosis in which too much lactic acid build up in the blood recommendation healthcare professional should follow the latest recommendation when prescribing metformincontaining medicine to patient with impaired kidney function patient should talk to their health care professional if they have any question or concern about taking metformin the labeling recommendation on how and when kidney function is measured in patient receiving metformin will include the following information before starting metformin obtain the patient egfr metformin is contraindicated in patient with an egfr below ml minute m starting metformin in patient with an egfr between ml minute m is not recommended obtain an egfr at least annually in all patient taking metformin in patient at increased risk for the development of renal impairment such a the elderly renal function should be assessed more frequently in patient taking metformin whose egfr later fall below ml minute m as the benefit and risk of continuing treatment discontinue metformin if the patient egfr later fall below ml minute m discontinue metformin at the time of or before an iodinated contrast imaging procedure in patient with an egfr between and ml minute m in patient with a history of liver disease alcoholism or heart failure or in patient who will be administered intraarterial iodinated contrast reevaluate egfr hour after the imaging procedure restart metformin if renal function is stable healthcare professional and patient are encouraged to report adverse event or side effect related to the use of these product to the fda medwatch safety information and adverse event reporting program complete and submit the report online wwwfdagov medwatch report download form or call to request a reporting form then complete and return to the address on the preaddressed form or submit by fax to fda read the medwatch safety alert including a link to the full drug safety communication at http wwwfdagov safety medwatch safetyinformation safetyalertsforhumanmedicalproducts ucmhtm you are encouraged to report all serious adverse event and product quality problem to fda medwatch at wwwfdagov medwatch reporthtm follow medwatch on twitter update your subscription modify your email address or stop subscription at any time on your subscriber preference page you will need to use your email address to log in if you have question or problem with the subscription service please visit subscriberhelpgovdeliverycom this service is provided to you at no charge by u food drug administration fda this email wa sent to ostovarsinasinabloggercom using govdelivery on behalf of u food drug administration fda new hampshire ave silver spring md infofda apr http hackkadeblogspotcom fdamedwatchmetformincontainingdrugshtml

global cardiovascular drug delivery technology market and company report research and market april dublin april prnewswire research and market ha announced the addition of jain pharmabiotechs new report cardiovascular drug delivery technology market and company to their offering logo http photosprnewswirecom prnh logo the cardiovascular drug delivery market are estimated for the year to on the basis of epidemiology and total market for cardiovascular therapeutic the estimate take into consideration the anticipated advance and availability of various technology particularly drug delivery device in the future market for drugeluting stent are calculated separately role of drug delivery in developing cardiovascular market is defined and unmet need in cardiovascular drug delivery technology are identified cellselective targeted drug delivery ha emerged a one of the most significant area of biomedical engineering research to optimize the therapeutic efficacy of a drug by strictly localizing it pharmacological activity to a pathophysiologically relevant tissue system these concept have been applied to targeted drug delivery to the cardiovascular system device for drug delivery to the cardiovascular system are also described role of drug delivery in various cardiovascular disorder such a myocardial ischemia hypertension and hypercholesterolemia is discussed cardioprotection is also discussed some of the preparation and technology are also applicable to peripheral arterial disease controlled release system are based on chronopharmacology which deal with the effect of circadian biological rhythm on drug actionsa full chapter is devoted to drugeluting stent a treatment for restenosis following stenting of coronary arteriesfifteen company are involved in drugeluting stent new cellbased therapeutic strategy are being developed in response to the shortcoming of available treatment for heart disease potential repair by cell grafting or mobilizing endogenous cell hold particular attraction in heart disease where the meager capacity for cardiomyocyte proliferation likely contributes to the irreversibility of heart failure cell therapy approach include attempt to reinitiate cardiomyocyte proliferation in the adult conversion of fibroblast to contractile myocytes conversion of bone marrow stem cell into cardiomyocytes and transplantation of myocytes or other cell into injured myocardium advance in molecular pathophysiology of cardiovascular disease have brought gene therapy within the realm of possibility a a novel approach to treatment of these disease it is hoped that gene therapy will be le expensive and affordable because the technique involved are simpler than those involved in cardiac bypass surgery heart transplantation and stent implantation gene therapy would be a more physiologic approach to deliver vasoprotective molecule to the site of vascular lesion gene therapy is not only a sophisticated method of drug delivery it may at time need drug delivery device such a catheter for transfer of gene to various part of the cardiovascular system selected company that either develop technology for drug delivery to the cardiovascular system or product using these technology are profiled and collaboration between company are tabulated the bibliography includes selected reference from recent literature on this topic the report is supplemented with table and figure key topic covered executive summary cardiovascular disease method for drug delivery to the cardiovascular system cell therapy for cardiovascular disorder gene therapy for cardiovascular disorder drugeluting stent market for cardiovascular drug delivery company involved in cardiovascular drug delivery reference for more information visit http before taking any kind of iron supplement get your iron and ferritin level tested ferritin is a protein that store the iron and transport it throughout your body iron and ferritin are two different thing and both need to be tested in order to test for iron deficiency i have a high iron problem called hemochromatosis also known a iron overload iron overload is when the ferritin keep taking in the iron that youve consumed and instead of releasing it it storing it often to dangerous level if left untreated the iron will be deposited around your organ and it will cause thing like heart failure and liver cancer a person with iron overload can have their iron tested and appear anemic but they can have outrageously high ferritin level normal ferritin level are for men to nanogram per milliliter standard unit or to microgram per liter international unit for woman to nanogram per milliliter standard unit or to microgram per liter international unit when i wa diagnosed my ferritin level wa and i wa only imagine if i hadnt gone to the doctor complaining of fatigue what would my level be at now year later when other people are diagnosed their level are often over a potentially very dangerous level if left untreated most woman are diagnosed when theyre in menopause and men are generally diagnosed when theyre in their s im not trying to freak people out but iron overload is in one of every to people especially people of uk or eastern european descent despite it being so prevalent doctor will rarely test for it unless you give them a reason to i dont know why because if it untreated it will shorten your lifespan ive seen so many post about oh im so tired i must be anemic so im going to take an iron supplement and it drive me insane never take any kind of supplement without properly educating yourself on it iron overload literally ha some of the same symptom a anemia chronic fatigue joint pain abdominal pain liver disease cirrhosis liver cancer diabetes mellitus irregular heart rhythm heart attack or heart failure skin color change bronze ashengray green if found early like it wa in me youll be fine with no damage done so long a you periodically get blood drawn but if youre middle aged or older chance are the iron stored around your body ha already harmed you and it need to be taken care of immediately before anything worse come from it february pm edited pm feb http communitymyfitnesspalcom en discussion getyourirontested

bvericel announces positive topline result from phase b ixcelldcm clinical trial of ixmyelocelt in patient with heart failure due to ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy b study meet primary endpoint of reduction in clinical cardiac event cambridge mass march globe newswire vericel corporation nasdaqvcel a leading developer of patientspecific expanded cellular therapy for the treatment of severe disease and condition today announced topline result from the company phase b ixcelldcm clinical trial of ixmyelocelt in patient with advanced heart failure due to ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy dcm the trial met it primary endpoint of demonstrating a reduction in the total number of death cardiovascular hospitalization or unplanned outpatient and emergency department visit to treat acute decompensated heart failure during the month following treatment with ixmyelocelt compared to placebo all clinical event in the primary and secondary endpoint were adjudicated in a blinded fashion by an independent adjudication committee the incidence of adverse event including serious adverse event in patient treated with ixmyelocelt wa comparable to patient in the placebo group ixmyelocelt ha been granted orphan product designation by the u food and drug administration for use in the treatment of dcm the result of the ixcelldcm study which we believe is the largest randomized cell therapy trial to treat congestive heart failure completed to date demonstrated a statistically significant and clinically meaningful reduction in cardiac event in patient who received treatment with ixmyelocelt compared to placebo said dr david recker vericels chief medical officer we are very excited about these study result given the lack of treatment option for endstage heart failure patient the phase b ixcelldcm clinical trial is a multicenter randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled phase b study designed to as the efficacy safety and tolerability of ixmyelocelt compared to placebo when administered via transendocardial catheterbased injection to subject with endstage heart failure due to ischemic dcm who have no reasonable revascularization option either surgical or percutaneous interventional likely to provide clinical benefit the trial wa designed to provide approximately power to show a difference in cardiac event for ischemic dcm patient treated with ixmyelocelt compared to placebo a total of patient were treated in the ixcelldcm clinical trial at site in the united state the full data result from the ixcelldcm trial are scheduled to be presented at the upcoming latebreaking clinical trial session of the american college of cardiology th annual scientific session expo on april and also will be submitted for publication about dilated cardiomyopathy mar http in a close vote a committee of medical expert said today that eteplirsen a drug to treat duchenne muscular dystrophy ha not met the bar set by the fda for approval which could make the drug the third duchenne treatment in recent month to face fda rejection adding to the frustration of a tightknit and increasingly desperate community of patient and their advocate the committee one of many that help the fda evaluate drug for approval wrestled today with a question that in most other circumstance would never even merit consideration should the agency approve a drug based on one trial with just patient but the consideration wa serious because duchenne is a progressive fatal disease with no effective treatment or cure a throng of patient advocate and others more than strong showed up with more than making their case at today hearing in hyattsville md a suburb of washington dc that lasted more than hour even the fda top drug official made a rare appearance at the meeting weighing in with comment just before the vote still nearterm approval of eteplirsen developed by cambridge mabased sarepta therapeutic nasdaq srpt appears unlikely the recommendation of fda advisory panel are not binding but the agency typically side with the expert decision the member panel voted to that sarepta hasnt provided substantial evidence from adequate and wellcontrolled study that eteplirsen help duchenne patient body create enough dystrophinthe muscleprotecting protein they lackto predict a benefit just before the vote janet woodcock the director of the fda center for drug evaluation and research and a key decision maker on drug approval made clear that the matter at hand wa accelerated approval a process that allows the agency to green light drug on a thinner body of evidence the fda final decision due by may will have significant implication for both the drug industry and thousand of patient with duchenne approval risk setting a precedent for allowing drug onto the market with a bare minimum of human testing a rejection mean patient whose disease is a death sentence lose more time before a medicine is available i respect the fda caution in setting a precedent in approving new drug but our kid are not a precedent they are real live human being and they are short on time said debra miller the ceo of the nonprofit newport beach ca organization cureduchenne at the hearing an fda official once told me the worst thing we can do is approve a drug and then have to pull it off the market i argue that the worst thing we can do is deny access to a drug and then find out it workstoo late after we have lost a generation of child the implication of this panel were clear from the start william dunn the director of the agency division of neurology product noted that regardless of how urgently a drug is needed for duchenne the fda would not lower it approval standard nor would it take perverse delight in rejecting a drug he knew what wa coming emotion will run high dunn said child with duchenne their parent doctor and even some politician spoke nearly all pleading for the agency to approve the drug one young patient responding to the agency criticism of eteplirsens effectiveness called the drug amazing and life changing i can only guess you dont know anything about duchenne he said a applause rang out while the panel voted against eteplirsen woodcock comment seemed to leave the door open for more evaluation in devastating disease the consequence of this mistake can be extreme she said but most of these con are borne by the patient that said the agency ha already brushed patient and advocate pressure aside in rejecting two other duchenne drug that were close to approval in january the agency said no to drisapersen a drug from biomarin pharmaceutical nasdaq bmrn a month later it rejected an approval application from ptc therapeutic nasdaq ptct on a drug called ataluren both drisapersen and ataluren are meant to slow the grim march of duchenne in certain subgroup of patient the disease affect about people worldwide primarily boy typically robs them of the ability to walk by their teen and eventually kill them through one of a number of complication like respiratory or heart failure despite the pressing need for a duchenne therapy data from the biomarin and ptc drug just werent good enough for regulator the agency called biomarins drisapersen data inconsistent and in some case contradictory and said ptcs ataluren application wa not sufficiently complete to permit a substantive review both drug had failed phase clinical trial but the company claimed that posthoc analysis showed the drug were benefitting patient since the february rejection of ptc all eye have been on sarepta whose eteplirsen is also meant to slow the progression of duchenne in a subset of patientsa group with a specific genetic mutation about percent of those with the disease sareptas original january date with the advisory committee wa postponed by a snowstorm but a with ptc and biomarin sarepta face next page reprint share underwriter and partner apr http wwwxconomycom boston neartermfdanodunlikelyforduchennedrugafternegativevote

thank god i got here when i did yearold stacy rollins of napoleon ohio said during a recent checkup at the heart and vascular center at the university of toledo medical center a month ago ut health cardiothoracic surgeon dr mark bonnell saved her life by implanting a batterypowered blood pump inside her chest to take over for her failing heart stacy rollins talked with ut health cardiothoracic surgeon dr mark bonnell during a recent checkup she is sharing her story during american heart monthfebruary is american heart month and rollins is sharing her story to encourage other younger woman to take care of themselves and pay attention to early warning sign of heart failure i wa in pretty good shape but i had been under a lot of stress rollins said i started to feel terrible i couldnt breathe at night i couldnt go up the stair i wa coughing i thought it wa pneumonia turned out her heart wa barely pumping the cough wasnt a cold the fatigue and breathlessness were symptom of heart failure which can become rapidly fatal in rollins case she had familial idiopathic cardiomyopathy a weakening of the heart muscle that is inherited with unknown cause her only chance of survival wa a left ventricular assist device commonly known a an lvad it is a mechanical device that help pump blood to the rest of the body lvads can serve a a bridge to a heart transplant or in rare case a therapy for a patient a her heart heals the longest a patient ha lived with an lvad is eight year and counting nationally about percent or le of these lvads are taken out for recovery bonnell said here at utmc we have actually taken out almost percent of them ut health cardiologist dr samer khouri said heart disease risk factor include a poor diet lack of exercise and stress this is what you call lowintensity stress that is continuous unfortunately khouri said the cause can also be genetic khouri said woman especially younger woman more often ignore or mistake symptom of heart failure this is an age where many have child khouri said they are so busy they dont have time for themselves with more woman dying from heart disease than breast cancer and lung cancer combined rollins want others to know she is alive and healthy today because she responded to the subtle symptom of heart failure and asked for help i am grateful for my doctor and my life rollins said feb http utnewsutoledoedu indexphp yearoldwomanreceivesheartpumpimplantatutmc

by carolyn miller cpr is commonly known a cardiopulmonary resuscitation and is a technique of saving life that is mostly used in numerous emergency such a heart attack or cardiac arrest and drowning in these two instance a person breathing becomes very hard or basically someone heartbeat stop cpr training sacramento is mostly recommendable for those people living family member who have heart problem cardiopulmonary resuscitation basically is an emergency technique or procedure that usually provides enough oxygen and proper blood circulation for people going through cardiac arrest there are a variety of cpr procedure specifically meant for adult and child this article will look at cardiopulmonary resuscitation for adult simply because they are more prone to heart attack there are several process or procedure of cpr carried out for child and adult and such procedure are quite different from each other this article will mainly look at resuscitation that is done on adult the reason being adult are actually more exposed to danger of cardiac arrest than child when a person is really finding it hard to breath normally they should know they might be having cardiac symptom and need to be checked in advanced this article will major of resuscitation for grown adult the reason being cardiac arrest ha been seen so much on adult a compared to child breathing difficulty should never be treated or taken lightly a they may be the earlier sign of cardiac arrest a person heart muscle may suddenly stop and if those people near them have no training one can die this heart failure may prove to be fatal in case they are not helped immediately some of the basic symptom of such arrest are finding it hard to inhale unconsciousness gasping of air not breathing at all and having no pulse some heart attack consequently end up causing cardiac arrest there are quite a number of people in city sacramento ca who cannot clearly draw clear distinction between cardiac arrest and this heart attack when someone ha shown the above mentioned symptom they should immediately take their phone and dial seeking for an ambulance cpr can come in handy in preventing someone life from being lost while waiting for hospital ambulance to arrive this is how cardiopulmonary resuscitate an individual who is basically experiencing breathing difficulty and when their pulse is absent the technique will comprise of rescue breathing and also chest compression cpr that is done on adult can be approached in distinct way there is the full version and actually focus or concentrate on circulation breathing and airway and the other approach is hand only version that is most recommended for individual who do not have prior training if a person ha never received any form of cardiopulmonary resuscitation training they should only perform hand only that is according to recommendation from american heart association this will basically boost blood circulation consequently preventing death first thing to do is dialing after making the call push put some pressure on the victim chest using your hand heel the second approach is referred to a hand only version hand only is a method recommended to be conducted by person without prior training on such matter the recommendation wa done by american heart association about the author you can get a detailed summary of the factor to consider when picking a cpr training sacramento provider at http wwwrescuetraininginstitutecom right now feb http adltinfoblogspotcom thebasicimportanceofgettingcprhtml

source tldr click to show spoiler click again to hide los angeles afp nancy reagan devoted wife and trusted confidante to late president ronald reagan who became the most ardent guardian of his legacy died on sunday aged the former first lady who suffered heart failure at her home in los angeles will be buried next to her husband at the ronald reagan presidential library in simi valley california her spokeswoman joanne drake said late in life reagan earned praise for many of the very quality that saw her savaged by critic during ronald reagan two white house term from her fierce protectiveness and outsized influence on the president perceived a regal and cold she wa feared by white house aide who often found themselves butting head with her over policy and personnel appointment she made her own mark a first lady with her signature just say no drug awareness campaign launched in but after she left the white house a she nursed reagan through his tenyear descent into alzheimers disease until his death in america softened it view of the former movie starlet proud example warm tribute noting nancy reagan steadfast dedication to her husband poured in with president barack obama and wife michelle calling her a proud example we remain grateful for nancy reagan life thankful for her guidance and prayerful that she and her beloved husband are together again the obamas said in a statement former first lady barbara bush said she wa totally devoted to president reagan and we take comfort that they will be reunited once more former california governor and action movie star arnold schwarzenegger described her a one of my hero who served a first lady with unbelievable power class and grace nancy reagan the wife of a truly great president wa an amazing woman she will be missed said donald trump the frontrunner in the race to be the republican presidential candidate in november president reagan is viewed a something of a patron saint of conservative and the patriarch of the modern republican party and the diminutive former first lady ha wielded considerable political power a a succession of presidential hopeful have sought her endorsement born anne france robbins in new york on july and given the name nancy by her mother edith robbins reagan car salesman father left the family when she wa young edith toured the country a an actress marrying prominent neurosurgeon loyal davis and settling the family in chicago inspired by her mother nancy worked a an actress on stage and in film and television and met ronald reagan while under contract with mgm love story they married in after reagan divorced his first wife actress jane wyman beginning a marriage that ha been described a a love story to rival any that the couple acted out on the silver screen the pair who wrote passionate love letter to each other over the decade had two child patti born in and ron born in she made film in all including three after her marriage appearing alongside her husband just once in her last role in hellcat of the navy when reagan went into california politics in the s nancy recast herself a the ultimate political wife and confidante serving a his first lady there from only month after he took office a u president in reagan narrowly survived an assassination attempt that spurred nancy to take a keener role a her husband protector strictly controlling access to the president she sometimes set out to influence decisionmaking indirectly by taking her case to people her husband trusted other time her role took on a bizarre twist a she consulted astrologer to guide administration policy dragon when she get her hackle up she can be a dragon said former reagan chief of staff howard baker appointed after nancy reagan engineered the firing of his predecessor don regan in a interview nancy said she wa forced to exert her influence because her husband wa poorly served by his aide especially during the irancontra scandal that tarnished his reputation to the public nancy reagan became best known for her glamorous designer clothes hollywood friend and reported social climbing a well a her just say no antidrug campaign behind closed door her action were much more important nancy wasnt popular and she operated under cover usually through a surrogate columnist eleanor clift wrote year ago in the washington post clift said nancy instinct for moderation drew her into debate over everything from social policy to ussoviet relation a she tried to protect her husband from rightwing influence after the reagan left the white house in tellall book by regan and especially an unauthorized biography by kitty kelley cast nancy reagan in an unflattering light even alleging an affair with frank sinatra but in she played a key role in her husband widelypraised disclosure that he had alzheimers and became a vocal campaigner for awareness of the disease a his memory faded and he no longer recognized the woman he had loved for half a century nancy reagan again closed rank around him shielding him from public view and even from old friend to protect his image and dignity ronnies long journey ha finally taken him to a distant place where i can no longer reach him a rueful nancy reagan said at an alzheimers fundraiser year ago drillz click to show spoiler click again to hide mar http forumlowyatnet topic entry

by kevin barnes at some point in your life you have experienced pain in your body pain is not a disease on it own but it is a signal that your body ha a medical condition that need treatment it is common for one to make an offcounter purchase of drug that relieve pain but it is advisable to visit a doctor for an examination instead of overlooking pain you can consult a pain doctor houston professional for advice assessment and treatment there are several pain that you should not ignore a this article discus one of the pain that you should not overlook is severe morning headache a mild headache can go unnoticed but a severe headache denotes an acute health issue such a a brain tumor the condition is rare therefore you should not think of a brain tumor every time your head hurt in the morning the incidence of a primary brain tumor is usually below one percent severe stomach pain point to several health issue including ulcer discomfort that occurs between the navel and the breastbone is a sign to watch out for since it is usually suggestive this form of irritation is also known a a burning pain and it should be checked a soon a possible other common sign that accompany such irritation include discomfort in the stool and a better feeling when you take a meal blood clot and congestive heart failure have a common sign where one experience discomfort on leg the earlier sign is a swelling and painful discomfort on one leg whereas the other sign is swelling in both leg blood clot come after one ha a recent surgery or rest for a long time traveling on a plane or a car sometimes also result in having a blood clot sometimes you can have a severe back irritation that wake you up from a deep sleep at night not only is such an irritation disruptive to a restful night but it can also be a sign of fever or cancer especially if you have a family history of such condition it is tempting just to assume that the discomfort is out of the wear and tear of the body but it can be an indicator of more complex health condition having a painful discomfort that feel a if it is penetrating the back is a sign that you should never ignore sometimes it is a sign that your artery can be hardening gradually and that is why you experience the irritation one of the early indicator of diabetes is having a feeling of pin and needle in the foot a lot of people live with diabetes since they tend to ignore the feeling what follows after the feeling is numbness of the foot making a prompt visit to a specialist after having the pin and needle in the foot enables one to manage diabetes at it early stage having the discussed sign doe not necessarily mean that you have the medical condition that are associated with them however it is only a doctor who can confirm the nature of the resultant medical condition that the pain indicate therefore you should make a visit to a specialist to have the pain examined about the author if you are looking for the fact about pain doctor houston local can come to our web page today more detail are available at http myspinetherapycom now jul http exzrcisewaytoweightlossblogspotcom paindoctorhoustonprofessionalhtml

by john young obstructive sleep apnea is a sleep disorder characterized by intermittent interruption in breathing the affected individual ha to wake up every so often to breathe person with this problem tend to snore and are excessively tired and drowsy during the day due to lack of good quality of sleep there are a number of fact on obstructive sleep apnea richardson tx resident need to understand if they are struggling with this problem the underlying problem in this condition is excessive relaxation of throat muscle these muscle comprise those of the soft palate the tonsil and the uvula the relaxed muscle narrow the space that is used by inhaled air total obstruction occurs intermittently for a period of ten to twenty second causing arousal from sleep snoring is the resulting of vibrating loose muscle a air is forced through a number of factor have been shown to predispose to this condition excessive weight is one of them this risk factor is present in about of those affected it is believed to contribute to the problem due to increased fat deposition around the upper airway that subsequently lead to obstruction related to the same is the possession of large neck defined a a circumference of more than inch in woman and inch in men others are chronic nasal congestion smoking hypertension and diabetes if not treated this condition may lead to a number of complication cardiovascular problem result from reduced oxygenation of blood that in turn cause a strain on the heart the risk of hypertension heart failure and abnormal heart rhythm arrhythmia are increased another major complication is reduced productivity due to daytime fatigue child with the condition may have poorer academic performance compared to their peer the first step in dealing with this problem is to institute lifestyle change one of them is to lose excess weight if you have been classified a being overweight or obese other measure that can be undertaken easily include taking part in regular physical exercise reducing smoking and alcohol intake in case of nasal congestion steroid based nasal decongestant offer some benefit other treatment option are considered in case the lifestyle change prove ineffective there are a number of device that can be used to open up blocked airway and reduce the severity of obstruction you will need to see a dental specialist to get the device that is most appropriate in your case surgery may be used a a last resort the type of operation that is performed is dependent on the cause one of the commonly performed procedure is removal of loose tissue around the upper airway a procedure known a uvulopalatopharyngoplasty upp involves the removal of tonsil the uvula and a part of the soft palate this is considered a major operation that is done under general anesthesia jaw surgery is another alternative that help increase the space behind the tongue the most important thing about sleep apnea is to seek treatment early while the rate of complication is fairly low there is a profound effect on the quality of life of the affected person and their loved one fortunately lifestyle modification are effective in many of the person suffering from the condition about the author to seek treatment for obstructive sleep apnea richardson tx dental professional urge you to refer to the recommended clinic make an appointment online using this website http dentalandbeyondcom apr http fitnessbandsproblogspotcom somefactsonobstructivesleepapneahtml

a promised novartis entresto is a slow burner inverts typical sale pattern with faster uptake of the drug in europe than in the u novartis muchlauded new heart failure drug entresto ha sold more in europe than the u since launch turning the usual sale pattern on it head widely tipped to become a multibillion dollar brand entresto valsartan and sacubitril brought in just m in sale in the first quarter with greater prescribing momentum in eu market thanks largely to prescribing hurdle introduced by health insurer in the u we cautioned that uptake particularly in the u would be very slow at the beginning because access would be blocked said novartis pharma chief david epstein on the firm firstquarter result call however we remain confident that the sale of this product would be in the range of bn in reduced ejection heart failure it first approved indication he added despite stellar efficacy data from the paradigm trial managed care plan in the u have put hurdle in place including a requirement for prior authorisation that have made physician reluctant to write entresto prescription particularly for patient who are stable on current therapy based on it initial experience in the u novartis ha also focused it marketing effort in europe on heart failure patient with symptom ie those who are not stable and ha found that doctor are more likely to prescribe in these case novartis is predicting sale will start to accelerate in the second half of this year and drive the product to around m in sale for a a whole additional momentum could come from new indication including preserved ejection heart failure assuming the ongoing paragon trial is positive and postacute myocardial infarction while entresto is growing slowly novartis other main product launch cosentyx secukinumab for psoriasis ankylosing spondylitis and psoriatic arthritis is off to a good start with quarterly sale of m up from m in the same period of epstein pointed to particularly strong takeup in germany having already overtaken johnson johnson rival psoriasis drug stelara ustekinumab cosentyx is on course to topple abbvies humira adalimumab a the number one biologic brand in the german market he added interestingly he noted that with increased resistance to the use of highpriced new biologic drug in the u which often take the form of stepedits in which patient must exhaust other treatment option beforehand the situation in europe is freer in europe those stepedits do not exist which mean a patient can move immediately from oral therapy to cosentyx at the first biologic therapy he said cosentyx wa however a high point in a quarter undermined by generic competition to novartis cancer drug glivec gleevec imatinib with sale down to m and underperformance by eye health unit alcon net sale fell to bn in the quarter and novartis reported a reduction in operating income to bn article by apr http wwwpmlivecom pharmanews aspromisednovartisentrestoisaslowburner

there is also some evidence that the tea can protect against the formation of clotsthe primary cause of heart attack got cholesterol green tea ha been proven to reduce the bad cholesterol in your body while increasing the good cholesterol the powerful antioxidant in green teaepigallocatechin gallate egcg may inhibit absorption of cholesterol from the large intestine which prevents an increase in bad cholesterol from greasy unhealthy snack and drink research suggests that drinking at least five cup of green tea a day will help in reducing bad cholesterol it can make you smarter of course what can delay the deterioration caused by both alzheimers and parkinson disease there is even evidence that it can help against dementia a well study carried out on mouse showed that green tea protected brain cell from dying and restored damaged brain cell reduce the risk of cancer green tea is thought to kill cancer cell without damaging other cell and ha been shown to reduce the risk of certain cancer such a esophageal cancer pancreatic cancer and even oral cancer the egcg in the tea is the powerful antioxidant that can kill cancer cell by destroying the cell mitochondrion which slowly lead the cancer cell to die some say it could even become a possible alternative to chemotherapy improve oral health although many people avoid tea due to the staining effect on teeth green tea actually help your oral health a study published in the journal of periodontology found that the more green tea one drank the lower the risk of periodontal disease the catechin in tea help reduce inflammation in the body control bacteria that can cause dental condition like throat infection and lower the acidity of saliva and dental plaquewhich prevents cavity improves vision how doe green tea help your vision more antioxidant and catechin green tea can penetrate the tissue of eye to produce and absorb antioxidant a study published in the journal experimental eye research found green tea can actually prevent cataractinduced blindness protects your skin apparently green tea can also help with wrinkle and the sign of aging thanks to their antioxidant and antiinflammatory activity multiple study have proven that applying green tea topically even reduced sun damage manage diabetes study have shown that green tea also assist in stabilizing blood sugar in people with diabetes green tea regulates the
