diabetes medication containing saxagliptin and alogliptin drug safety communication risk of heart failure including onglyza saxagliptin kombiglyze xr saxagliptin and metformin extended release nesina alogliptin kazano alogliptin and metformin oseni alogliptin and pioglitazone audience pharmacy internal medicine patient endocrinology issue an fda safety review ha found that type diabetes medicine containing saxagliptin and alogliptin may increase the risk of heart failure particularly in patient who already have heart or kidney disease a a result fda is adding new warning to the drug label about this safety issue this communication is an update to the fda drug safety communication background saxagliptin and alogliptin are part of the class of dipeptidyl peptidase dpp inhibitor drug which are used with diet and exercise to lower blood sugar in adult with type diabetes fda evaluated two large clinical trial conducted in patient with heart disease these clinical trial were also discussed at the fda endocrinologic and metabolic drug advisory committee meeting in april each trial showed that more patient who received saxagliptin or alogliptincontaining medicine were hospitalized for heart failure compared to patient who received an inactive treatment called a placebo see data summary in the fda drug safety communication for additional information in the saxagliptin trial of patient who received the drug were hospitalized for heart failure versus of patient who received a placebo this is the same a out of every patient compared to out of every patient risk factor included a history of heart failure or kidney impairment in the alogliptin trial of alogliptintreated patient were hospitalized for heart failure versus in the placebo group this is the same a out of every patient compared to out of every patient recommendation health care professional should consider discontinuing medication containing saxagliptin and alogliptin in patient who develop heart failure and monitor their diabetes control if a patient blood sugar level is not wellcontrolled with their current treatment other diabetes medicine may be required patient taking these medicine should contact their health care professional right away if they develop sign and symptom of heart failure such a unusual shortness of breath during daily activity trouble breathing when lying down tiredness weakness or fatigue weight gain with swelling in the ankle foot leg or stomach patient should not stop taking their medicine without first talking to their health care professional healthcare professional and patient are encouraged to report adverse event or side effect related to the use of these product to the fda medwatch safety information and adverse event reporting program complete and submit the report online wwwfdagov medwatch report download form or call to request a reporting form then complete and return to the address on the preaddressed form or submit by fax to fda read the medwatch safety alert including a link to the fda drug safety communication at http wwwfdagov safety medwatch safetyinformation safetyalertsforhumanmedicalproducts ucmhtm while heart disease is the no killer for all american african american are at even higher risk for the disease african american men are at the highest risk for heart disease and more than percent of african american have high blood pressure a leading cause of heart disease and stroke altogether nearly percent of african american men and percent of african american woman have some form of cardiovascular disease that includes heart disease and stroke heart valve disease refers to a group of problem people experience with heart valve the gatekeeper that open and close so blood can circulate correctly into and out of the heart chamber heart valve disease is not always easily diagnosed some people experience no symptom at all while others show very noticeable symptom which can develop quickly if the condition is severe a heart valve diagnosis may seem overwhelming but with proper treatment most people are able to recover and return to a normal healthy lifestyle the american heart association and american stroke association aha asa recently launched a program designed to help the million of american diagnosed every year with heart valve disease the heart valve ambassador program is an effort to raise awareness about heart valve disease support others struggling with the disease and share available resource with patient and caregiver the aha asa ambassador make up a volunteerbased group of heart valve disease survivor and caregiver who are leader in the patient community a survivor they understand the physical emotional and social impact heart valve disease can have on patient and caregiver by sharing their personal experience the ambassador help those newly diagnosed with the disease understand what to expect and reassure them theyre not alone heart valve ambassador robert epps shared his personal story with me in order to offer help and hope to others the retired u coast guard sr chief petty officer underwent open heart surgery after his heart valve issue were detected during a regular checkup he went on to found the national organization for aortic awareness also joining him wa american heart association spokesperson eldrin lewis md mph who discussed more information about heart valve disease and the heart valve ambassador program take a listen to our chat below word for more information visit wwwheartorg heartvalves meet our guest eldrin lewis md mph dr eldrin lewis is in his th year a a faculty member in the cardiovascular division at brigham and woman hospital and is an associate professor of medicine at harvard medical school he wa one of the first recipient of the minority faculty development award which is a year award given to promising young physician with research potential he is involved with several large international clinical trial and ha approximately publication during his career he also received a grant from the robert wood johnson foundation to study the role of quality of life assessment in clinical decision making in patient with heart failure and several grant from the national institute of health dr lewis is immediate past chair of the american heart association heart failure and transplant committee and director of the cardiology clerkship for harvard medical school student who rotate at brigham and woman hospital he is also chair of the aha founder affiliate research committee and a member of the aha founder affiliate board of trustee dr lewis is an international expert in the area of quality of life and heart failure and serf on scientific committee to review grant for the american heart association and the fda task force for the standardization of definition for endpoint event in cardiovascular trial he is also an associate editor for circulationheart failure and serf on several editorial board of other journal robert epps raised in jersey city new jersey robert joined the u s coast guard at the age of at the age of robert largest artery the aorta tore three surgery and year later robert is a patient advocate for cardiovascular health passionate speaker author and hospital volunteer and the founder of the national organization for aortic awareness foundation his miraculous story ha been featured in ebony magazine newspaper the american heart association website and other national publication because of his reconstructed aorta he ha established the first aortic health foundation that focus on the entire aorta to raise public awareness of aortic health through his foundation robert work closely with the leading aortic expert sharing insight and experience and discussing common challenge and exploring creative solution through his c charity he conduct free aortic health awareness presentation for the local community robert is retired scpo of the u s coast guard an active member of the disabled american veteran mended heart inc toastmaster international a steering committee member and featured patient for the thoracic aortic disease coalition tadco he is a graduate of dale carnegie training and former culinary professional he and his wife of year have a yearold son and reside in chesapeake va heart disease the post new program helping african american at risk for heart disease appeared first on melisasource apr http wwwmelisasourcecom africanamericansheartdisease

took a similar med avandia which got pilloried by what i thought were baised interpretation of some study at a time when people were looking to dump on the pharmaceutical industry avandia did get the black box warning although later study have questioned whether it wa justifiedthe later study seeem to suggest maybe it is not so bad one poster here cm keyes if i have his name right swears by it and ha gone to fda hearing to testify in favor ot it i eventually stopped taking it because i had macular edema and one study showed that it could cause macular edema in out of patient taking it when i stopped i discovered that like metformin it really had very little effect on my personal blood sugar level incidcating that the problem it address wa not the source of my high blood sguar level both actos and avandia work by lowering insulin resistance at a cellular level so that the insulin that you have can more effectively transport the glujcose inyour blood to the cell of your muscle and organ both supplying you with energy and lowering your blood sugar when i started taking it these two were the only drug that specifically focused on that issue since then other drug have been developed some of which claim to address that a a secondary mode of action these newer drug however also carry the risk of dangerous side effect so it may be a case of pick your poision with most of them however including actos the incidence of the dangerous sideeffects is on a relatively small minority of the people taking them even if the potential is severe this is unlike metfoirmin which cause a minor side effect gastrointestinal distress very annoying but it disappears when you stop taking met on about half of all user with actos though afaik the edema usually in the ankle is a clear sign that one of the very rare side effect congestive heart failure is possibleso stop taking it however i dont know if there is any easy way to know if you would be one of the very small minortiy who might be bladder cancer in the long run apr http communitydiabetesorg t adultslivingwithtype actos mp highlight truem

a time to exercise reduces risk of day heart failure in a a study show that even a little exercise a day ha clear health benefit chair can kill something could have titled the newspaper of the time the discovery made in epidemiologist jerry morris this scottish researcher studied two type of worker other than london bus driver and collector both were men of similar social environment but the first heart attack suffered far more often than the latter the difference seemed to be that driver spent all day while sitting collector had to move constantly up and down the stair between the two floor of those vehicle after confirming the correlation had been observed he published their finding in the lancet in what is considered the first scientific evidence of the link between disease and physical inactivity since then many other scientific study have confirmed that exercise is good for health but how much is necessary to have benefit in a study published this week a group of swedish researcher after analyzing nearly people aged between and year old ha concluded that more than one hour of moderate exercise or half hour of intense exercise a day can reduce the risk of heart failure by the work which is now published in the journal circulation began in and included people who then did not suffer heart failure the swedish team of scientist found that more active a wa a person the lower their risk of autism this study ha also confirmed that although a greater amount of exercise provides greater benefit even low level of activity can have positive effect in addition to promoting exercise a part of a healthy lifestyle the article author researcher at the university of uppsala consider designing city in which walking or cycling move easy and safe can provide great health benefit the explanation for the benefit of physical activity occur among other thing because during exercise the muscle contract more frequently and power increasing blood flow to the artery this cause subtle change in the autonomic system that control the contraction and relaxation of the blood vessel and eventually reduce the number of resting heart rate lower stress and help to have a heart capable of beating in a wider range all these factor reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease in addition exercise ha been associated with a reduction of inflammation which is usually involved in disease such a arteriosclerosis exercise slims little although the link between exercise and health not arouse too many doubt not so with that between sport and thinning a motivation that often drive more people to move the state your artery in the case of moderate exercise if deemed to walk a kilometer consume about calorie a day five kilometer are traveled that would mean an extra intake of about calorie a day while quantity is important a kilo of fat contains about calorie thereby maintaining the usual diet weight loss process would be very slow and may produce demotivation for now it seems that the main method to lose weight and stay healthy one is to reduce the number of calorie consumed in any case a shown by the swedish study confirming previous work even a small amount of exercise that doe not make u sylph can help u be better a study led by chi pang wen national health research institute in taiwan analyzed the physical activity level of taiwan for eight year in this group they found that even people who did just minute of exercise a day were le likely to die in those eight year later and increased their life in three year on average compared to inactive people the article also mentioned that in addition to reducing the risk of heart disease the quarter of an hour of exercise could have avoided one in nine cancer death among those who did not perform any physical activity finally they tried to see if what happened wa that the most active people had overall a healthier lifestyle and it wa not when factor such a drinking alcohol or smoking were separated it wa observed that the benefit of sport for health were still present more information document doseresponse relation of total and leisuretime physical activity to risk of heart failure a prospective cohort study doi circheartfailure source daniel mediavilla http elpaiscom sep mar http planetaveganoblogspotcom unahoradeejercicioaldiareduceelhtml

reuters health hispanic and latino people in the u have a high risk of heart pumping problem that can lead to heart failure but most who have these disorder dont know it a recent study suggests researcher examined heart ultrasound for more than hispanic latino adult in four u city and found about half of them had cardiac dysfunction that put them at increased risk for heart failure a chronic disease that happens when the heart cant pump enough blood to keep the body healthy but fewer than in of these patient with cardiac dysfunction knew they had a problem the author report in the journal circulation heart failure this may be at least in part due to the lack of symptom at least initially said lead author dr hardik mehta of wake forest baptist medical center in winstonsalem north carolina hispanic are particularly vulnerable to heart pumping problem because they are more likely than other people to have risk factor for heart failure such a diabetes obesity and high blood pressure mehta and colleague note the prevalence of risk factor ha been known to be higher but now we know that the prevalence of asymptomatic cardiac dysfunction is also very high mehta said by email when compared with other ethnicity with high risk factor like nonhispanic black hispanic still have a higher prevalence of cardiac dysfunction mehta added to as the risk of heart pumping problem among hispanic and latino adult mehta and colleague studied people between the age of and in new york chicago miami and san diego patient were year old on average and percent were men roughly percent were cuban american percent mexican american percent dominican percent puerto rican percent central american and percent of south american descent about half of participant had whats known a left ventricular diastolic dysfunction when the lower left chamber of the heart doesnt relax enough between beat to gather enough blood about percent had whats known a left ventricular systolic dysfunction when the heart largest chamber doesnt push blood out into the body a forcefully a it should risk factor for these type of cardiac dysfunction high blood pressure diabetes obesity limited activity and smoking also put these patient at higher odds of developing heart failure the author note the finding suggest that hispanic latino patient would benefit from screening for diabetes and other risk factor to help catch problem before heart failure develops said dr andrew krumerman a researcher at the montefiore einstein center for heart and vascular care in new york who wasnt involved in the study patient should ask their primary care physician about screening krumerman said by email they should seek out exercise program and begin to increase their activity level while making healthy choice when it come to their diet it important for doctor to also understand that hispanic isnt a precise racial or ethnic group it a cultural and social way people may describe themselves when they have origin in many part of the world said dr keith ferdinand a researcher at tulane university school of medicine in new orleans who wasnt involved in the study hispanic can be white black asian or a in most case of mixed heritage ferdinand added by email each individual need to be assessed based on his her risk and not on somewhat artificial category at the same time all patient including hispanic should be familiar with the sign and symptom of heart failure said dima qato a pharmacy and health outcome researcher at the university of illinois at chicago who wasnt involved in the study these include shortness of breath persistent cough and fatigue qato said by email for some hispanic patient it also possible moving to the u may have led them to adopt unhealthy american habit like eating junk food and sitting in front of the television too much said dr kevin thomas a researcher at duke university who wasnt involved in the study acculturation to the u ha led to decreased activity obesity and worse health outcome thomas said by email source http bitly cksu circulation heart failure online april apr http wwwchannelnewsasiacom news health ushispanicshavehighri the division of drug information ddi serving the public by providing information on human drug product and drug product regulation by fda the u food and drug administration fda ha strengthened the existing warning about the risk of acute kidney injury for the type diabetes medicine canagliflozin invokana invokamet and dapagliflozin farxiga xigduo xr based on recent report we have revised the warning in the drug label to include information about acute kidney injury and added recommendation to minimize this risk patient should seek medical attention immediately if they experience sign and symptom of acute kidney injury this is a serious condition in which the kidney suddenly stop working causing dangerous level of waste to build up in the body sign and symptom of acute kidney injury may include decreased urine or swelling in the leg or foot patient should not stop taking their medicine without first talking to their health care professional doing so can lead to uncontrolled blood sugar level that can be harmful health care professional should consider factor that may predispose patient to acute kidney injury prior to starting them on canagliflozin or dapagliflozin these include decreased blood volume chronic kidney insufficiency congestive heart failure and taking other medication such a diuretic blood pressure medicine called angiotensinconverting enzyme ace inhibitor and angiotensin receptor blocker arb and nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug nsaid as kidney function prior to starting canagliflozin or dapagliflozin and monitor periodically thereafter if acute kidney injury occurs promptly discontinue the drug and treat the kidney impairment for more information please visit canagliflozin and dapagliflozin jun http elbiruniblogspotcomblogspotcom newdrugsafetycommunicationonhtmlutmsourcefeedburnerutmmediumfeedutmcampaignfeedacienciasmedicasnewscienciasmedicasnews

april pm richard denison made history helped preserve it he wa veteran of combat mission a a u army air force navigator during world war ii denison wa awarded france highest military honor the chevalier medal of the french legion of honor in he led research team served a volunteer with california state railroad museum richard denison wa awarded the chevalier medal of the french legion of honor in in recognition of his world war ii service a a u army air force bombardier and navigator helping liberate france from german occupation manny crisostomo mcrisostomosacbeecom i by cathy locke a childhood fascination with airplane and train led richard denison to join the u army air force a a navigator during world war ii and later to a civilian career devoted to preserving railroad history denison wa aboard a gooney bird c aircraft on dday in june swooping behind german line and launching a glider plane carrying artillery gunner for the nd airborne in recognition of his combat mission a a u army air force bombardier and navigator helping liberate france from german occupation denison wa awarded france highest military honor the chevalier medal of the french legion of honor the medal wa presented by the french consul general in in a ceremony at the california state railroad museum where denison wa employed a a researcher and served hour a a volunteer after retiring from the military denison died in sacramento on april of congestive heart failure after suffering from pneumonia said his daughter carol denison he wa four week shy of his th birthday despite three stroke and two bout of cancer her father remained active until recently carol denison said he always said when the elephant lie down the jackal will get him she recalled the number of combat mission richard denison flew a a navigator during world war ii richard h denison wa born april in new albany ind to charles and maude denison he wa the eldest of six boy five saw military service while a sixth became a methodist minister to look out for the rest of u richard denison wrote in a brief summary of his life a a youth he became interested in building model airplane he attended several flying meet winning third place in an indianapolis american legion contest denison worked hour a week at a grocery store to earn money to come to california where he could earn a degree in aeronautical engineering in two year but after the japanese bombed pearl harbor he left college and went to work for the douglas aircraft co before he wa drafted he entered the u army air force and graduated a an aerial navigator he married betty jane schmidt in december a month before he departed for england the couple were married year denison earned honor including the distinguished flying cross and five battle star in world war ii in when he received the chevalier medal he told a sacramento bee reporter i wa just an average guy who wa drafted and had to do thing that i could not conceive that i would have ever been able to do he wa discharged from the army air force in december and entered the air national guard in january a a fulltime administrative officer he wa recalled to active duty for the korean war denison became the base commander at the air national guard base in van nuys in and later became the project officer for converting five group of f fighter to c transport at travis air force base he then wa transferred to sacramento and became the project officer for converting the c for water bombing in fighting forest fire denison wa promoted to brigadier general upon retirement from the air national guard in and turned his attention to train i wa just an average guy who wa drafted and had to do thing that i could not conceive that i would have ever been able to do richard denison upon receiving the chevalier medal of the french legion of honor in he never worked for the railroad but he could tell you everything about the history of the railroad said carol denison a model railroad enthusiast denison went to work for the california state park system heading a team of nine researcher charged with ensuring the historic accuracy of railroad equipment being restored in advance of the opening of the california state railroad museum in he later worked in the museum exhibit section upon retiring from state employment in he became a docent at the museum marilyn sommerdorf worked with denison for more than year a an employee and volunteer at the railroad museum she and denison both avid photographer spent three day at stanford university photographing handpainted illustration of baldwin locomotive philadelphiabased baldwin locomotive work wa one of the world largest and most influential builder of steam locomotive and the material in the stanford archive are important to those doing restoration work summerdorf said she and denison provided copy of their photograph to stanford and the smithsonian institution a well a the california state railroad museum denison often said of the locomotive restoration were doing thcentury work in the th century sommerdorf recalled the number of hour richard denison spent a a volunteer with the california state railroad museum carol denison said part of what kept her father young in spirit wa cultivating friendship with people who were younger than he wa bruce kleinshmidt met richard denison when he began working a a docent at the railroad museum in although year younger than denison kleinshmidt said the men shared many conservative view they met regularly for lunch over the year talking about history and about denisons war experience he would get choked up over some of the story and especially friend he had lost kleinshmidt said richard denison is survived by his wife betty of sacramento daughter carol denison of sacramento and christine nekl of colorado spring colo four grandchild and four greatgrandchildren he wa preceded in death by a granddaughter a celebration of his ive had heart trouble since when l wa im now ive had a heart ablation where extra electrical pathway that had developed in my heart were lasered out i have had major heart attack both with cardiac arrest i had a triple heart by pa and my main aorta which wa in a very bad state repaired my suregeon said that in his opinion it had been leaking for year over all those year l had svt supra ventricular tachycardia and af atrial fibrillation and chronic angina month after my by pa surgery l had to have a scaffold the latest most modern kind of stent inserted into my th artery because in that short space of time that artery which wa completely clear when l had my by pas had clogged up very badly that wa why l wa still having horrendous angina i couldnt even go into the cold aisle in the supermarket l had to stand at the end and tell my husband what to get i also have end stage kidney disease and have dialysis day a week i also have osteoporosis and osteo arthritis all my life l have suffered with bi polar and with borderline persoality disorder i tell you all this because lve always found that seldom do diagnosis or prognosis go straightforward there are often differing soft opinion whereas one doctor or specialist cardiologist will tell you one thing or and another one or even two will tell you something completely different my cardiologist blamed a lot of my trouble ei weight gain fluid retention etc on my kidney and my nephrologist would blame it all on my heart i had to have my first major heart attack before they would sort themselves out and agree i often felt that l wa banging my head on a brick wall trying to get through to them my advice is to talk to your gp and ask for a many test that they can do a day ecg where you would have the machine they are tiny now compared to the brick l had to carry around year ago attached to you for day which give a much longer and more thorough picture reading of the behaviour of your heart ask to go on the treadmill ask for an angiogram the best way to put your mind at ease or at least know what youre coping with is to persist and really drum it home to them how worried you are one of my friend who had absolutely no sign or symptom of any kind of heart trouble did this because her father sat down one day and just died he wa only year of age she asked for an angiogram and it wa discovered that even though she wa fit a a fiddle with no sign of heart disease two of her artery were blocked she had a double heart by pa and because she wasnt ill to begin with she made an extremely quick recovery and wa back working swimming and running in no time at all i hope this is of some help to you i had my first heart attack in asda and my second on my th birthday on our way to asda all my family and friend advised me to do our shopping in morrison in future lol good luck let know how you get on yours sincerly mo ashton may http wwwpatientcouk forum discus enlargedheartorderlatest

chubby cheek are good only in rhyme ask those people who have these chubby cheek and double chin on their bloated face they just want to get rid of all the face fat but how to lose this fat on face while losing weight is always a task that need determination and continuous effort losing weight on face need a lot of extra effort in fact a bloated face is not only a matter of look but it may indicate a serious health issue let see why we get a fat face cause for facial fat here are the top reason why your face look all blown up when you see it in the mirror every time more so in the morning junk food whenever you eat those burger and pizza try to evaluate the nutrient in them did you find any they are pure junk you need all the vitamin and mineral and other essential nutrient to look at your best to be specific lack of vitamin c and beta carotene can make your face bloat not only this whenever you eat such food you are pushing carbohydrate and salt into your system these two thing too cause puffiness of face so start having balanced diet full of nutrition fruit vegetable and herb are good for losing weight not only on face but from all over your body dehydration this is due to water retention when your body craves for water and doesnt get it it tends to retain water face is one of the area where your body can retain more water so start drinking lot of water if it isnt possible for you have more of watery fruit and vegetable a well a healthy drink aging when you age the hormonal change inside your face lead to bloating and puffy face however it not too hard to delay these aging symptom just eat right the nutritious balanced diet and exercise a lot while maintaining a healthy lifestyle alcohol do you drink a lot if yes expect your face to become puffy and fat why doe this happen this is because alcohol dehydrates your body this lead your body to again retain water which make your face look fat so cut back on your alcohol consumption heredity sometimes it may be your gene that give you a fat face while you cannot do a lot in such a situation you can at least try to tone your facial muscle with some toning exercise medical condition facial fat is not always due to the above cause it can be a symptom of something thats not right in your body for example kidney problem sinus infection allergy insect bite mumps dental issue edema etc take step to treat these condition and youll get rid of your facial fat now when you know what might be causing your facial weight you may definitely try to eliminate that cause and lose your facial weight but the question is how to do so how to lose weight on face there is a three pronged approach for losing face fat lifestyle and diet change face exercise home remedy lifestyle change for losing facial weight drink water this is the most essential step you can take to keep yourself away from body weight including facial fat drinking enough water throughout the day will keep your body hydrated to a level where it would not require to retain water and give you a bloated appearance drink glass of water daily have more water based fruit and vegetable like cucumber tomato watermelon etc if you cant drink plain water have healthy drink like fruit juice herbal tea vegetable smoothy soup etc limit salt consumption salt lead to water retention in your body this happens because your body try to dilute the salt with larger amount of water this not only make your face look fat but also lead to serious health issue too much salt intake put pressure on your heart and may lead to heart failure or stroke over time you may also get kidney problem due to excessive salt consumption so stop taking too much of salt but how cut back on processed and fast food they are loaded with salt instead have more fruit and veggie avoid sprinkling salt on each and every food item you eat all natural food have adequate amount of salt you need not add more salt to them it is a matter of few day only when you will start liking food with low salt level have lot of water to help your body flush out the excessive sodium you have stored in your body through salt intake have natural diuretic a they eliminate sodium and water from your body cranberry juice and cabbage are good example of such natural diuretic eat more potassiumrich food potassium balance sodium in your body by flushing out water and sodium out of the body banana carrot spinach raisin etc have high amount of potassium in them have them daily have balanced diet wholesome diet loaded with all the essential nutrient will not only reduce facial weight but will help you lose weight from all over your body have more fresh fruit avoid having canned or preserved fruit they might contain sugar sodium or other preservative that can further lead to bloating and weight gain have more vegetable fiber in the vegetable help eliminate toxin from your body which is essential to lose weight they also give you all the essential mineral and vitamin dont skip meal and eat your meal regularly preferably on the same time every day this help in better digestion a you might be knowing indigestion is the cause of almost all the disease eat smaller meal many a time instead of big meal this will help boost your metabolism so that you get rid of fat avoid junk food processed a well a fast food all are junk food avoid them this would help you avoid excessive salt and carbohydrate you should know that unhealthy carbohydrate are a big reason for fat a they lead to bloating avoid packed food avoid processed food reduce the frequency of visit to restaurant eat more home cooked food eat more raw food fruit and vegetable by adding them in salad instead of such snack a cooky biscuit popcorn etc snack on dry fruit peanut date coconut etc take enough rest lack of sleep can give you puffy eye dark circle saggy skin fine line and wrinkle etc all of which can make you look aged and sometimes bloated so have enough rest by sleeping for adequate time every day also not taking rest break during work can make you over stressed that will lead to various medical condition including bloated body and face take break from work frequently sleep enough every day try to go to bed at the same time everyday and wake up at the same time in the morning even on holiday this set a rhythm of your body and you can sleep easily if needed you can learn some meditation technique calming your nerve and mind can give you deep rest and relaxation correct your posture if you are in a habit to sit wrongly correct it now hunched back can make your face look fat additionally it also lead to double chin always stand straight do not bellow your face down while talking or walking this can make the fat get stored in your chin area exercise exercise is the healthier way to keep your body fit and fine when you exercise regularly you help your body work naturally your metabolism improves and you start losing weight when you lose weight it is obvious that fat on your face too reduces move your body daily be it walking swimming cycling dancing do whatever you like but move it if possible do intense exercise at least day a week such a cardio aerobics yoga or any other such exercise when it come to facial weight you also need to do face exercise the next section deal with this elaborately sourcehttp wwwrapidhomeremediescom jun http sarepta issue statement on advisory committee outcome for use of eteplirsen in the treatment of duchenne muscular dystrophy cambridge mass business wire sarepta therapeutic inc srpt a developer of innovative rnabased therapeutic today announced that the u food and drug administration fda peripheral and central nervous system advisory committee pcnsc met to review the new drug application nda for eteplirsen a a treatment for duchenne muscular dystrophy amenable to exon skipping the advisory committee voted against the finding of substantial evidence from adequate and well controlled study that show that eteplirsen induces production of dystrophin to a level that is reasonably likely to predict clinical benefit fda question the advisory committee voted with three abstention against finding substantial evidence based on the clinical result of the single historically controlled study study that eteplirsen is effective for treatment of dmd fda question we would like to thank the hundred of patient and family who participated in the discussion today underscoring the critical unmet need of people living with duchenne said edward kaye md sareptas interim chief executive officer and chief medical officer we appreciated the opportunity to present our data to the advisory committee panel and will continue to work with fda a they complete their review of the eteplirsen nda today more than ever we remain committed to our mission of bringing a treatment to the duchenne community dmd is a rare degenerative neuromuscular disorder causing severe progressive muscle loss and premature death the fda is not bound by the advisory committee recommendation but take it advice into consideration when reviewing new drug and biologic license application in general the prescription drug user fee act pdufa action date for completion of fda review of eteplirsen is may in three additional voting question the panel voted to with one abstention against whether decision to administer the minute walk test v conclusion that the patient could no longer walk were sufficiently objective and free of bias and subjective decisionmaking by patient their caregiver and or health care professional to allow for a valid comparison between patient in study and an external control group fda question the panel voted on the impact of the north star ambulatory assessment with one panel member voting that it strengthened the persuasiveness of the finding in study with five voting that it weakened the persuasiveness and seven voting that it had no effect fda question the panel also voted on the impact of the other test of physical performance eg rise time meter run walk on the persuasiveness of the finding in study with the result of one panel member voting that they strengthened the persuasiveness two voting that they weakened the persuasiveness and ten voting that they had no effect fda question the pcnsc advisory committee recommendation wa based on a review of result from the phase iib clinical program for eteplirsen study and longterm outcome through week from the study openlabel extension study a well a year clinical effectiveness data based on a comparison of patient in study to a historical control group that wa designated a a major amendment to the nda in january about the minute walk test mwt the mwt wa developed a an integrated assessment of cardiac respiratory circulatory and muscular capacity for use in clinical trial of various cardiac and pulmonary condition in recent year the mwt ha been adapted to evaluate functional capacity in neuromuscular disease and ha served a the basis for regulatory approval of a number of drug for rare disease with mean change in the mwt ranging from to meter additionally published data from longitudinal natural history study assessing dystrophinopathy a disease continuum comprised of dmd and becker muscular dystrophy support the utility of the mwt a a clinically meaningful endpoint in dmd these data show that boy with dmd experience a significant decline in walking ability compared to healthy boy over one year suggesting that slowing the loss of walking ability is a major treatment goal about duchenne muscular dystrophy dmd is an xlinked rare degenerative neuromuscular disorder causing severe progressive muscle loss and premature death one of the most common fatal genetic disorder dmd affect approximately one in every male worldwide a devastating and incurable musclewasting disease dmd is associated with specific error in the gene that code for dystrophin a protein that play a key structural role in muscle fiber function progressive muscle weakness in the lower limb spread to the arm neck and other area eventually increasing difficulty in breathing due to respiratory muscle dysfunction requires ventilation support and cardiac dysfunction can lead to heart failure the condition is universally fatal and death usually occurs before the age of about eteplirsen eteplirsen is designed to address the underlying cause of dmd by restoring the messenger rna mrna reading frame thus enabling the production of a shorter functional form of the dystrophin protein eteplirsen u sareptas proprietary phosphorodiamidate morpholine oligomer pmo chemistry and exonskipping technology to skip exon of the dystrophin gene approximately percent of the dmd population is amenable to exon skipping data from clinical study of eteplirsen in dmd patient have demonstrated a consistent safety and tolerability profile and have also shown measurable dystrophin protein expression promoting the synthesis of a shorter dystrophin protein is intended to slow the decline of ambulation and mobility seen in dmd patient there currently is no approved treatment in the united state for dmd and eteplirsen ha not been approved by the fda or any regulatory authority for the treatment of dmd about sarepta therapeutic sarepta therapeutic is a biopharmaceutical company focused on the discovery and development of unique rnatargeted therapeutic for the treatment of rare infectious and other disease the company is primarily focused on rapidly advancing the development of it potentially diseasemodifying dmd drug candidate including it lead dmd product candidate eteplirsen designed to skip exon sarepta is also developing therapeutic for the treatment of washington dc april because sequenced care plan called clinical pathway now shape the treatment decision for an increasing number of cancer patient an initiative called project innovation unveiled decoding clinical pathway the first online resource for the public that explains what pathway are and how they affect cancer care today the goal is to help patient understand factor that are shaping their care and if theirs is governed by a pathway so they are better prepared to weigh available treatment option with their physician and care team project innovation is a campaign to elevate advancement in cancer treatment a a national priority coinciding with the publication of the policy paper recommendation for the role of clinical pathway in an era of personalized medicine on april in the american journal of managed care the new module come at a time when the use of pathway is expanding and evolving authored by cancer specialist working with the national patient advocate foundation npaf the paper report that many hospital and physician practice now use pathway to translate published medical practice guideline into the essential step for treating a specific disease or condition when properly designed and implemented these pathway help steer patient and provider to evidencebased treatment option that take into account such factor a efficacy and safety along with cost however the npaf paper caution that pathway can also be oriented more towards cookiecutter approach that can preempt shared decisionmaking between doctor and patient and interfere with physician clinical judgement this is of increasing concern a insurance company implement their own care plan a a way to control cost and in some case pay bonus to doctor for prescribing on pathway treatment the american society of clinical oncology asco estimate that individual health plan are currently implementing oncology pathway particularly for breast lung and colorectal cancer responding to these development the online guide introduces the concept of pathway to patient and caregiver most of whom have never heard the term before and serf a a primer on the purpose of these care plan the likely benefit of patientfocused pathway and the potential limit restrictive version may impose on available treatment option and patient access to emerging personalized therapy the decoding clinical pathway module is available on the project innovation website at wwwprojectinnovationorg for too long the discussion about cancer clinical pathway ha been limited to physician insurance company and policymakers even though patient are directly affected by how these care plan are designed and what they cover said alan balch phd chief executive officer of the patient advocate foundation paf which manages project innovation our goal is to equip patient and caregiver with userfriendly information about pathway so they will know what question to ask and be prepared to weigh treatment option with their oncologist the need for transparency today clinical pathway are used to manage cancer and other challenging disease such a congestive heart failure and diabetes when applied to cancer care these protocol are intended to allow oncologist and patient to weigh treatment regimen based on different safety and effectiveness profile improve outcome and drive value in the health system conversely some pathway erode the doctorpatient relationship and the overall quality of cancer care by limiting or precluding treatment option that may be appropriately personalized to an individual patient which is why the npaf policy paper state patient need to be aware not just of how option on pathway were chosen but also of what other alternative are viable according to guideline that may not be listed in the pathway patient can then have an honest consultation with their physician about the various risk benefit and cost associated with each viable option reflecting this position asco published a policy statement with nine recommendation to improve clinical pathway and the national patient advocate foundation issued a set of guideline for clinical pathway design and development calling for all clinical pathway to support shared decisionmaking and reflect patient preference for how to individualize their care however until these recommendation are enacted the online module encourages patient to take action themselves by asking these question of their oncologist is my treatment determined by a clinical pathway if so what treatment option are available through the pathway for my diagnosis and why were they chosen doe the pathway include the option of enrolling in a clinical trial what happens if the most appropriate treatment is not covered by the pathway are there way that the health plan will cover this treatment doe the insurance plan give financial incentive to the oncology practice for following the pathway further the online module recommends patient and caregiver take advantage of new rule under the affordable care act aca which require insurance company to make available in concise easytounderstand language what their health plan cover way to get information on the drug covered through the health plan are to visit the insurer website to review the list of prescription the plan includes ask the insurance company to provide the summary of benefit and coverage a form that summarizes the key feature of the plan such a the covered benefit costsharing provision and coverage limitation and exception call the insurance company directly to find out what drug are covered about project innovation launched in june and spearheaded by the patient advocate foundation paf and national patient advocate foundation npaf project innovation is a national movement designed to accelerate the pace of medical discovery in cancer deliver safe and effective breakthrough therapy to patient quickly and save life through project innovation and it complementary policy development initiative the cancer innovation coalition stakeholder have joined force to address the barrier slowing the pace of biomedical research and limiting patient access to much needed treatment more information about project innovation is available at wwwprojectinnovationorg projectinno on twitter and http facebookcom projectinno on facebook apr http adventuresindevelopmentcom another step towards finding best treatment combo for each individual patient eurekalert science newsa service of the american association for the advancement of science public release feb single dose of trastuzumab kick start immune response in certain breast cancer case western reserve university a tumor immune response to a single dose of the her inhibitor trastuzumab predicted which patient with herpositive breast cancer would respond to the drug on a more longterm basis according to the result of a study published recently in clinical cancer research in addition vinay varadan phd assistant professor at case western reserve university school of medicine and member of the case comprehensive cancer center and his colleague found that woman with the herenriched subtype of herpositive breast cancera subtype that is estrogen and progesterone receptor negativehad the highest rate of immune response to treatment with trastuzumab with significant increase in immune response after a single dose of the drug our study showed for the first time that the immunecellactivating property of trastuzumab are likely related to the subtypes of breast cancer varadan said knowing this can inform future trial studying the usefulness of adding immunotherapy drug to trastuzumab only onehalf of woman with herpositive breast cancer treated with trastuzumab will have their tumor completely respond to therapy prior to undergoing surgery to remove the mass even when a second hertargeting drug such a pertuzumab is combined with trastuzumab only of woman have a complete response therefore there is a need to find way to identify woman who are the most likely to respond to this presurgical treatment prior research showed that a patient own immune system can play a role in determining whether the tumor will respond to therapy with trastuzumab to look into this association further varadan and his colleague used data from two clinical trial to measure the molecular makeup of breast tumor after treatment with a single dose of trastuzumab they examined how and if the immune system interacted with the drug and if the immuneassociated property of trastuzumab were related to the subtype of herpositive breast cancer woman with the herenriched subtype of disease had the highest rate of tumor response compared with other disease subtypes in patient taken from both clinical trial based on these result varadan and colleague used a molecular signature immune index to measure the amount of immune activity occurring within the tumor tissue again the herenriched subtype tumor had significant increase in immune activity after only one dose of trastuzumab compared with the other subtypes we found that higher immune index evaluated after just one dose of trastuzumab predicted the tumor response varadan said this response seems to be specific to trastuzumab there wa no association between immune activity and the subtype of breast cancer in patient who were given a single dose of another chemotherapy also the predictive ability of the immune index test wa not observed in patient tumor before any therapy wa given suggesting that just a single dose exposure may be a beneficial way to identify which patient are most likely to benefit from trastuzumabbased chemotherapy and thus do not need additional antiher treatment varadan said finally the researcher wanted to identify which type of immune cell were associated with this brief exposure to trastuzumab they found that signature of tcell activitya key immune responsewere consistently predictive of response after one dose of trastuzumab suggesting that the immune system is likely playing a key role in enabling the therapeutic benefit of trastuzumab specifically pd expression a marker of tcells wa significantly increased in woman with the herenriched subtype of disease this suggests that this subtype of breast cancer may benefit most from the addition of drug that target pd given that the subtypes of herpositive disease and the immune signature predict response to trastuzumabbased therapy the next question is whether these signature can also predict response to dualher targeted therapyvaradan said additionally we would like to understand why certain breast cancer have a strong immune response when treated with antiher therapy while others escape immune surveillance we are poised to answer these question using both labbased research a well a an ongoing preoperative clinical trialcasebeing conducted here at cwru for more information about case western reserve if youve ever tried to lose weight youve probably heard a lot about water and weight loss can drinking more water really help you lose weight the short answer is yes and no if youre already well hydrated and getting plenty of water getting more water into your diet probably wont make a lot of difference but if youre going through your day a little or a lot dehydrated a many people are getting enough water could help dr christopher calapai do is a manhattan osteopathic physician board certified in family medicine and antiaging medicine he state that there is always the case of too much of a good thing some people are such water drinking devotee that they are aquaholics resulting in overhydration a a result expert now fear weve become so focused on staying hydrated that were guzzling water to lifethreatening extreme dr calapai point out that there are two type of overhydration increased water intake and retaining water increased water intakeor drinking more water than the kidney can get rid of in the urinecan cause too much water to collect in the body when the body is unable to get rid of excess water it is said to be retaining water this happens with several medical condition for instance it can be dangerous because it throw off the balance between water and sodium in the blood overhydration caused by drinking too much water can occur both consciously and unconsciously dr calapai say that a person may drink too much water during exercise some medication can also cause dry mouth and cause an increase in thirst increased thirst can also be caused by uncontrolled diabetes psychiatric condition such a schizophrenia primary polydipsia or psychogenic polydipsia can also cause compulsive water drinking what are the symptom of overhydration symptom of overhydration may not be recognized in the early stage but can include nausea and vomiting headache change in mental state confusion or disorientation if left untreated overhydration can lead to dangerously low level of sodium in the blood hyponatremia this can cause moresevere symptom such a muscle weakness spasm or cramp seizure unconsciousness coma how can overhydration be prevented endurance athlete can reduce the risk of overhydration by weighing themselves before and after a race to determine how much water they have lost and need to replenish dr calapai emphasizes that individual should avoid drinking more than one liter per hour of fluid drinking more fluid before and during a race or anintensive athletic exertion can also help you avoid the need to drink too much water afterwards sport beverage that contain the electrolyte sodium and potassium are also recommended a both are lost in sweat so how do you know how much water you need for starter dont rely solely on thirst say calapai a soon a you put water on your tongue you kill your thirst mechanism instead he suggests the following weigh yourself daily for a week to check hydration your body weight shouldnt fluctuate too much calapai say notice how much you peeand it colorin the morning it should be a copious amount and pale or clear aim to wake feeling hydrated if youre thirsty when you get out of bed in the morning you may not be consuming enough fluid when choosing sport drink search for label with low sugar dr calapai recommends about gram per ounce serving even natural drink like coconut water have too much sugar and potassium to hydrate coffee tea and watery fruit and vegetable count toward fluid intake also caffeine is not a diuretic dr calapai say it about volume so if you drink five cup youll pee more start slowly sleep is a six to eighthour fast so if you drink three cup of juice or water right away youll trigger the volume response sip instead if you have an underlying medical condition such a diabetes congestive heart failure or kidney problem talk to your doctor about the best treatment for those condition if you experience excessive thirst or an overly strong urge to drink water contact your doctor before you develop symptomsit could indicate a medical problem that requires treatment dr christopher calapai do antiaging physician and the stem cell guru wwwdrcalnet dr christopher calapai do is an osteopathic physician board certified in family medicine and antiaging medicine proclaimed a the the stem cell guru by the new york daily news dr calapai is a leader in the field of stem cell therapy in the u his stem cell treatment have achieved remarkable result in clinical trial on patient with condition a varied a alzheimers arthritis erectile dysfunction frailty syndrome heart kidney and liver failure lupus m and parkinson dr calapai started his practice in new york city in and for over year he ha hosted nationally syndicated radio show including his two weekly callin show on wabc am where he offer health and medical advice he ha a show on saturday morning am and sunday evening from pm he ha consulted with numerous highprofile individual including mike tyson mickey rourke steven seagal and fox series gothams donal logue and worked a a medical consultant for the new york ranger hockey team a well a various modeling agency dr calapai received his medical degree from new york college of osteopathic medicine and he consults in manhattan with practice on long island in east meadow and plainview he ha appeared on news and in the page ofa magazine and social life magazine he is the author of ebooks heavy metal and chronic disease reverse diabetes forever seven step to healthy blood sugar top ten supplement you cant live without and glorious glutathione learn more about dr calapai on his website wwwdrcalnet jun http itsaglamthingcom areyouanaquaholictoomuchhcanactuallybedangerous

this monthly blog highlight and discus emerging trend and challenge related to healthcare data and it ever changing life cycle by wendy james rhia pmp the technological advance that have taken place over the past year have been nothing short of phenomenal when i reflect on the thing i have experienced not only in my professional career but the technological advance i have seen over the course of my life across the board in all facet of life the effect is staggering from safetyoriented upgrade we now take for granted like lap seatbelt and car equipped with airbags to the improbably yet amazingly real home monitoring system that notifies me whenever there is anything out of the norm from climate control to movement at the front door think about it who would have ever guessed this would be the type of environment we would live in today technology ha also been advancing in the healthcare industry suppose someone very close to you just had a major health event and ha been admitted to the hospital a health information management professional that are in the business so to speak it could be said we are at a slight advantage to know that being admitted to the hospital may not result always in the best outcome and are on the lookout for potential issue whether we like to think it or not we know what can and sometimes doe happen for those who are not a informed an incredible amount of trust and faith is given to those who are now caring for your loved one when i think about those who are not familiar with healthcare i get concerned because many time they do not have an advocate that is independent of those caregiver take for example someone diagnosed with atrial fibrillation which not only present itself a a more enlarged heart on a scan but also is somewhat of an irregular heartbeat when this person present in the emergency room if there is no one there a an advocate for this person this person might receive medication because their blood pressure is not normal these medication then cause the patient to hallucinate which then might cause a misdiagnosis by the caregiver who are unfamiliar with this person a patient best defense is many time a loved one who remains diligent and passionate asking question each step of the way on the journey through the hospitalization what may be normal for your loved one is not normal for someone else so how can our health information actually save a life how many time have you entered in your demographic in triplicate during the same episode of care for the same facility we document our medication we document our date of birth we document our health history we document our allergy we document our past surgery we document our known problem but who really read it to the caregiver it just data but to me or my loved one it my health story one that i am passionate about one that i want to protect not every patient is going to have an advocate available to them at all time while in the hospital for those who do they are lucky there have been many time having that loved one in the room with you might have saved your life perhaps they questioned a medicine or questioned why a certain procedure wa necessary one of the challenge today patient face is the general lack of continuity of care limited knowledge of the patient history or the robotic response to automated and or scheduled order without consideration of the current condition having an advocate present is sometimes nothing short of being a lifesaver the ability to provide such an ardent advocate for each patient is not currently possible or feasible but what if it wa a new smart phone application developed by larry trach at emrconnect is currently being tested that will provide a giant step forward in helping a patient safely navigate a hospital stay this application will monitor data stream from the hospital electronic health record from three different subject area registration and admit discharge transfer adt message provider access of your patient record clinical result like lab vital sign and other pertinent documentation registration and adt monitoring after registration is completed you will be able to visually verify your demographic information guarantor and emergency contact insurance information advance directive and provider assigned to your case a registration system is susceptible to human and interface error such a registration overlay bad medical record or account combine and system interface error if any of your key demographic change during the course of your stay you would be immediately alerted monitoring provider access not all damage or injury is a result of medical malpractice inappropriate access to your health information by someone who is not on your care team can be a signal for identify theft loss of confidentiality and more you will be able to see all the provider that accessed your record what their role wa and what they did on your behalf if you question a particular activity or access a review request can be sent directly to the designated privacy officer or security team clinical monitoring for predicting harmful condition vital sign and lab can be good predictor of vital stress over sedation early detection of sepsis and many other condition or adverse event each time a new result arrives it will be reviewed scored and combined with other key measure risk factor and comorbidities because of the dynamic and sometimes chaotic nature of activity on the nursing unit it is easy to miss a key piece of new information such a a critical lab value not to mention the latency between time of care and time of documentation the monitoring application would allow a patient or the patient designee to receive message about their healthcare there would be remote access for monitoring and message capability thus improving communication among all of the appropriate caregiver if we can wire our home to provide u with uptotheminute information in the interest of safety and security then we should certainly be able to apply this same technology to healthcare after all there is nothing more important than saving a life wendy james wsjyahoocom is a senior quality control engineer at a fortune software development company and a freelance writer about health information management topic jun http journalahimaorg candatasavealife

view more job woodcliff lake nj business wire eagle pharmaceutical inc nasdaqegrx eagle or the company today announced that it ha entered into an agreement with the national institute of health nih national institute on drug abuse nida to explore the use of ryanodex in the treatment of hyperthermia related to mdma ecstasy and methamphetamine intoxication which is a lifethreatening condition mostly affecting adolescent and young adult the preclinical study will be conducted by nida beginning in the summer of utilizing a wellcharacterized animal model initial result of the focused study are anticipated in late or early we believe that ryanodex ha the potential to provide benefit to patient experiencing pathological thermal dysregulation associated with the use of ecstasy and methamphetamine we are very pleased to be working alongside the nih to explore the potential of ryanodex to reduce elevated body and brain temperature resulting from the use of ecstasy and methamphetamine result of our recently completed clinical study of ryanodex for exertional heat stroke indicated that patient receiving ryanodex in addition to standard of care soc which is currently limited to body cooling and supportive measure experienced an incremental therapeutic benefit over patient receiving soc only said scott tarriff president and chief executive officer of eagle pharmaceutical we believe that ryanodex ha the potential to provide benefit to patient experiencing pathological thermal dysregulation associated with the use of ecstasy and methamphetamine stated adrian hepner executive vice president and chief medical officer we anticipate that having positive outcome from our preclinical study would enable u to meet with fda and potentially lead to a rapid transition into pivotal clinical trial clinical study in emergency setting are of relatively short duration due to the nature of the disorder and the known distribution of case of ecstasy and methamphetamine intoxication commonly associated with large holiday celebration the development of ryanodex for body and brain hyperthermia associated with intoxication from illicit psychostimulant drug in a preclinical model in collaboration with nida expert will be an important step forward in addressing the serious consequence of this condition added hepner brain hyperthermia is one of the leading cause of severe morbidity and death in mdma ecstasy and methamphetamine intoxication in the last year for which data is available emergency room visit were related to ecstasy and methamphetamine use methamphetamine are the fourth most reported illicit drug in emergency room visit following cocaine marijuana and heroin and according to the drug abuse warning network dawn the number of emergency room visit involving ecstasy among patient younger than increased percent between and mdma ecstasy methylenedioxymethamphetamine mdma commonly known a ecstasy or molly is an illicit synthetic drug that alters a user mood and perception mdma increase the activity of three brain chemical dopamine norepinephrine and serotonin it is chemically similar to both stimulant and hallucinogen producing feeling of increased energy pleasure emotional warmth and distorted sensory and time perception mdma can also affect the body ability to regulate temperature leading to a spike in brain and overall body temperature that can result in liver kidney or heart failure and even death mdma is a schedule i drug under the controlled substance act schedule i drug have a high potential for abuse no currently accepted medical use in treatment in the united state and a lack of accepted safety for use under medical supervision methamphetamine methamphetamine also known a meth crystal chalk and ice is an extremely addictive stimulant drug that is chemically similar to amphetamine it take the form of a white odorless bittertasting crystalline powder methamphetamine increase the amount of dopamine in the brain dopamine is involved in reward motivation the experience of pleasure and motor function methamphetamine ability to release dopamine rapidly in reward region of the brain produce the euphoric rush or flash that many user experience repeated methamphetamine use can easily lead to addiction the consequence of methamphetamine abuse can cause memory loss aggression psychotic behavior damage to the cardiovascular system malnutrition and severe dental problem methamphetamine abuse ha also been shown to contribute to increased transmission of infectious disease such a hepatitis and hiv aid methamphetamine is classified a a schedule ii drug available only through a prescription that cannot be refilled according to data from the national survey on drug use and health nsduh over million people percent of the population have tried methamphetamine at least once methamphetamine are known to cause hyperthermia which can contribute to methinduced neurotoxicity and mortality about nida the national institute on drug abuse nida at the national institute of health nih support most of the world research on drug abuse and addiction it mission is to advance science on the cause and consequence of drug use and addiction and to apply that knowledge to improve individual and public health additional information can be found at wwwdrugabusegov scott tarriff president and chief executive officer adrian hepner executive vice president and chief medical officer and other key management will provide a general business update focusing on the recently released exertional heat stroke data and the agreement with the nih a follows date mar http wwwbiospacecom newsstoryaspxstoryidfull

with the temperature rising our body need more fluid and to maintain the temperature and keep the body cool the heart is forced to pump blood at a faster rate while most people tolerate these change without any problem those with damaged or weakened heart are at a high risk of heat stroke dehydration arrhythmia angina and heart attack which in some case might be fatal so to keep your heart healthy during summer here are five tip from our expert dr sanjay kumar hod principal consultant cardiology fortis escort hospital faridabad you need to keep in the mind stay hydrated according to dr sanjay dehydration is a known trigger for atrial fibrillation and stroke a summer cause excess loss of fluid from the body it is important to stay hydrated by drinking fluid such a water coconut water soup and juice people above the age of year fail to recognise that they are thirsty and often become victim of dehydration and heat stroke hence ensure to drink water frequently even if you are not thirsty choose medication wisely people suffering from heart disease and hypertension are often prescribed diuretic also known a water pill however when taken during summer it might worsen dehydration by increasing the urine output even the consumption of antidepressant and antihistamine can also block sweating thereby further worsening the condition if you feel dizzy or lightheaded check with your doctor immediately regarding reducing the dosage fo the medication during summer limit the consumption of caffeinated or alcoholic beverage it go without saying that the consumption of alcoholic beverage or caffeinated drink during summer might trigger dehydration thereby increasing your risk of heart complication also people who have undergone angioplasty or those with stent and artificial heart valve need to be more cautious a dehydration might cause thickening of the blood which can cause blocking of the stent hence it is wise to load up your intake of water here are hearthealthy drink limit outdoor activity it is always advisable to exercise outdoors but during summer it is important to ease the strain on the heart caused by the summer heat hence limit outdoor activity like brisk walking running or gardening to evening and not in the morning it is advisable to stay indoors during the morning and afternoon hour when the temperature is the highest if you are planning to workout wear lightcolored clothes and those made from breathable fabric like cotton you may like to read about exercise that help you cope after a heart attack consult your doctor if you suspect anything wrong patient with coronary heart disease may get episode of angina during summer due to increased pressure on the heart and the heightened demand for oxygen moreover these people are at high risk of suffering from atrial fibrillation and congestive heart failure hence it is critical for people with heart disease to stay healthy and take necessary precaution when the temperature rise if you suspect any symptom of heat stroke visit nearest hospital immediately to avoid any causality image source shutterstock article source http wwwthehealthsitecom diseasesconditions experttipstokeepyourhearthealthyinsummerb apr http healthtipsarticlescom experttipstokeepyourhearthealthyduringsummer

hi there are no specific remedy to improve breathlessness after an acute heart attack what we should do is look for the cause of this problem and propose a targeted treatment first it is important to explain what it mean myocardial infarction myocardial infarction also known a heart attack is when a piece of the heart is destroyed once destroyed that area will no longer contraction function and the rest of the heart will have to work more to address the lack of that piece when this piece destroyed is bigger cause larger contraction deficit including severe heart dysfunction and can cause death of patient second when there is loss of contractile function of the heart loses some of it ability to pump blood forward and liquid become accumulated in various part of the body especially the lung causing pulmonary edema this fluid accumulation in the lung is responsible for the sensation of breathlessness then i believe the heart attack you had may have destroyed a large area in your heart leading to a condition known a heart failure and there are several treatment for this problem incuindo cardiopulmonary rehabilitation medication and visit by multidisciplinary team i suggest you contact your cardiologist for further information and determine which therapy are needed to solve the problem hope i have answered your question if you have any further question i will be happy to help you wish you good health mar http wwwhealthcaremagiccom question suggestremedyfordifficultyinbreathingandpaininshoulderpostheartattacktreatment answer

monday april healthday news regular do of vitamin d may improve heart function in heart failure patient a new british study suggests these finding could make a significant difference to the care of heart failure patient said study leader dr klaus witte from the university of leeds school of medicine it is the first evidence that vitamin d can improve heart function of people with heart muscle weakness known a heart failure the study included more than patient who had pacemaker and or were receiving blood pressure drug known a ace inhibitor or beta blocker the study participant took either vitamin d or inactive placebo pill once a day for a year the researcher explained that they avoided using a calciumbased vitamin d supplement because calcium can cause other problem for heart failure patient heart pumping function improved from percent to percent in patient who took vitamin d while there wa no change among those who took the placebo pill the investigator found the study wa presented monday at the annual meeting of the american college of cardiology in chicago research presented at medical meeting is typically considered preliminary until published in a peerreviewed journal the researcher suggested that the improvement seen in some of the patient who took vitamin d might reduce their need for an implantable cardioverter defibrillator icd an icd is a device that detects dangerous heart rhythm problem and delivers a shock to restore a normal heartbeat icds are expensive and involve an operation if we can avoid an icd implant in just a few patient then that is a boost to patient and health system a a whole witte said in a university news release heart failure affect about million people worldwide the study author said more information the american academy of family physician ha more about heart failure apr http newshealthcom vitamindboostsheartfunctioninstudy
