cdc health effect heart disease smoking tobacco use smoking cause one of every three death from cardiovascular disease the latest million heart action step guide pdfkb provides clinician with tested strategy for identifying and treating patient who use tobacco clinician can try evidencebased protocol for treating tobacco user or customize their own million heart tobacco cessation protocol pdfkb template what is heart disease and stroke heart disease and stroke are cardiovascular heart and blood vessel disease cvds heart disease includes several type of heart condition the most common type in the united state is coronary heart disease also known a coronary artery disease which is narrowing of the blood vessel that carry blood to the heart this can cause chest pain heart attack when blood flow to the heart becomes blocked and a section of the heart muscle is damaged or dy heart failure when the heart cannot pump enough blood and oxygen to support other organ arrhythmia when the heart beat too fast too slow or irregularly a stroke occurs when the blood supply to the brain is blocked or when a blood vessel in the brain burst causing brain tissue to die stroke can cause disability such a paralysis muscle weakness trouble speaking memory loss or death top of page how are smoking related to heart disease and stroke smoking is a major cause of cvd and cause one of every three death from cvd smoking can raise triglyceride a type of fat in your blood lower good cholesterol hdl make blood sticky and more likely to clot which can block blood flow to the heart and brain damage cell that line the blood vessel increase the buildup of plaque fat cholesterol calcium and other substance in blood vessel cause thickening and narrowing of blood vessel top of page how is breathing secondhand smoke related to heart disease and stroke breathing secondhand smoke also harm your health secondhand smoke is the smoke from burning tobacco product secondhand smoke also is smoke breathed out by a smoker breathing secondhand smoke can cause coronary heart disease including heart attack and stroke know the fact secondhand smoke cause nearly early death from coronary heart disease each year in the united state among nonsmoker nonsmoker who breathe secondhand smoke at home or at work increase their risk of developing heart disease by secondhand smoke increase the risk for stroke by each year secondhand smoke exposure cause more than death from stroke breathing secondhand smoke interferes with the normal functioning of the heart blood and vascular system in way that increase your risk of having a heart attack even briefly breathing secondhand smoke can damage the lining of blood vessel and cause your blood to become stickier these change can cause a deadly heart attack top of page how can heart disease and stroke be prevented heart disease and stroke are major cause of death and disability in the united state many people are at high risk for these disease and dont know it the good news is that many risk factor for heart disease and stroke can be prevented or controlled the federal government million heart initiative aim to prevent million heart attack and stroke by it important to know your risk for heart disease and stroke and to take action to reduce that risk a good place to start is with the abc of heart health aspirin aspirin may help reduce your risk for heart disease and stroke but do not take aspirin if you think you are having a stroke it can make some type of stroke worse before taking aspirin talk to your doctor about whether aspirin is right for you blood pressure control your blood pressure cholesterol manage your cholesterol smoking quit smoking or dont start in addition to your abc several lifestyle choice can help protect your heart and brain health these include the following avoid breathing secondhand smoke eat lowfat lowsalt food most of the time and fresh fruit and vegetable maintain a healthy weight exercise regularly limit alcohol use get other health condition such a diabetes under control top of page additional resource brian one of the tip campaign participant had a heart attack at age he learned how important it wa to quitand to stay quit by doing so he eventually qualified for and received a precious gifta heart transplant for more information about the benefit of quitting see the american heart association web page entitled why quit smoking this page provides information about smoking and coronary heart disease including the health consequence of smoking the benefit of quitting a calculator that computes the monthly and yearly cost of smoking a smoking quiz that test how much you know about the danger of smoking for more information about organ donation go to organdonorgov this web site includes how ice affect the heart patient with methamphetamineassociated cardiomyopathy mac appear to fall into two type with one having a better prognosis an australian study show a retrospective review of record for consecutive patient presenting with mac at the alfred hospital melbourne found global systolic dysfunction in patient and a reverse takotsubo pattern in the remaining six the reverse takotsubo patient were nearly all female had a short history of abuse of either ice or speed and relatively high troponini and creatine kinase level these patient all had normalisation of systolic function within week but patient with global systolic dysfunction did not fare so well with only two of the having normalisation of their left ventricular ejection fraction on follow up echocardiography the six patient presenting with the reverse takotsubo pattern is the largest group reported with this pattern in the literature to date say the author led by professor david kaye the study is also the first to find evidence of midwall fibrosis in human abusing methamphetamine in two third of nine global systolic dysfunction patient who underwent cardiac mri one may postulate that methamphetamine abuse elicits a heterogeneous response with some patient developing a chronic fibrotic process while others present with an acute stress reverse takotsubo cardiomyopathy the author say the study looked at all patient with a diagnosis of mac presenting at the hospital between january and july methamphetamineassociated cardiomyopathypatterns and predictor of recovery patient with methamphetamineassociated cardiomyopathy mac appear to fall into two type with one having a better prognosis an australian study show previous next related article please log into disqus to leave a comment by clicking on the blue d icon below if you are not yet registered with disqus then please sign up below thanks mar http wwwminutescomau cardiologyupdate latestnews howiceaffectstheheart

view more job your weight a a teenager is linked to your risk of heart failure in early middle age research that followed more than million swedish men from adolescence onwards between and ha shown that those who were overweight a teenager were more likely to develop heart failure in early middle age surprisingly the increased risk of heart failure wa found in men who were within the normal body weight range a body mass index of to in adolescence with an increased risk starting in those with a bmi of and rising steeply to a nearly tenfold increased risk in those who were very obese with a bmi of or overresearch that followed more than million swedish men from adolescence onwards between and ha shown that those who were overweight a teenager were more likely to develop heart failure in early middle age surprisingly the increased risk of heart failure wa found in men who were within the normal body weight range a body mass index of to in adolescence with an increased risk starting in those with a bmi of and rising steeply to a nearly tenfold increased risk in those who were very obese with a bmi of or over the study which is published today friday in the european heart journal found that in men with a bmi of and over the risk of heart failure increased by with every bmi unit after adjustment for factor that could affect the finding such a age year of enlistment into the swedish armed force other disease parental education blood pressure iq muscle strength and fitness annika rosengren professor of medicine at the sahlgrenska academy gothenburg sweden who led the research said although most study define a normal weight a having a bmi between and this is probably not an appropriate definition in the young most of whom are naturally thin this may be why we see an increase in the risk of heart failure starting at a fairly low bmi level however it wa surprising to see the very steep increase in risk with increasing body weight above a bmi of given the global trend for growing number of teenager to be overweight and obese our finding suggest that heart failure which in this study occurred at the relatively early average age of about may well become a major threat to health worldwide this serf to underline the urgent need for action worldwide to curb the obesity epidemic action need to be taken by government a well a by individual for instance by creating an environment that doe not promote overweight and obesity and that encourages people not to be sedentary and not to eat more than they need this is more important than hassling people into dieting whatever shape they are once established overweight and obesity is much harder to tackle until recently swedish law required all yearold swedish men to enlist in the armed force and between and a total of men enlisted and underwent standardised physical and cognitive examination for this study professor rosengren and her colleague analysed data on men from the swedish conscript registry they followed the men from the time they enlisted at for between five to year an average followup time of year during that time men were admitted to hospital for heart failure with an average age at diagnosis of nearly compared with men who had a bmi of between and at the time of conscription men with a bmi of to had a increased risk of heart failure after adjusting for factor that could affect the result the risk nearly doubled for those with a bmi between and and more than tripled for those with a bmi between and the risk increased more than sixfold for those classified a obese with a bmi between and wa nearly fold for the very obese with a bmi of or more the researcher say their finding suggest that preventive action need to be taken earlier in life prof rosengren said current prevention guideline are meant to guide doctor treating patient with factor that may put them at increased risk of heart and blood vessel problem within the next decade or so the overwhelming majority of young people have an extremely low risk of any such problem and so are not in need of preventive measure on an individual basis except for firm antismoking advice however our finding show the importance of body weight in adolescence and suggest that more emphasis should be placed on the maintenance of a healthy body weight from an early age a a preventive measure the researcher point out that limitation to the study include the fact that their finding are only applicable to men and that overall woman have a lower risk of heart failure than men nor did they have any information on weight gain after the men were conscripted at so that a slightly greater weight at might be an indicator of an increased risk of subsequently becoming overweight or obese which in itself would be a risk factor for heart failure however the strength of the study is it large size with over million participant jun http wwwbiospacecom newsstoryaspxstoryidfull

miami united state taking step to recover from depression and boost vitamin d level may improve heart health according to new research out saturday the finding were contained in two study presented at the american college of cardiology conference in chicago the first focused on depression a known risk factor for heart attack stroke and even death researcher at the intermountain medical center heart institute in salt lake city studied a registry of more than people and found when depressed patient get effective treatment they can lower their risk of heart damage to the same level a a person who never suffered from depression our study show that prompt effective treatment of depression appears to improve the risk of poor heart health said heidi may a cardiovascular epidemiologist with the intermountain medical center heart institute however those who remained depressed had higher rate of heart problem at a rate of about six percent compared to around four percent of people without depression the key conclusion of our study is if depression isnt treated the risk of cardiovascular complication increase significantly may said a second study also led by may focused on two measure of vitamin d which when too low can predict the likelihood of heart attack stroke heart failure or death some people aged to were studied most already had coronary artery disease percent and one quarter were diabetic for doctor who treat these patient the most important measure of vitamin d are known a total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d since both were the most accurate in predicting harmful cardiovascular event said the finding our study found that low level of both total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d appear to be associated with poor cardiovascular outcome said may and evaluating usable vitamin d could mean the difference on the amount of vitamin d prescribed if it prescribed at all may added that more research wa needed to examine caucasian and africanamerican patient since these group are known to be affected differently by vitamin d source technologyinquirernet apr http buzzconnectblogspotcom fixingdepressionboostingvitamindhtml

http wwwredditcom r keto wiki faq adapting to a low carb lifestyle what is keto flu and how long will i have it during the induction phase of a ketogenic diet most people experience a horrid flu that often make people believe from the start that it isnt right for our body consider it the first of your many trial to come the flu is a manifestation of your mental and physical dependence on carbohydrate and the body is essentially going through a phase where it ha to learn to use fat a fuel keto flu can be treated by replenishing your electrolyte see next section the flulike symptom should dissipate in a few day or week but be warned for a long a you eat lowcarb if you dont take care to get enough sodium potassium and magnesium aka electrolyte in your diet you may experience fatigue muscle twitching headache muscle cramping and in severe case arrhythmia leg cramp may be the most common sign that your electrolyte are out of balance how do i replenish electrolyte even if you go out of your way to eat lot of table salt and food containing potassium and magnesium you may find you need to take supplement the minimum daily intake for the three electrolyte is given by lyle mcdonald a mg of sodium salt http enwikipediaorg wiki sodiumchloride mg of potassium in the form of potassium chloride or potassium sulfate mg of magnesium you can track the intake of these mineral with a tool such a myfitnesspalcom most of u will not reach these suggested total with food alone but there are several way to ingest extra electrolyte drink or cup of bouillon or broth daily measure salt and or salt substitute to add to your food over the course of the day take a multivitamin containing magnesium and or potassium take a magnesium supplement use salt or salt substitute to meet the minimum daily intake over the course of the day dont take large amount eg mg of salt substitute potassium at once to avoid adverse effect spread it out over the day instead potassium supplement in capsule tablet form are limited to mg per dose for safety and convenience note unfortunately many potassiumrich food are not ketofriendly for example dont eat banana unless you want to get knocked out of keto several company make lowsodium salt substitute losalt lite salt alsosalt etc for people trying to reduce their sodium intake luckily for keto dieter these product tend to contain lot of potassium which we need a a supplement read the product label to see how much of which mineral it contains people with kidney failure heart failure or diabetes should not use salt substitute without medical advice jun http wwwredditcom r keto comment oiu hicouldsomeonepleaselinktheelectrolytes limitdzcd

great use of vocabulary it still doesnt negate the underlying contention and reasoning for why obesity isnt recognised in a positive manner in society if we are here to talk about obesity in a symbolic manner let me offer a different spectrum could obesity be representative of a privileged life with access to an abundance of food which correlate to economic prosperity is it not indicative of a first world physique we have individual who are suffering from malnutrition in region of africa who we emphatically donate to for the greater good and for humanity and rightly so yet we move onto the opposite spectrum and see individual who have no solid control over their eating habit and we suddenly correlate such thing with artistry no that isnt fair and by blending artistry with obesity doesnt negate the negative impact it may have there a big difference between being overweight and being morbidly obese it is the latter that should not be treated in a positive life the underlying contention of having a positive body image is certainly admirable but we must be able to realise the reality we live in in the end we are human being who have the capacity to suffer chronic illness and heart failure due to a myriad of injury rampant obesity could certainly be correlated with unhealthy eating which correlate to possible clogging of artery leading to a possible heart attack a one example these health effect are often not cognisant with the unwary until it happens to them which i have had the personal unfortunate experience of knowing someone with such illness it not a pretty face i dont necessarily disagree with the premise of body image and reducing depression but im also a realist and that individual have the opportunity to lose weight there is a fine line between being overweight and being morbidly obese which should not be forgotten jun http wwwfacebookcom permalinkphpidvwallstoryfbid

the death of a partner may actually break your heart new research suggests the study found that those who lose a partner are at an increased risk of developing an irregular heartbeat also known a atrial fibrillation which in itself is a risk factor for stroke and heart failure the researcher noted that the risk appears to be greater in younger people after the death of their loved one compared to older generation whats more the risk of an irregular heartbeat also increase when the death is least expected danish researcher collated data from almost people diagnosed with an irregular heartbeat between and and compared it to healthy people a total of of those diagnosed with atrial fibrillation had lost their partner compared to of the comparison group after taking into account a number of lifestyle factor the researcher calculated that the risk of developing an irregular heartbeat for the first time wa higher among those who had been bereaved the author cautioned that no cause and effect can be inferred from the observational study but said that bereavement is known to increase the risk of cardiovascular disease mental illness and even death the loss of a partner is considered one of the most severely stressful life event and is likely to affect most people independently of coping mechanism the study author said according to the press association in this large populationbased study the severely stressful life event of losing a partner wa associated with a transiently increased risk of atrial fibrillation which lasted for about one year the elevated risk wa especially high for those who were young and those who lost a relatively healthy partner bereavement is a major life event which is known to increase the risk of cardiovascular disease mental illness and death the underlying causal mechanism for the association between the loss of a partner and af is unclear but acute stress may posse direct arrhythmogenic property by alternating autonomic control influencing heart rate variability and enhancing proinflammatory cytokine maureen talbot senior cardiac nurse at the british heart foundation added the bereavement of a partner is a devastating event in anyones life but the effect can be even worse when a death is sudden or premature our research ha shown how emotional stress can have an adverse effect on the heart but this study also highlight a significant physical effect a greater risk of developing atrial fibrillation when recently bereaved this risk appears even greater the more sudden the death or younger that person is study to increase understanding of the cause of this finding are needed but it is important to ensure the newly bereaved regardless of their age are monitored and supported by their loved one and to see their gp if they experience any symptom this feed and it content are the property of the huffington post and use is subject to our term it may be used for personal consumption but may not be distributed on a website apr http wwwhuffingtonpostcouk deathofapartnercanbreakyourheartnhtmlutmhprefuklifestyleiruklifestyle

get a diagnosis otherwise in my view it wa off to the psychiatrist this all happened in year ago and i am still going at the time there wa a genuine life expectancy of year for cardiomyopathy but luckily i wa diagnosed the year that cardiverol wa introduced to the world and for chf patient my ef wa i like you had an excellent result from my angiogram pristine artery i didnt get my icd until i got a biventricular pacer with the icd but i wa decompensating at the time and it wa what i needed to keep me going to me it saved my life i know it is a big shock to get a you say this brick in your chest i wa on diagnosis but had a year old daughter so there were a lot of issue that i faced also year on my brick ha saved my life time by shocking me out of cardiac arrest it ha kept my heart going through a lot of other illness not related to heart disease it even saved me when anyone else without an icd would have died from septicemia i have been through cancer gall bladder disease and septicemia a mitral valve replacement a a result of the septicemia and more recently appendicitis all in the past year through all of these illness i have felt assured that i will not die a a result of a sudden cardiac arrest and a my artery are still good i felt that i wa protected through all these issue my heart function is not that good at the moment my ef ha dropped and i am back in chf again but honestly the last thing i worry about is the icd it ha proved that it is a life saver to me mind you the first few year i had the device it really didnt need to do much but in the last year i would be dead if it wasnt there to protect me i look at all the other people out there in the community who could drop dead from a sca and know i am protected just look at the young athlete that drop dead whilst playing or running the tragedy of this is that if they were protected with an icd they would have been able to get up and continue on with their life so yes it is a very big procedure to come to term with it also is a sign that you are not physically well that you have heart disease you are faced with your own mortality and the realization that your world ha changed but once you go through the grieving process regarding these issue you will come out the other side with a certainty that you are protected by your little in your chest so glad you have come on here for support this is a brilliant group you will not get any of the normal platitude from u we speak the truth and from experience nothing like peer on peer support a i am sure you realize a a psychologist jul http cast member tom hiddleston pose during a photocall in san sebastian northern spain september reuters vincent west los angeles british actor tom hiddleston explores the short life of country music star hank williams in i saw the light and performs the singer hit himself in the new biopic the movie follows williams career from his breakthrough in the s to his death from heart failure slumped in the back of his cadillac at the age of in londonborn thor actor hiddleston said one of the biggest challenge he faced wa learning williams accent he ha a resonant tone of a gospel preacher which come from something deep in his southern root he told reuters at the film premiere in los angeles on tuesday night a soon a i started to listen to the cadence and the musicality of the way he spoke that wa when it clicked for me he described the singersongwriter whose hit included your cheatin heart and im so lonesome i could cry a a cornerstone in the development of american music music is the most evocative most immediately emotional art form i think my admiration for singer is huge and i think singing is the most naked mean of expression there nothing to hide behind hiddleston said the film also look at williams relationship with his first wife audrey played by avenger star elizabeth olsen which grew more tempestuous a the singer relied increasingly on painkiller and alcohol it is one of several music biopics including mile ahead with don cheadle a mile davis and born to be blue in which ethan hawke portrays chet baker to be released this year i saw the light open in cinema in los angeles new york and nashville on friday reporting by reuters television in los angeles writing by marielouise gumuchian in london editing by louise ireland mar http newsftcpublicationscom hiddlestonsingshankwilliamshitshimselfinbiopicisawthelight

in a one month period the food and drug administration fda ha issued two separate safety warning involving the type diabetes drug invokana canagliflozin one warning requires janssen pharmaceutical to amend the invokana label to reflect fda concern over kidney injury the other alert involves an increased risk of amputation a may fda alert reported that patient in a clinical trial studying invokana and invokamet a combination drug containing canagliflozin were about twice a likely to undergo amputation a patient taking a placebo interim analysis of study data showed that the equivalent of five of every patient taking a milligram daily dose of the active ingredient canagliflozin needed amputation according to law the equivalent of seven of every patient taking a milligram daily dose needed amputation compared with only three of every patient taking a placebo people with diabetes are already at risk of amputation because the disease can cause nerve damage and impair blood circulation according to the mayo clinic the amputation affected leg toe and foot fda official said they are working to determine whether canagliflozin is responsible for the elevated risk of amputation but the agency stressed that because of the danger of uncontrolled blood sugar patient should not stop taking invokana without first consulting a doctor the fda said patient taking canagliflozin should notify their health care professional right away if they notice any new pain or tenderness sore or ulcer or infection in their leg or foot the clinical trial in question is examining how canagliflozin affect cardiovascular health the trial which is expected to continue ha followed patient for year another trial which followed patient for nine month did not find an elevated risk of amputation the fda said official for janssen pharmaceutical the maker of invokana and invokamet say they remain confident that canagliflozin is an important treatment option for people with type diabetes according to law the other fda warning for invokana wa issued on june the fda announced that invokana label warning for kidney disease and kidney injury would be strengthened invokana canagliflozin and other diabetes drug can cause lifethreatening kidney injury the new warning also includes farxiga and xigduo xr dapagliflozin drug in the same class a invokana the fda said these medication could cause worse acute kidney injury than previously known from march to october there were confirmed case of acute kidney injury onefifth of those case required hospitalization in intensive care four people died law report the change to the drug label will include information about acute kidney injury and added recommendation to minimize this risk the fda said in acute kidney injury the kidney suddenly stop working sign of acute kidney injury include decreased urine or swelling in the leg or foot the fda said a with the may alert the fda said patient should not stop taking the medication because of serious risk if blood sugar is not properly controlled anyone who experience kidney symptom should seek immediate medical attention and should ask the doctor about continued use of the diabetes medication in addition the alert recommends that doctor carefully evaluate the patient predisposition for kidney issue decreased blood volume chronic kidney insufficiency congestive heart failure and use of other medication that may increase the risk through interactionbefore prescribing invokana or a drug in it class share jun http wwwpublichealthwatchdogcom janssenpharmaceuticalshitwithtwoinvokanasafetyalertsinonemonth

hi ardnaxela wecome to grace congratulation on your good response initially to chemo radiation and now to crizotinib im sorry to hear of the symptom your pleural effusion is causing but a dr west ha stated by the formal criterion used in clinical trial to as for response or progression a change in a pleural effusion doe not constitute a significant change in disease status this is because inflammation or infection or even heart failure can cause an effusion and it also a product not just of production of fluid but also the draining ability there are enough variable that we prefer to see it decrease or resolve but we dont consider a worsening effusion a clear evidence of progression http cancergraceorg topic chroniccoughanddifferenceofopinionpost perhaps you can get symptom relief by draining the effusion or further intervention may be possible and desirable such a a pleurodesis a procedure in which a substance is inserted into the pleural space in an effort to cause the layer of the pleura to stick together eliminating the friction which cause the fluid to build up you may want to read dr west post on option for managing recurrent pleural effusion jimc forum moderator mar http cancergraceorg topic clearpetctbutpleuraleffusionlarger post

stanford family show up for stanford conference on potentially lifethreatening heart disease by patrick may pmaymercurynewscom comment stanford the room wa full of story some of hope some of miracle but most we would never want to live through ourselves two hundred family showed up saturday at stanford university for a conference called affair of the heart living with inherited cardiomyopathy one of it more common type is hypertrophic cardiomyopathy or hcm the disease borne of an inherited gene mutation that cause overcontraction of the heart muscle wa the thread that linked everyone here the doctor and nurse from stanford center for inherited cardiovascular disease expert and industry pioneer sharing the latest research on a malady that can cause critical heart failure and even sudden death in young people a well a hcm patient and their parent hcm sometimes come with the growth spurt of the teenage year said dr euan ashley the center director and an internationally renowned expert in the disease that affect about one in people and while it can also show up with older people it also among the most common cause of death in young athlete advertisement early symptom include chest pain and shortness of breath caused by decreased blood flow through the ventricle and the disease if diagnosed in time can sometimes be treated by medication implanted device and in the most dire case surgery and heart transplant in about half the case ashley said genetic and other test can help doctor determine the exact cause of the hcm but thats often just the beginning when we screen other relative including mother father brother and sister he said we find a percent chance of someone else sharing the diagnosis the bingham family from eastern oregon know all too much about those perilous odds stacy bingham who wa at the conference said her yearold daughter sierra suffers from a related heart disease known a dilated cardiomyopathy and ha already undergone two heart transplant after her body rejected the first heart sierra younger sister who also ha the disease received a new heart at stanford and their younger brother is now at the same hospital awaiting a transplant of his own after the first transplant i thought i wa doing great sierra said during an interview outside the conference room at the time of the first operation when sierra wa sierra wa too young to fully grasp what wa going on her mother said before the transplant she asked u how long will it take them to make a new heart for me when that organ wa rejected sierra recalled i kind of freaked out that id have to have a second transplant sierra who had that surgery a year ago now say that prayer help and even though you can never see the future i feel great i think this one will work out these day she help comfort her brother gage who had a pacemaker put in when he wa and now at age is waiting for a transplant of his own sometimes my brother get scared sierra said he asked me doe it hurt to get a new heart while medication such a beta blocker can sometimes relieve symptom and prevent further complication theyre not always enough conference attendee sef samatua a yearold tatoo artist from san jose with two young daughter wa diagnosed with hcm in after he experienced an irregular heartbeat while working out at the gym after several year and several invasive heart procedure samatua ha changed his diet and take medication but i still feel the palpitation more a i get older it feel like my heart skipping a beat while testing revealed that both his kid carry the genetic makeup associated with hcm neither ha been diagnosed the family work together on keeping everyone healthy we steer the girl away from sport he said while they help remind me to be careful to not eat too much salt and fat samatua said that because the beta blocker arent enough to fully treat his hcm hell soon make an appointment to receive a surgically inserted icd or implantable cardioverterdefibrillator which will monitor his heart rhythm if the batteryoperated device detects an abnormal heart rate it delivers energy to the heart muscle to make it beat normally again in the meantime samatua said he remains upbeat and devotes much of his time to spreading awareness of this condition when people talk about a disease like this they think they cant do anything about it he said but my diagnosis uplifted me i want to help others whove lost hope and share my story to show them that you can still lead a good life even with hcm contact patrick may at or follow him at twittercom patmaymerc if youre interested feb http wwwsantacruzsentinelcom health stanfordfamiliesshowupforstanfordconferenceonpotentiallylifethreateningheartdisease

must watch possible first case of cte diagnosed in the living cte is football bogeyman researcher arent sure exactly what make some player susceptible to the disease and others not factor such a genetics and age of first impact may play a role but what is clear for many researcher is that it occurs because of repeated head trauma that result in a buildup of an abnormal protein called tau the tangle of tau can overtake part of the brain that control for memory mood and aggression the symptom are similar to alzheimers but begin much earlier there are four stage of the disease and the most severe case can result in suicidal thought thing to know about cte fred jr remembers hearing the headline of other player dave duerson junior seau and mike webster all seemed to have parallel to his father life thats when you start to realize ok yeah the rage the forgetfulness the identity crisis he said gavin even talked to his father about suicide and his dad brushed it off im not going to do that nah nah just joking around gavin recalled it a conversation no son should have with their father all gavin could say wa i hope you wouldnt i love you just know that if you hear me hear that first cte ha no cure it can only be diagnosed with an autopsy tia mcneill had no idea at the time what her husband future looked like but she knew that when he passed she would have omalu evaluate his brain we wanted to know she said diagnosing the living in omalu approached the mcneills with a new technology that he had helped developed and is invested in called taumark it u a radioactive tracer called fddnp to bind to tau protein in the brain the tau protein can then be seen on a positron emission tomography or pet scan omalu explained to cnn that this technology could only be licensed to corporation and that his motive behind it is not profit but research when omalu and his team examined the scan there were angry red splotch all over fred mcneills brain his wife wasnt surprised living brain scan of five former nfl player including fred mcneill critic say the test is too early it only been used on former football player but more importantly they say it isnt precise enough it bind to tau a well a amyloid protein a signature for alzheimers omalu said it not just what the marker is highlighting but where the highlight are tau ha a distinctive pattern in cte and omalu said his test is tracing the tau in the same place he found it in autopsy meanwhile mcneills dementia continued to worsen his outburst became more extreme ultimately the family moved him into an assisted living facility it wa more for his safety tia mcneill said a different kind of care fred mcneill found a home at the silverado beverly memory care community in los angeles a few block from gavins office and minute away from his wife home silverado is one of the nfls two preferred provider of memory care it wa the best care they could find but tia mcneill said it wa never a perfect fit there were yearolds at the facility and fred mcneill wa just in his early s still relatively fit he wanted to walk throw around football he loved music and karaoke former nfl player need a different kind of care tia mcneill contends sylvia mackey wife of hall of famer john mackey agrees she wrote a letter to thennfl commissioner paul tagliabue about caring for her husband dementia the letter wa the impetus to form the plan the nfls benefit plan for player experiencing dementia lou gehrig disease and parkinson sylvia mackey get call from nfl wife all the time about what to look for and what they can do to help their husband she recalled when her husband entered a nursing home surrounded by folk in wheelchair who could barely get around she remembers him pushing the other resident in their wheelchair she said it wasnt just the age difference but the pure physical difference of the former football player they need larger bed and larger equipment a the disease progress and they become le mobile they need lift chair thing they need to help them move around and the staff cant shoulder that physically themselves they need equipment to help mackey said fred mcneill wa a linebacker for the minnesota viking she also said the former athlete still identify a player brother of a certain bond tia mcneill agrees she said her husband lit up when he found out manfred moore a former pro football player wa also at silverado the two had played college football against each other when fred mcneill wa at ucla and moore at rival usc it not clear how many former player are now in assisted living facility in loren shook president and ceo of silverado told the chicago sun time we have treated about nfl player we have about a dozen right now cnn ha reached out to the nfl retired player association but ha not heard back however through the nfl alumnus association sylvia mackey is now working with validus senior living to open an assisted living facility in all nfl city each facility would work with a younger and healthier population dealing with dementia there no road map there no support for this tia mcneill said there no protocol when youre afflicted with cte what it look like and how to care for that person best she want there to be more a final blow in march fred mcneill wa diagnosed with lou gehrig disease also called amyotrophic lateral sclerosis or al study have found that former professional football player are four time more likely to suffer neurodegenerative disease such a al parkinson and alzheimers mcneills hand had become shaky he wa losing control from the waist up he eventually wa put on feeding tube because he couldnt eat on november mcneills family brought him home from the hospital they wanted him to enjoy his last day in peace we brought him home on a monday morning and he passed he wasnt here hour tia mcneill recalled photo athlete and cte former minnesota viking linebacker fred mcneill died in november at the age of due to complication from al however an autopsy confirmed that he suffered from cte what make mcneills case even more remarkable though is that he wa potentially the first to be diagnosed while alive doctor used an experimental new technology to examine his brainscientists believe repeated head trauma can cause cte a progressive degenerative disease of the brain symptom include depression aggression and disorientation but so far scientist can only definitively diagnose it after death here are a few of the former athlete who have been diagnosed with cte hide caption of photo athlete and cte one time nfl mvp and oakland raider by debra redman lmt nctmb margarette is the picture of health so a mini health crisis came a a surprise in the same week her divorce wa to be final she wa scheduled a an outpatient for an ablation a type of heart surgery on wednesday and replacement breast implant surgery on friday the postsurgical recovery would have most people flat on their back for more than just a few day imagine my surprise when she answered her door for a manual lymph drainage massage the day after the heart surgery the immune system doe not react well to being overstressed margarette wa experiencing a very stressful time in her life she had swelling in her right leg from the malfunctioning valve in her heart the collapsed breast implant left her chest feeling heavy a a medical massage therapist i suggested she relieve some of the discomfort with a medical massage modality called manual lymph drainage mld this specialized technique is designed to stimulate the immune system and help the lymphatic system achieve healing in the body margarette received mld both before and immediately after her surgery preoperative mld clean the area so that there is little bleeding creating an environment that decrease pain level and the chance for infection this primed her lymph system to start moving toxin out of her body before the surgery the effect of mld last up to hour depending upon the duration of the massage the result is that it slows the amount of bleeding during surgery and cause the body to begin detoxifying the chemical from the anesthesia and other medication immediately the postoperative session kept the process going diminishing pain level to the point where margarette didnt need any medication she recovered so quickly she wa back at work by the following wednesday missing only five workday mld u very gentle precise stroke to promote the release of fluid buildup in the body called edema any interruption in lymph circulation can impair the functioning of the body immune system it ability to repair damaged tissue and cause chemical imbalance in the body if left untreated the swelling could potentially lead to a more serious medical condition called lymphedema edema is a condition defined a swelling that occurs when interstitial fluid build up in the muscle of the body lymphedema is a build up of fluid in the lymph system unlike edema lymphedema can become a chronic condition that ha consequence for the whole body swelling pain numbness sensation of pressure increased susceptibility to infection loss of mobility and impaired wound healing are all a result of chronic lymphedema chronic swelling ha four level of manifestation micro edema mild or pitting edema nonpitting edema and severe hardening the first two can be reversed and usually completely alleviated with mld the last two cannot be reversed but mld may help relieve the symptom some reason why the lymph system will respond with edema include illness lack of exercise injury ie sport surgery disease and being on an airplane flight mld help both acute and chronic condition type of condition that mld cannot help include kidney disease nephritis leaking blood vessel varicose vein third degree burn congestive heart failure untreated high blood pressure obstruction in the circulation system thrombosis or clot and active cancer most people learn about the effect of lymphedema when they experience cancer based on client feedback very little information is disseminated to noncancer patient about how to take care of the swelling they experience after a sport injury accident or surgical procedure not very many people are told about the benefit of mld prior to surgical event or the impact on healing after surgery i have discussed mld with heart surgeon podiatrist chiropractor and orthopedic and plastic surgeon it is my concern that few know how to fully utilize mld or pay any attention to the role that edema play in healing doctor dont seem to be addressing the impact chronic swelling ha when treating condition that wont heal appropriately i have used mld to treat client who have experienced injury from sport acute and chronic accident or surgery cancer patient in remission parkinson patient pregnant woman fibromyalgia chronic fatigue allergy and sinus problem i recommend mld for breast cancer prevention and maintenance if you knew that this natural noninvasive treatment wa available and it work why wouldnt you do it related natural product immunity plus is a natural safe and effective liquid herbal formula that is a blend of african asian and other herb specifically formulated to optimize immune functioning immunity plus is a potent complex remedy that contains ingredient to provide a wide range of benefit to those suffering from depressed immune system or wish to boost their optimal functioning this includes a liver tonic immune system strengthening improved body functioning detoxification and enhanced convalescence immunity plus can be used to tone and strengthen the immune system during and after illness and is a useful overall tonic for the body created by a clinical psychologist immunity plus is pharmaceutically manufactured to the highest standard about the author debra is a nationally certified and licensed massage therapist whose practice is located at franklin rd marietta in labyrinth centre save free pdf health ebook are you looking for the best vein treatment denver we have the answer to a variety of common vein problem including varicose and spider vein treatment always have an ultrasound performed before allowing any procedure to test for reflux disease a further complication could arise if undetected and the varicose vein could return when wa the last time you paid any attention to your vein maybe when you gave blood and yet they are an integral part of the vascular system that keep u aliveday in and day outwhether we think about it or not vein are the blood vessel that carry blood back to the heart and into the lung to be replenished with the oxygen and nutrient the body need to function and stay healthy for the blood to get to the heart from the leg it must travel upwards against gravity it doe this with the help of the vein and the muscle that surround them when we stand and walk the muscle constrict squeezing the vein and pushing the blood toward the heart through a system of valve when we sit or at rest the muscle relax and valve within the vein close to prevent blood from flowing back into the leg and foot about percent of our blood return to the heart by way of the deep veinsveins that lie deep within the body the other two type of vein are superficial and connecting superficial vein are the one you can see through your skin they carry blood from tissue closer to the surface of your skin to the deep vein where the blood flow to the heart connecting vein carry blood from the superficial vein to the deep vein unfortunately our vein can also develop problem the following chart list and describes the most common vein problem that can develop in the leg some are more serious than others but all are worth discussing with your doctor type of vein problem description thrombosis a blood clot in the vein blood clot can block blood flow or break free and travel through the blood stream to the heart and lung pulmonary embolism thrombophlebitis swelling caused by a blood clot in the vein it can occur in the superficial or deep vein deep vein thrombosis dvt with dvt blood clot form in the large vein deep within the leg pelvis and sometimes in the arm dvt strike about in people over the course of a lifetime pulmonary embolism pe when a blood clot break free from a deep vein and make it way into an artery in the lung it is called a pulmonary embolism pe pe is lifethreatening condition that can cause heart failure it is important to call if you have trouble breathing or if you are coughing up blood postthrombotic syndrome also known a postphlebitic syndrome and venous stress disorder in this condition the symptom of pain heaviness in the leg or foot cramp itching tingling bluish or brownish flaky skin sore and varicose vein caused by dvt continue after treatment either because the blood clot is still there or the blood clot caused other damage to the vein chronic venous insufficiency cvi venous reflux high blood pressure in the vein venous hypertension varicose vein spider vein cvi is damage or weakness in the vein wall or vein valve that allows blood to flow backl down into the vein venous reflux the backflow of blood accumulates in the vein and cause inflammation phlebitis and more clotting clotting can block or slow blood flow through the vein raising the blood pressure and possibly causing more damage varicose and spider vein are caused by the accumulation of the blood from venous reflux phlebitis swelling in the deep or superficial vein is called phlebitis venous sore when pressure in the vein continues for a long time it can break down healthy tissue which cause ulcer or sore congenital vascular malformation includes birthmark this is a catchall term for the very few people le than percent who are born with vein that are defective in some way for example the vein may not have valve this category also includes birthmark that are a mass of vein close to the skin click here to learn about about year ago i completed my internal medicine training in upstate new york which included a weekly outpatient clinic and ward rotation at the local va hospital i love military history and enjoyed the opportunity to talk to many ww ii veteran back then there were even a few ww i soldier still around in those day these were everyday working class even humble men who quietly lived common life but had participated in some of the most storied and celebrated battle in the last century they were part of a generation that made tremendous sacrifice and embodied many of the value that made america great it wa my privilege to hear some of the story of this so called greatest generation first hand one ww ii veteran wa in my clinic for over two year so i wa his physician for an extended period time he wa a tall large man with a long grey beard and he always wore a confederate cap i always thought the hat reflected a bit of his gentlemanliness demeanor with just a hint of a rebel in him he wa a simple man who although i wa so much younger basically a kid in those day always treated me with the utmost respect and called me doc but never with my last name we got to know each other fairly well a he wa in severe chronic heart failure so i wa seeing him in my clinic on a frequent basis to adjust his medication one day he told me his own personal story about the war it turned out he had served under patton in north africa he described the scene of his last battle in that war and in my mind eye i felt i wa there he wa on a high hill and the german had overrun and nearly surrounded his position most of his company had been killed or retreated from his position he could see the enemy advancing on three side it wa rock and gravel and sand like the moon there wa dust and the smell gunpowder and the smoke and odor of burning diesel and oil the german could not see his exact location and so were firing indiscriminately up the hill on the other hand from his vantage point he could see the terrain well and wa systematically picking off enemy soldier one at a time with well placed rifle shot he wa apparently incredibly deliberate and collected under the most intense circumstance his own foxhole buddy wa already down but he thought still alive it wa only a matter of time before they were both either dead or prisoner suddenly the enemy stopped firing and my friend knew that the german were sending a scout to ascertain his precisef location to better target his position he also knew that he only had a few moment left so he picked up his buddy in a fireman carry and started running away from the enemy position had he not been carrying his friend he would have been able to move much faster he wa nearly over the crest of the hill that would have put him temporarily out of sight and gun range when he wa knocked down a bullet tore through his left shoulder and upper chest he fell heavily to the ground with a gaping chest wound his friend rolled a short distance completely inert it wa only much later he would find out his buddy did not survive my friend wa bleeding heavily but his next breath collapsed his lung and much of the bleeding must have slowed he lost consciousness and awoke in the dark he wa unable to get up and drifted in and out of consciousness all night the next day he wa picked up by american force that had reclaimed that territory of the battlefield his wound were severe and his recovery prolonged but he survived though he never fought in uniform again he wa awarded the purple heart but other more prestigious metal of distinction would never come because no one else lived to testify about his heroism he had not told the story to many people he said because he just never enjoyed talking about the war a lifetime of cigarette and alcohol had taken a toll on him a he fought other inner battle not the kind of fight that were won by gun or violence when i met him a i mentioned he wa also battling severe health problem remarkably i wa able to keep him out of the hospital for a fairly long time however eventually thing fell apart and he wa hospitalized and started a down hill spiral he had been in for a few week and just not getting better during that time he had no visitor and he never spoke of family so i suspected he wa alone in the world i wa on call every third night which typically meant working hour straight it wa after midnight and i visited him in the icu the room wa dark and we could only see from the dim light in the hallway he knew that he only had a short time left he thanked me for the care i had given him and then started talking about the war again you know doc i never regretted the thing i did or those german i killed i knew if i didnt kill them they would kill me but lately in my dream im seeing the face of all those young german boy i killed i thought to myself their face i pondered if this wa a trick of his memory but didnt ask how close quartered his combat experience had been generally you see an enemy face in handtohand combat i had always presumed the enemy wa far away and never really knew exactly how many there had been now in his final battle he wa going back to one of his first battle death is the final enemy and my friend knew he wa going to the same place to which he had sent others to year ago he died that night alone with his memory and dream he wa a soldier a patriot a hero and had become my friend many of u dont really understand the physical and mental burden our veteran carry with them often for their entire life it wa my honor to know and serve this true hero thank you friend for your service and sacrifice and also thanks to all the countless others who have served in uniform fought killed and even died for our safety and freedom apr http wwwredditcom r history comment hh astorytoldtomebyawwveteranisharethis limithh

remember when adult stem cell advocate were called antiscience by the embryonic stem cell lobby for arguing that we could have our regenerative medicine and noncontentious ethic too i do well the socalled antiscientists had it far more right than their accuser adult stem cell from patient own body have been shown in study to halve death from heart failure in comparison to patient receiving placebo from the telegraph story stem cell can repair a damaged heart and potentially halve the number of people dying from heart failure scientist have shown in a major breakthrough for regenerative medicine now in the largest trial ever conducted doctor in the u have proven that even the most serious case of heart failure can be repaired using stem cell harvested from a patient own bone marrow endstage patient whose only hope wa a heart transplant were treated with stem cell in a single operation doctor found the group were per cent le likely to have been admitted to hospital in the month following the operation and half a likely to have died than those on placebo i did a google search and found very few story covering this wonderful breakthrough how telling about medium bias still in the tank for the embryonic approach indeed if this had been an embryonic stem cell breakthrough you would have heard the headline dont be surprised if the next embryonic stem cell animal study brings greater news coverage than this very hopeful story of an ethical technique now alleviating great human suffering image credit sergey nivens dollar photo club crossposted at human exceptionalism apr http wwwevolutionnewsorg antisciencerehtml

i think there a fundamental misunderstanding here betablockers such a propranolol act by blocking beta and beta receptor throughout the body beta receptor when stimulated cause an increase in heart rate among other effect beta receptor when stimulated cause a whole bunch of other thing such a vasodilation relaxation of blood vessel relax bronchiole etc now betablockers are usually given to someone in heart failure or with atrial fibrillation in these state the heart is working to hard at rest and is doing damage to itself because of this work because it is working so hard it is becoming ischemic a lack of oxygen and other nutrient betablockers block beta receptor and cause the resting heart rate to decrease this cause the heart to not work a hard at rest which increase the survival for people with these condition now betablockers block a certain amount of betaadrenergic stimulation but not all of it that would be very dangerous so when you exercise even if you are taking your betablockers there is such a flood of acetylcholine the molecule that stimulates betablockers that it can bind to receptor even in the presence of the drug and cause an increase in heart rate therefore even if you are on the drug you still get increase in heart rate with higher than normal level of stimulation mar http wwwredditcom r askscience comment ja howdobetablockerslowerrestingheartratebut limitdke

former ufc heavyweight champion and twotime ncaa division i wrestling champion kevin randleman ha passed away at the age of bleacher report jeremy botter would later report the ohio state buckeye legend wa hospitalized with pneumonia before suffering heart failure randleman first emerged onto the mixed martial art scene in winning the uvtf one night tournament with three straight stoppage win the beast eventually made his way over to the ufc debuting at ufc a a entrant in the road to the heavyweight title tournament after earning a unanimous decision over former champion maurice smith randleman dropped a split decision in the tournament final round to future ufc hall of famer ba rutten the judge decision remains one of the most controversial decision in mma history randleman later rebounded with a unanimous decision over pete williams earning the vacant ufc heavyweight champion in the process he would later defend it one time before suffering a third round tko to randy couture another future hall of famer randleman fought just two more time under the ufc banner suffering a first round ko to chuck liddell and earning a decision over renato sobral before jumping over toe pride fc in japan it wa here randleman took part in many of his most famous bout including a thrilling first round ko victory over mma legend mirko cro cop for his performance randleman earned both upset and knockout of the year his followup performance would eventually go down a one of the most iconic scene in mma history in front of a sold out crowd at the saitama super arena randleman dropped poundforpound great fedor emelianenko on his skull with a powerful suplex however emelianenko quickly recovered and finished randleman with a first round kimura randleman would close his career with loss in eight of his next bout including submission setback to cro cop mauricio shogun rua and roger gracie in his last professional bout fan saw randleman suffer yet another submission loss this time at the hand baga agaev in may he finished his career with nine stoppage win including five by way of knockout feb http themmacornercom it done thank goodness so monkeyman went in on thursday early morning without complaint because he couldnt eat or drink or had to wake up early just to go and sit and wait and wait and wait at hospital he is such a sweet sweet boy having an aspergers child in the house i cant help but appreciate his cooperation and nondefiant behaviour so very very much it make his and our life soooo easy i know it unfair that i compare him and his sister but hey theyre sibling it impossible not to notice when one child scream her head off about everything and another say yes mom of course mom to every thing you demand of him so monkeyman got to the hospital and entertained himself on his tablet for hour and hour and watched a bit of tv we got to talk to all three the doctor before the op the pediatric gastroenterologist ge answered some of our question and really calmed my nerve the phdoctor came to discus the procedure and what gerd is etc and wa really surprised when she realised not only do we exactly know and that our whole family ha it but that she wa the one that did my my eldest daughter and eldest son phstudies year ago a well then came this really really young looking anaesthesiologist it scared my husband a bit to trust our son who ha had anaesthesia problem into the hand of someone looking like he hasnt even finished medical school let alone specialised already but somehow i wa ok with it thinking that maybe a a young dr he would be up to date on all the newest thing and it turned out to be true before the operation my husband went to a lot of trouble to contact the previous anaesthesiologist that took care of monkeyman the ge doctor asked him to my husband requested a list of all the medication they used and we put all of it together on one page which we presented this newest anaestheologist with he listened carefully to the symptom and progression that monkeyman experienced every time he received anaesthesia it wa always the same he would wake up confused like any normal child screaming fighting cry then in time he calmed down and sometimes would fall asleep when he had the pulmonary hypertension he slept for hour after the anaesthesia still this is all normal then about hour after the anaesthesia everytime the vomitting start doesnt matter how strong the antinausea med they give him during the anaesthesia this continues for the rest of the day gagging and vomitting inbetween nausea then the physical tiredness he can barely lift his head walking to the bathroom is too much to bear he just lie down on the couch and doesnt move for hour and hour about hour after anaesthesia the fever start this continues for about hour around this time or a bit earlier his nose start to run and it clog up with his eye s tearing exactly like a cold the worst isnt the symptom but the fact that you can see this is an ill child that something really is wrong but when you try to tell someone they all say oh but it normal to not feel well after anaesthesia yeah i know but this wa different the first time he wa a small child of year old and we thought that he mustve come down with a bug unrelated to the fact that he had anaesthesia just by chance having it at the same time a he wokes up from anaesthesia the second time it wa very fishy to see the exact same progression of symptom but again i thought he mustve came down with a bug at the same time a the procedure or that maybe the pipe down his throat wa to blame he wa then age he wa really really ill we wrote it partly off due to the fact that he had pulmonary hypertension and an enlarged heart but still it really bothered u seeing him so very very ill so whenever someone just mention a possible gastroscopy we backpedalled we just didnt want to face the anaesthesia again our instinct wa to protect our child and putting him through anaesthesia went through everything we knew wa good for him our instinct screamed but we knew at some stage it just simply had to be done so when this dr said it needed we told her about our fear and experience so she asked u to get a list of all the medication used in his previous anaesthesia i didnt even think it possible but all doctor came through for u and when we presented the newest anaesthesiologist with the list he said he believe that it the gas that make monkeyman so ill after the gastroscopy the gastroenterologist came to talk to u for quite a while shes such a sweet caring doctor anyway she said that the anaesthesiologist belief that monkeyman may have malignant hyperthermia she said it time accentuating it sound like the anaestheliologist really wanted u to know that he think thats what it is which make sense to me when i googled it malignant really doe mean malignant it scare me big time but at the same time i have this huge relief in me one le puzzle to try and figure out a possible diagnosis basically it mean that a gene on one chromosome mutated and make the body unable to handle gas inhalant anaesthesia the body basically kill itself within hour fortunately monkeyman havent had a bad case of it yet just the start of the symptom like the fever and exhaustion and nausea he must just never ever get gas again then hell be fine also no cocaine ecstasy or such which i dont really see a a concern at this point i know itll be strange for people to understand the relief of knowing my child probably ha malignant hyperthermia but we had this sword hanging over our head fearing monkeymans next anaesthesia it feel like we have removed that sword now it an enemy we could deal with and we dealt with it it make me happy and relieved and grateful make sense so how wa monkeyman after the gastroscopy well he wa confused for about minute directly after the operation he fought and tangled all the wire something terrible then he woke up properly watched tv for an hour ate stood up and walked out of the hospital such a trooper no nausea until late the night no vomitting no fever unfortunately still the runny nose clogged sinus and red and teary eye so so much better but not all symptom gone no lying down all day no abnormal tiredness nothing he ate and drank normally unlike the previous time just a normally tired little boy who had minute of anaesthesia really just normal of course he only got iv anaesthesia not gas but he barely flinched when they put the iv in so allinall such an easy child he asked for daddy to go in with him i wa really so happy about that it wonderful to see their bond and i had more than my share of seeing my baby made to sleep the only thing is now just this runny nose and teary eye and clogged sinus why would anaesthesia do that to him is it still an allergy is it a reaction similar to the malignent hyperthermia is it because his immune system is lower than the average child the gastroenterologist wa very happy with everything during the operation she found no structural abnormality like constriction or growth or such no clear sign of issue except that the stomach wa quite red abnormally but nonspecific red she took biopsy of the throat tummy and intestine she also took a lot of blood shes gonna get a new baseline for him since the last one wa over a year ago and then when she wa done the ph doctor inserted the ph study while he wa still under so that he wa saved that trauma at least thank goodness for caring doctor he didnt like the little pipe at all it bothered him quite a bit a much a it did me shame man but again he wa a trooper i kept him at home and after hour we went to the ph doctor to take it out she only gave u some prelimenary result shell send the full report to the ge dr the news wasnt good even despite being on high do of med x a day already he still had a positive gerd test he refluxed x during the day and x during the night of those event didnt just rise up into the throat but the contends of the stomach very little acid due to the medication moved right into his mouth poor little boy no wonder he complains about nausea and aspirated his stomach contends when he wa on le medication so ya our hope of lowering his medication dossage wa dashed she said we simply cannot do that to him it will damage his lung to the point where it can kill him she said after year of aspiration it look like smoker lung now we wait for the ge call next week to tell u what the biopsy and blood show and her opinion on the reflux report ah well im so good with waiting these day boeboes long road ha taught me at least that hahaha no really im ok with the waiting i remember how i used to complain on this blog about the waiting but ive come a long long way i have learned patience and perserverance and i know nothing ever get to the point of being fixed so no point in being impatient it not a destination it a road with reststops along the way maybe come to think about it that wa the lesson i needed to learn maybe that answer the why so many people have asked or mentioned this past few year how come one family could have so many little rare issue they deal with well maybe that wa so that i could reach this point of acceptance and just founding the joy in the here and now enjoying every day we a a family have together apr http roadtosanmicheleblogspotcom gastroscopybiopsiesandphimpedementhtml

to the hospital i prayed please god let me be back to raise them at that time while i wa terror stricken the doctor implanted a metal filter in my main vein leading to my lung to prevent any clot from breaking off and traveling there to kill me i remember being awake a they threaded a tiny metal basket down through my neck through my heart down into my abdomen a safety net they told me until i formed another clot above it and that clot became fear in the form of my own body the month after that were beyond harrowing i wa scared to be alone in case i collapsed and the kid were left alone i in is even harder than it sound constant appointment several ambulance ride blood test genetics testing all to later find that the reason id gotten the clot in the first place wa because of a cluster of event including a genetic condition called factor v leiden my body once triggered to clot would have a difficult time shutting off that process a chain effect but even though that wa the most terrible time in my life through god grace i recovered slowly and timidly nervous to put my toe back in the water the girl grew i wa grateful to be there to watch it and never took it for granted time marched on but never far from the what ifs of if it ever happened again the fear ha stifled imprisoned taunted it ha whispered to me in dark room and been my alarm clock many morning i had just started getting counseling for what my therapist thought wa ptsd from it when suddenly a month ago completely out of the blue and four year almost to the day i felt that familiar pain again and the panic returned surely it wa just anxiety surely i just needed to breathe deeper calm my thought surely but unable to let it go i called the doctor and almost collapsed when after an ultrasound they told me i had a clot once again the room spun i rung my hand i can barely remember leaving that place how could this be my path again god didnt i suffer enough and the wave were up to my waist fear had returned with his ugly face to whisper see i told you so youll never be able to get away i own you but a fear tried once again to take over god voice reminded me that what satan lay out for evil god reweaves for good now ive had week of test blood work and appointment back to the same seat in the clinic waiting room that still somehow feel warm from when i left the doctor in order to verify there wa no further clotting up higher ordered a ct scan he said just to be sure i went and i shook and tear dripped into my ear a i lay there on my back being prepped i prayed in that tube staring up at the light painted to look like a beautiful sky a if a painted cherry blossom and a cloud wa going to calm me i wa done soon enough and i went home and then i waited and waited and waited a week into my mom group at church thankful for the grace of each new day thankful for what wa obviously good but then i got the message the ct scan result had not showed any further clotting but incidentally had seen fluid around my heart a note said i needed to call my cardiologist right away the message said try not to worry it should have also said definitely do not google but of course i did and the finding were so scary that the water around me looked like mud there are many reason one could develop fluid around their heart and many different level you could have a small effusion caused by a virus or illness you could have a medium sized one caused from trauma or autoimmune issue or in the worst scenario you could have a large effusion that could be life threatening and often had a very high mortality rate caused from cancer or bleeding from the heart surely mine wa a small then i told myself i felt ok they would have called me to come in right away if it were more serious right i spent my weekend in on off fear cry often laughing some thinking constantly the wave slowly moving up further and now around my neck this morning before i could even call her the phone rang it wa my cardiologist her voice sounded serious a she laid out the next step to diagnose the why of this new finding id need an echocardiogram and some blood work to start once they figured out the reason and actual amount of fluid they would know how to treat it she said she had seen the report but would need to know more before she could know how to move forward and then i asked it even though respiratory disease is defined a medical condition affecting the breathing organ and tissue including inflammatory lung disease obstructive lung disease restrictive lung disease respiratory tract infection trachea bronchus bronchiole alveolus the nerve and muscle breathing etc pleural disease pleural effusion the pleura is a thin tissue covered by a layer of cell mesothelial cell that surround the lung and line the inside of the chest wall pleural effusion is a condition of collection of fluid within the pleural cavity a a result of heart failure bleeding hemothorax infection excessive or decreased fluid volume etc type of pleural effusion depending to fluid accumulation b hydrothorax pleural effusion a a result of serous fluid accumulation in many case it is a result of cirrhosis according to the study by the harvard medical school patient with cirrhosis and portal hypertension often have abnormal extracellular fluid volume regulation resulting in accumulation of fluid a ascites oedema or pleural effusion these complication carry a poor prognosis with nearly half of the patient with ascites dying in the ensuing year other case may be result a a complicating peritoneal effusion a a result of blood accumulation within the pleural cavity in most case it is a result from a injury to the thorax resulting to ruptured blood to spill into the pleural space according to the lisinopril is an ace inhibitor ace stand for angiotensin converting enzyme lisinopril is used to treat high blood pressure hypertension or congestive heart failure it is also used to improve survival after a heart attack mechanism of action renin synthesized by the kidney is released into the circulation where it act on a plasma precursor to produce angiotensin i which is converted by angiotensinconverting enzyme to angiotensin ii a potent vasoconstrictor that also cause release of aldosterone from the adrenal lisinopril block the conversion of angiotensin i to angiotensin ii leading to decreased bp decreased aldosterone secretion a small increase in serum potassium level and sodium and fluid loss indication hypertension congestive heart failure myocardial infarction diabetic nephropathy contraindication kidney disease or if you are on dialysis liver disease diabetes high level of potassium in your blood adverse effect headache dizziness insomnia fatigue gastric irritation chest pain itching tired feeling loss of appetite dark urine reference wwwdrugscom http wwwdoctorsloungecom mar http healthmedicalinfohmiblogspotcom lisinoprilaceinhibitorhtml
