patient with heart failure often have a buildup of scar tissue that lead to a gradual loss of heart function but researcher say they are making progress toward an approach that could shrink the amount of heart scar tissue while replenishing the supply of healthy heart muscle the finding published in the journal cell stem cell came from researcher from the university of north carolina school of medicine our past work brought hope that we could one day improve heart function in people with heart failure by converting scar tissue into beating heart muscle said li qian phd assistant professor of pathology and laboratory medicine and the study senior author but that wa more of a proofofprinciple study and the conversion rate wa quite low now we have found the barrier to conversion and by removing it we have been able to significantly increase the yield of musclelike cell heart failure ha no cure and currently affect an estimated million people in the united state common symptom include shortness of breath fatigue and swelling all of which often worsen a the heart weakens over time our hope is that this approach could extend the life of people with heart failure and markedly improve their quality of life in the future said qian who is also a member of the mcallister heart institute at unc in qian and her colleague created a cocktail of protein capable of converting fibroblast which create scar tissue into cardiomyocytes heart muscle cell that beat on their own exactly the way regular heart muscle cell do notably the team approach did not require converting fibroblast into stem cell which is typical of other tissue regeneration technique qians approach lowered the likelihood of uncontrolled cell growth and tumor formation in experiment using mouse the cocktail proved successful at shrinking the size of scar tissue and improving heart function but the process had remained disappointingly slow until now we wanted to have a better yield and shorten the conversion time so in the future this process could be fast easy and efficient for disease modeling or for treatment qian said the new breakthrough came when the team discovered that a gene called bmi interfered with the expression of other key gene needed to convert fibroblast into heart muscle cell bmi previously had been investigated for it role in neural stem cell and cancer cell but this is the first study to pinpoint a role in it interaction with cardiogenic gene when the team depleted bmi the conversion rate sped up markedly the percentage of fibroblast that transformed into heart muscle cell increased fold repressing bmi also allowed qians team to simplify the cocktail by reducing the number of different protein in it mar http thirdagecom acellularremedyforheartfailure

what is the kingdom of god where is the kingdom of god is the kingdom of god just another word or synonym in the gospel for heaven the kingdom of god spark many question and rightly so when searching the gospel for kingdom of god or kingdom of heaven which appears more often in the gospel according to saint matthew one is amazed by the numerous reference throughout the century believer have pondered the meaning and implication of the kingdom of god and scholar certainly have grappled with the phrase and filled library shelf with volume of thoughtprovoking commentary what can and must we do with the reality of the kingdom in our day in pope paul vi penned the apostolic exhortation evangelii nuntiandi on evangelizing in our day early in the exhortation the bishop of rome state a an evangelizer christ first of all proclaims a kingdom the kingdom of god and this is so important that by comparison everything else becomes the rest which is given in addition only the kingdom therefore is absolute and it make everything else relative the lord will delight in describing in many way the happiness of belonging to this kingdom a paradoxical happiness which is made up of thing that the world reject the demand of the kingdom and it magna charta the herald of the kingdom it mystery it child the vigilance and fidelity demanded of whoever awaits it definitive coming evangelii nuntiandi clearly pope paul vi see the kingdom of god ha the central experience of jesus public ministry so central that everything in his ministry is grounded in the kingdom similarly the catechism of the catholic church paragraph through examines the manifold depth of the kingdom in jesus public ministry based on these text a well a other catechetical document the roman missal and the sacred scripture i have compiled a working description note not a definition of the kingdom of god that ha been helpful to undergraduate deacon candidate seminarian and believer there is certainly much room for discussion in this description and is in no way intended to be exhaustive the kingdom of god is god our father intervening definitively in the created order the kingdom is not necessarily or strictly a specific place although place will be a dimension of the kingdom a a way of living the kingdom is a way of living an ongoing activity initiated by god the father in loving concern for being that have been created in his image and likeness we have become addicted to sin in such a way that we cannot break free from it grip by our own power we have come to enjoy sin too much sin tentacle have woven deeply into our life that often we cannot see or think clearly we may from timetotime have great desire to rid ourselves of sin desire that are marvelous but desire that do not contain within themselves the power to effect what is desired more often than not however sin ha dulled our sen to divine love sin ha numbed u into complacency and entitlement to the point that we even approach the thing of god and church from a selfish point of view with no regard to the life of faith a engagement with the divine person who call me a an individual and a a community to ongoing conversion manifesting charity and service to the body of christ so powerless over sin so addicted to the false self we have become that an intervention is needed the kingdom of god this intervention is a work of power a power that transforms and surpasses the power of creation god the father work is quintessentially a work of restoration not annihilation ask anyone in construction and he or she will tell you that it is often easier to raze a building and start over than to renovate or restore renovating an existing structure that doe not have a level plumb or square line in it make restoration tedious and time consuming not to mention the surprise lurking behind old plaster and lathe yet ask any restorer when the project is complete and most likely she or he will tell you that in spite of it challenge and frustration it wa and continues to be a labor of love such is the kingdom neither creation nor humanity is destroyed the creator doe not raze the created order and begin anew even though humanity make continuous choice reinforcing the addiction to sin the father with eye of love gaze upon each human person in such a way that each of u are declared precious so precious are we in the sight of god the father that none of u are disposable expendable or useless each of u ha a particular vocation in the father plan of salvation and our very being is so precious to the father that the loving transforming power of his kingdom call u from the addiction to our false self to our true self a icon of the father love this transforming power becomes a way of living hence not a specific place that one can absolutely pinpoint you cannot use google map or a gps device to find the kingdom the kingdom is god the father way of living it is a way of living that is the son jesus he life each moment of his life attentive to his father word and will spending night in communion with his father jesus teach with his life that kingdom living is living joined connected related whatever word you wish to use to god the father a a way of living the kingdom is a radical embrace of the first commandment no one nor no thing nor anything we deem important come before the father or interferes with our relationship with him kingdom living is life that provides the essential to a sister or brother in need matthew and celebrates praise and thanks the father for all that he is doing in life cf luke the magnificat it is in this sense that one can speak of the kingdom a a place wherever one is when living a the father command there is the kingdom the kingdom a a way of living ha been prepared by the prophet of old many of the prophet called israel to authentic worship a message that is still quite valid despite present misguided and weak argument that attempt erroneously at a division between religion and spirituality for the prophet the spiritual relationship formed by the covenant necessarily bound one religion freely to observe and practice a continuous ongoing changeofheart the prophet knew that the energy required to live justly a a covenant person did not come from within a person by himself or herself such living depended upon the mercy of god celebrated and experienced in authentic worship such worship then propelled one to be an instrument of charitable service in the world acting not on one own initiative and power in the name of god the kingdom a a way of living is now definitely revealed and embodied in jesus here all ambiguity concerning the kingdom is erased the kingdom is essentially a person the person jesus only he can lead u to the love of the father in the spirit and make u share in the life of the holy trinity catechism of the catholic church paragraph the incarnation make the kingdom a reality in the created order to effect the father loving transformation of everything most especially the human heart responding and living the love revealed to u in christ jesus is the essential work and live of the kingdom of god is there more to be said about the kingdom certainly but more importantly the kingdom is not intended for study but for living while some of these reflection may give u some insight such insight is always directed to worshipping god the father and serving one another in the name of jesus christ with the gift and power of the holy spirit a jesus teaching on prayer is proclaimed today at mass consider i have thought that the kingdom of god is what doe it mean to seek the kingdom of god and his righteousness in view of the kingdom of god i am thankful for glory to the father and to the son and to the holy spirit a it wa in the beginning is now and will be forever amen top jun http toulogoilogoublogspotcom awordfromtodaysmassordinarytimehtml

attack stroke heart failure or death low level of total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d can help predict a person risk of major adverse cardiovascular event such a a heart attack stroke heart failure or death according to a firstofitskind study from the intermountain medical center heart institute in salt lake city our study found that low level of both total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d appear to be associated with poor cardiovascular outcome said lead author heidi may phd msph a cardiovascular epidemiologist with the intermountain medical center heart institute the study evaluated participant between the age of and a quarter of the study participant were diabetic and percent had coronary artery disease clinician tested participant vitamin d metabolite level which included component of vitamin d that are formed during metabolism to determine the metabolite association with future major adverse cardiovascular event bioavailable vitamin d result from vitamin d being absorbed into the blood stream without binding to surrounding protein during metabolism only percent of total vitamin d is available in the body to act on target cell a most are bound to vitamin d binding protein therefore evaluating whether the proportion of vitamin d that can be used may be important a only unbound vitamin d such a bioavailable vitamin d is available to act on target cell the study tested many different type of vitamin d but found that measuring total vitamin d and bioavailable vitamin d were the most accurate in predicting harmful cardiovascular event this study is the first research that evaluates the association of vitamin d metabolite with cardiovascular event said dr may and evaluating usable vitamin d could mean the difference on the amount of vitamin d prescribed if it prescribed at all the study expands on the result of several observational study including some performed at intermountain healthcare but researcher recommend conducting more study on noncaucasian population because past research show vitamin d metabolite affect caucasian and noncaucasian race differently result of the study will be presented at the american college of cardiology scientific session in chicago on saturday april at pm cst story source the above post is reprinted from material provided by intermountain medical center note material may be edited for content and length cite this page intermountain medical center low level of two component of vitamin d can help predict risk of heart attack sciencedaily sciencedaily april wwwsciencedailycom release htm apr http result from vericels positive phase b ixcelldcm clinical trial of ixmyelocelt presented today at acc and published in the lancet patient treated with ixmyelocelt had a percent reduction in clinical event compared to placebo cambridge mass april globe newswire vericel corporation nasdaq vcel a leading developer of patientspecific expanded cellular therapy for the treatment of severe disease and condition today announced the presentation and publication of result from the company phase b ixcelldcm clinical study of ixmyelocelt in patient with advanced heart failure due to ischemic dilated cardiomyopathy dcm the data were presented today by timothy henry md at the latebreaking clinical trial session and press conference at the american college of cardiology acc th annual scientific session and published in the lancet dr henry is director of cardiology at cedarssinai heart institute principal investigator of the study and coauthor of the lancet publication the ixcelldcm study met it primary endpoint of demonstrating a reduction in the total number of allcause death cardiovascular hospitalization or unplanned outpatient and emergency department visit to treat acute decompensated heart failure during the month following treatment with ixmyelocelt compared to placebo said dr david recker vericels chief medical officer from a safety perspective the incidence of adverse event including serious adverse event in patient treated with ixmyelocelt wa comparable to or lower than patient in the placebo group we are very excited about the result of this clinical trial and greatly appreciate the contribution of the patient investigator and dedicated personnel who participated in this study we have a major unmet need in the treatment of class iii and iv heart failure said amit n patel md director of clinical regenerative medicine and associate professor of surgery at the university of utah and the chair of the ixcelldcm steering committee based on these positive result we are encouraged that ixmyelocelt ha the potential if approved to represent an important new option for patient with class iii and class iv heart failure due to ischemic cardiomyopathy the ixcelldcm clinical trial is a multicenter randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled phase b study to as the efficacy safety and tolerability of ixmyelocelt compared to placebo vehicle control when administered via transendocardial catheterbased injection to subject with endstage heart failure due to ischemic dcm a total of patient with new york heart association nyha class iii or iv heart failure were randomly assigned to receive either ixmyelocelt or placebo and patient were treated at site in the united state all clinical event in the primary and secondary endpoint were adjudicated in a blinded fashion by an independent adjudication committee the trial met it primary endpoint with patient in the ixmyelocelt group having a percent reduction in allcause death cardiovascular hospitalization or unplanned outpatient and emergency department visit to treat acute decompensated heart failure during the month following treatment compared to the placebo group p the primary endpoint wa driven by a reduction in both allcause death and cardiovascular hospitalization in the primary endpoint without procedurerelated event three percent of patient in the ixmyelocelt group died and percent had cardiovascular hospitalization one or more time compared to percent and percent respectively in the placebo group all death were adjudicated to be due to cardiovascular cause with respect to the secondary endpoint of the trial the component of the primary endpoint were also analyzed using the win ratio in a hierarchical manner to incorporate both the incidence and timing of the endpoint component the win ratio result of showed that more often ixmyelocelt wa the winner in that the time to death left ventricular assist device placement heart transplantation or time to cardiovascular hospitalization wa shorter for placebotreated patient but this difference did not reach statistical significance the time to first event wa longer in the ixmyelocelt group compared to placebo but wa not statistically significant there were no significant structural change in left ventricle cavity size or left ventricular ejection fraction a measured by echocardiogram in either the ixmyelocelt or placebo group both treatment group had an improvement in the nyha class and six minute walk test with no statistical difference between the group at month using last observation carried forward overall there were fewer adverse event and serious adverse event in the ixmyelocelt group compared to the placebo group adverse event included those typically related to catheterization or injection procedure the ixcelldcm trial showed a statistically significant reduction in clinical event driven by both cardiac mortality and cardiac hospitalization at month compared to placebo these result are consistent with two previous phase a study which showed that ischemic dcm patient treated with ixmyelocelt experienced fewer major adverse cardiovascular event during follow up compared to control patient vericel will host a webcast at pm et on tuesday april to review ixmyelocelt and the phase b ixcelldcm trial result dr gary l schaer md of rush university medical center and a member of the ixcelldcm steering committee will present an overview of the result from the ixcelldcm clinical trial and dr ross tubo vericels chief scientific officer will present additional background information on ixmyelocelt and describe the potential benefit of expanded multicellular therapy in the repair and regeneration of ischemic tissue the live webcast and a recording will be available at the event and presentation section of the vericel website at investorsvcelcom eventscfm both the lancet publication and the acc scientific session presentation a well a additional data and analysis not presented at acc are currently available at investorsvcelcom eventscfm about dilated cardiomyopathy dilated cardiomyopathy dcm a progressive disease of the heart is a leading cause of heart failure and heart transplantation dcm is characterized by weakening of the heart muscle and enlargement of the heart chamber leading to systolic abnormality difficulty of the left ventricle to pump blood heart enlargement and poor function generally lead to progressive heart failure with further decline in the ability of the heart to pump blood efficiently throughout the body about ixmyelocelt ixmyelocelt is a patientspecific expanded multicellular therapy manufactured from the patient own bone marrow using vericels proprietary highly automated fully closed cellprocessing system this process selectively expands the population of mesenchymal stromal cell and alternatively activated macrophage which are responsible for production of antiinflammatory and proangiogenic factor known to be important for repair of damaged tissue ixmyelocelt ha been designated a an orphan drug by the u food and drug administration for use in the treatment of dcm about the ixcelldcm clinical trial the ixcelldcm clinical trial is a multicenter randomized doubleblind placebocontrolled phase b study designed to as the efficacy safety and tolerability of ixmyelocelt compared to placebo vehicle control when administered via transendocardial catheterbased injection to subject with endstage heart failure due to ischemic dcm who have no reasonable revascularization option either surgical or percutaneous interventional likely to provide clinical benefit the primary endpoint of the ixcelldcm clinical trial study is the number of allcause death cardiovascular hospital admission and unplanned outpatient and emergency department visit to treat acute decompensated heart failure over the month following administration of ixmyelocelt compared to placebo about vericel corporation vericel corporation is a leader in developing patientspecific expanded cellular therapy for use in the treatment of patient with severe disease and condition the company market two autologous cell therapy product in the u carticel autologous cultured chondrocytes an autologous chondrocyte implant for the treatment of cartilage defect in the knee and epicel cultured epidermal autograft a permanent skin replacement for the treatment of patient with deepdermal or fullthickness burn comprising greater than or equal to of total body surface area vericel is also developing maci a thirdgeneration autologous chondrocyte implant for the treatment of cartilage defect in the knee for more information please visit the company website at wwwvcelcom epicel and carticel are registered trademark and maci is a trademark of vericel corporation vericel corporation all right reserved apr http wwwinvestorvillagecom smbdaspptmsgmbmidmn

cough he wa initially diagnosed with pneumonia severe congenital heart disease in congestive heart failure and electrolyte imbalance april the patient wa referred and transferred to bataan general the hospital finding the dengue vaccination is coincidental according to naefic congenital heart disease is not an exclusion criterion for vaccination the philippine reported more than dengue case scenario the emphasis of ventricular filling during late diastole increase the a component of the e a ratio causing a reversal of the ratio hence an indication of diastolic dysfunction u left atrial volume ha also been described a an excellent biomarker of the chronicity of diastolic dysfunction and of cardiovascular disease risk parameter of diastolic function such a early diastolic velocity measured a e prime e the e to late diastolic filling a ratio e a and the transmitral to mitral annular early diastolic velocity ratio e e have all been shown to predict mortality and cardiovascular event the early diastolic velocity of the mitral valve annulus e reflects the rate of myocardial relaxation when combined with measurement of the early transmitral flow velocity e the resultant ratio e e correlate well with mean left ventricular enddiastolic pressure hence a marker for la pressure left ventricular diastolic dysfunction is a relatively common finding seen on doppler echocardiography while multiple study demonstrate abnormal diastolic function assessment to be associated with increased cardiovascular comorbidity it can hold varying prognostic significance depending on underlying cardiac ventricular function it ha been shown that mortality is higher in hospitalized patient with depressed left ventricular ejection fraction of le than additionally diastolic dysfunction ha been recognized a a strong predictor of mortality in acute myocardial infarction and congestive heart failure c however isolated diastolic dysfunction ha significant clinical implication a well there is much heterogeneity regarding the prognosis of patient with diastolic dysfunction with mortality ranging from to multiple study have shown prognostic significance of doppler index of left ventricular diastolic dysfunction where pattern of abnormal relaxation increase the risk of cardiovascular event c in one study among patient undergoing cardiac catheterization the small subgroup with diastolic dysfunction defined a those with high lv enddiastolic pressure and no systolic dysfunction coronary heart disease or lv dilation had a high risk of future cardiac morbid event this association between echocardiographic marker of abnormal relaxation and decreased survival even in those with no av history of chf suggests that echocardiography may help identify those who are a heart attack result when a blood clot completely obstructs a coronary artery supplying blood to the heart muscle and heart muscle dy the blood clot that cause the heart attack usually form at the site of rupture of an atherosclerotic cholesterol plaque on the inner wall of a coronary artery heart failure damage the heart muscle at the cellular level it generally thought that the heart muscle damage caused by heart failure is permanent however imperial college researcher found that heart failure damage can be reversed if the heart muscle is simply allowed to rest and heal susceptible to coronary blockage that can cut off blood and destroy major hunk of heart muscle at one time in a heart attack the heart can only heal itself slowly often leaving behind thinned and baggy scar tissue devoid of healthy beating musclemyocardial infarction mi latin infarctus myocardii or acute myocardial infarction ami commonly known a a heart attack occurs when blood stop flowing properly to a part of the heart and the heart muscle is injured because it is not receiving enough oxygen jun http breakingnewssblogspotcom whatismaincauseofheartattackhtml

i woke up yesterday morning feeling vaguely depressed but until my husband nick wished me happy birthday i didnt realize this wa the day i turn year old i think i wa dreading this birthday partly because my mother died at her birth day wa feb mine is feb my mother died of congestive heart failure and actually outlived her doctor prediction by about a year so i drank my morning coffee and tried to sort out the jumble of thought and emotion this th birthday so close to the beginning of a new year wa definitely for me a liminal experience a daughter eleni would call it limen mean threshold in latin eleni studied anthropology in college and in her blog the liminal stage she explains liminal stage are psychological threshold time of transition when we stand betwixt and between one state and another the biggies are birth marriage deathcultures develop splashy ritual around these transition to ease the anxiety they provoke you can guess which liminal stage i wa contemplating in fact ive been talking so much about death in recent month that my kid and husband keep razzing me about it ive sent them memo about what i want and dont want at my funeral no open coffin in fact no body or casket funeral service for immediate family only some time later a party open house memorial service with no eulogy only extemporaneous anecdote with lot of food wine and music ive already worked out the entire mix of song i want heavy on led zeppelin and queen before her death my mother the world most organized person had written down the hymn and scripture reading for her funeral specified cremation and purchased the mausoleum niche where her ash and my father would be stowed in brass box that resemble book she chose a niche which had a view of the swan on the cemetery pond she had all their financial affair in order filed neatly in her desk when she died my father on the other hand had dementia a well a parkinson disease until he died at so he didnt even known when my mother died his dementia first became evident at our parent fiftieth wedding anniversary in when he wa about needle to say ive been watching myself for sign of alzheimers and avidly doing lumosity brain game every day daughter marina kindly signed me up knowing my worry about memory loss i realize a recent article have pointed out that lumosity doesnt really help you stave off dementia it just measure how you become better at the game with practice but nevertheless it gave me comfort that yesterday workout result put me at lpi whatever that is a compared with my age group and for problem solving but only for memory i wa happy that my number had gone up but then i realized that overnight the age group i wa being compared to had changed from age to to over le competition for the past fifty year or so ive been making pretty much the same new year resolution a everyone else lose ten pound go to the gym or pilate twice a week publish a book with my own name on it learn spanish so i can communicate better with my bilingual grandchild this year my new year resolution changed im no longer interested in improving my weight career or possession but still want to learn spanish all my resolution can be collected under the theme get rid of stuff i am a hoarder a my family will attest i even bought the best seller the lifechanging magic of tidying up by marie kondo but after reading several chapter i had to stop because it wa making me feel so guilty now im going to target certain areasmy studio my computer desk my makeup area the library and especially my closetsone at a time ton of paper have to go all those book ill never read again will be donated to the grafton library for sale all my officeappropriate clothes will go to dress for success so that other younger woman can find job ive told the kid whatever they want take it now in hope of avoiding a among my mother nine sibling bitter schism between two child who want the same antique bureau a the day of my th birthday moved from morose reflection over coffee to astonishment at the sight of over birthday wish on the internet i alternated between tear over the card my husband gave me and laughter for instance when daughter eleni posted on facebook did you know that on her th birthday i witnessed this woman sip from a hash milkshake in amsterdam trust me she wa in it for the milkshake happy birthday party girl i wa delighted to receive call and gift from son chris and daughter marina both on the opposite side of the country and chuckled at the book marina sent the alzheimers prevention program keep your brain alive and u for a grandma among them at the end of the day at dinner in the romantic restaurant casa tua in south beach fl nick and i told each other how lucky we are that weve made it through year of marriage that we have three great kid and two extraordinary grandchild and that when we get up in the morning no part of our body hurt thats a rare blessing when your age group is over so by the time the waiter brought a birthday crme brule with a candle in it a well a a chocolate meltdownboth surprise ordered by daughter eleni i felt ready to cross the threshold into the next liminal stage whatever it brings feb http arollingcroneblogspotcom thoughtsonmythbirthdayhtml

a a newly minted psych np ill reiterate what horseshoe said above psych patient have medical issue and if you start a psych med that interacts with something they take for a medical condition or exacerbates that condition then thats your own malpractice and youre hurting the people youre supposed to help for instance i had a transgender patient who wa on an androgen blocker but couldnt remember the name they also had frequent nightmare my preceptor started them on prazosin which treat nightmare but is also a blood pressure medication the patient started fainting turn out they were on spironolactone which is an androgen blocker and a blood pressure med the patient wasnt harmed but could have been my experience in medsurg ha helped me avoid drug interaction or exacerbating someone heart failure or diabetes more time than i can count you could also work in psych a an rn and that would be beneficial it will allow you to observe psych symptom and recovery drug dosage side effect etc i worked inpatient psych while i wa in grad school specifically for that reason and it helped a lot now when i have a patient decompensating i can ask myself if they present like the patient i saw admitted to my inpatient unit and decide if i need to send them to the er or if i can safely treat them outpatient jun http allnursescom studentnursepractitioner howdoesworkingpagehtmlpost

reuters health over the last year heart disease rate have dropped in the u overall but the change varied widely by region with the highest rate of the disease shifting from the northeast to the south researcher say heart disease refers to several condition including coronary artery disease which can cause heart attack despite the decline in death over time heart disease is still the leading cause of death in the u killing more than people per year according to the center for disease control and prevention cdc the consistent progression southward over the past few decade suggests that the pattern is not random and could be attributed to geographic difference in prevention and treatment opportunity said lead author michele casper of the cdc division for heart disease and stroke prevention in atlanta georgia identifying those county and region with the greatest burden of mortality is a necessary first step to target appropriate resource that will ultimately reduce death rate casper told reuters health by email the researcher used data on heart disease death among people age and over in the u collected in two year interval between and from more than county of the contiguous state every county saw a decline in heart disease death the average decline across the u wa percent but some county only saw a decline of percent while others cut heart disease death by percent at the beginning of the study heart disease death were most common in the northeast through appalachia and into the midwest coastal north carolina south carolina and georgia also had high rate most county with the lowest death rate were located in the west with some lowrate county also scattered in alabama florida and mississippi by most highrate county were still in the eastern half of the country but in the south rather than in the north with some part of new england becoming pocket with lower death rate decline were slowest in county in alabama mississippi louisiana arkansas oklahoma and part of texas the author reported in a paper scheduled for publication in circulation since the s national attention on the danger of cigarette smoking and uncontrolled high blood pressure ha led to a significant decline in death from coronary heart disease and heart attack but heart disease includes other condition which have not decreased a much said dr donald a barr of stanford university school of medicine in california who wrote an editorial accompanying the new study comparable data for heart failure which is a different process not due to clogging of blood vessel but due to the heart wearing out a a result of diabetes obesity and underlying high blood pressure ha not been coming down a fast barr told reuters health by phone heart failure is projected to increase over the next couple of decade while coronary heart disease is expected to decline he said heart failure disproportionately affect lowincome american and african american he said these atrisk population are found in a somewhat higher proportion in those southeastern state combining heart failure and coronary heart disease under the global term heart disease combine good news with not so good news barr said there were still meaningful decline in heart disease death in the south casper noted heart diseaserelated death are largely preventable and with targeted public health effort it possible to alleviate much of the heavy burden of this disease and close the geographic gap in declining heart disease death rate casper said with collaboration government agency medical care organization community group business and other organization can provide more local opportunity for physical activity a well a access to smokefree space affordable healthy food quality healthcare and social and economic wellbeing source http bitly xihahi circulation released march mar http wwwchannelnewsasiacom news health usheartdiseaseratesde htmlcidcnaflip

naturalhealth a recent study is now showing strong evidence of a link between lack of vitamin d and poor cardiovascular health the study result show that low vitamin d level have been linked with a higher risk of having a heart attack stroke or heart failure among other health issue the result come from an innovative study conducted by the intermountain medical center heart institute of salt lake city the study finding were presented at the american college of cardiology scientific session in chicago avoid low vitamin d level this is a powerful way to protect your heart higher risk of stroke heart issue and cardiac event seem to correlate with low level of a specific vitamin d component a well a deficient overall level the researcher found that those with low vitamin d level in both bioavailable and total amount had more cardiovascular health challenge bioavailable vitamin d refers to vitamin d in the bloodstream but not attached to protein for the study lead researcher cardiovascular epidemiologist dr heidi may and her colleague studied vitamin d level in older adult around percent of the participant showed coronary artery disease and a quarter had diabetes the research team looked at level of vitamin d element produced during metabolism to find connection to future cardiac issue studying the unbound bioavailable vitamin d wa key a only to percent of vitamin d can act during metabolism however both total vitamin d level and bioavailable amount were accurate in predicting the risk of heart issue down the road vitamin d is crucial to many area of your health profile the study ultimately concluded that people with higher vitamin d level had the lowest risk of heart attack heart failure stroke and death the study underscore the importance of vitamin d to overall health throughout our lifetime other research ha shown how important vitamin d is to memory cognitive health and avoiding alzheimers in older age a well person already experiencing coronary health issue should consider having their vitamin d level checked and take action if a lack of vitamin d is detected doing so could be crucial to cardiovascular and overall health sunshine diet and supplement can all provide vitamin d while vitamin d can be prescribed or taken in supplement form one of the best way to receive it is from the sun it should be noted that people of different race tend to process vitamin d at different level those with darker skin may require more supplementation regardless of sun exposure food that are rich in vitamin d include fatty fish like salmon sardine and herring raw milk and some breakfast cereal contain vitamin d but one must be careful about food allergy if they exist in addition whole egg mushroom and ricotta cheese offer vitamin d but again how the food wa produced plus dietary sensitivity must be considered before choosing a way of eating bottom line get your vitamin d level tested dont guess and make the necessary change to hi everyone i hope your sunday is going well and i hope youre ready to say goodbye to july i find it hard to believe that tomorrow is august st i have to admit that i wont be sorry to see the hot and humid weather of this summer leave u for some autumn weather i havent been able to be outside very much during the month of july june wasnt too bad but july wa terrible because of my chronic congestive heart failure and other heart issue when im out during humid weather my chest feel like there a ton of brick pressing down on it and i cant breathe so consequently i remain indoors on most summer day im not complaining though im so thankful that im still living if that mean staying inside during the summer then so be it whats been happening in your life i hope only good thing but i know that usually isnt the case we really have to accept the troubling time a well a the good thing those bad thing help u to appreciate it when thing go our way i try very hard to take one day at a time accepting whatever happens to me each day i know that god ha a plan for each of u but it will only be revealed in his time not ours most thing happen for a reason although we dont know what that reason is at that time god doe work in mysterious way i grew up hearing the quote when one door close another one open for u i believe this with all my heart and soul the problem arises when we think we know what should be behind that new door it not up to u it up to god this world need to put their trust in god not in worldly thing i detest all the hatred and killing that are taking place in this world we all live in today what we need to do is pray love one another and stop blaming everyone else for our bad choice i truly believe that a lot of this behavior fall on the shoulder of the parent too many parent today are afraid to discipline their child the way they need to do i understand that parent are instructed by counselor to try to reason with their child when they back talk them shout and scream at their parent when they do whatever they want regardless what the parent say what is happening in this world today i see nothing wrong with strong discipline for child starting when they are toddler thats the way i raised my three daughter and theyre strong wonderful mom they raised their son the same way and i pray that my grandson will raise their child just the same too many child are rude and disrespectful to their parent and to everyone im sorry but thats just wrong i can remember since i wa a young child being taught that you always respect your elder that start with your parent and grandparent and carry on from there what is the answer to our problem i truly dont know but im thankful that im not raising young child today i truly fear for this world in the future generation we all need to pray for each other it the best thing we can do for one another i hope you have a good monday tomorrow be safe and may god bless you and your family susan jul http home remedy how to recognize a heart attack one month before it happens cardiovascular disease or cvd is the most dangerous killer nowadays it come with no warning well at least that is what you believe heart attack have several common symptom but most sufferer are not aware of these not until it is too latehowtorecognizeaheartattackonemonthbeforeithappens what is even worse there are patient who notice that something is wrong but they tend to overlook the problem and leave it without any proper treatment being aware and not doing anything is like a suicide here is a brief list of the most common sign and symptom of heart attack and heart disease in this way you will be able to recognize any strange symptom and treat them properly hopefully these will help you save your life in time dizziness and shortness of breath if you are not asthmatic or if you are not dealing with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease your inability to catch breath may indicate only a few thing and heart attack is one of them dizziness is also a common symptom of heart attack and cardiovascular ailment especially when it is accompanied with shortness of breath being constantly sick heart attack if usually announced through vomiting stomach ache indigestion or a general feeling of sickness chest pain chest pain is also a common symptom and luckily most people are aware of it meaning it may be triggered by various factor including muscle cramping lack of vitamin and mineral pulmonary disease and other the like medical expert explain that the pain that lead to a heart attack is usually located right under the breast bone or slightly in the left side of the center unusual ache ie neck pain similar to other medical condition an upcoming heart attack trigger pain in unrelated part in the body it may start off at the very center of the chest and then spread upwards the neck or the jaw some patient deal with severe and unbearable neck pain and ache in the jaw anxiety believe it or not anxiety can indicate a heart disease if your anxiety is accompanied with lightheadedness and even dizziness take special precaution because you might be dealing with a heart disease sicklike appearance blood pressure drop significantly prior a heart attack which is why most sufferer look pale and like they are about to faint palpitation irregular and fast heart rate followed by shortness of breath weakness and dizziness may be a sign of a sudden heart attack sometimes this symptom is associated with arrhythmia and heart failure consider treating this condition because when left untreated it may result in devastating healt problem tiredness weakness also a common symptom of an upcoming heart attack expert from the british heart foundation explain that woman are more likely to experience tiredness or weakness or both prior a heart attack sweating patient who have survived a heart attack remember being flooded in cold sweat before the attack had happened mar http canadian journal of gastroenterology and hepatologyvolume article id page research article splitdose polyethylene glycol is superior to single dose for colonoscopy preparation result of a randomized controlled trial division of gastroenterology faculty of medicine university of calgary calgary ab canada department of medicine and community health science university of calgary calgary ab canada forzani macphail colon cancer screening centre alberta health service calgary ab canada division of gastroenterology faculty of medicine university of ottawa ottawa on canada received august accepted october copyright rachid mohamed et al this is an open access article distributed under the creative common attribution license which permit unrestricted use distribution and reproduction in any medium provided the original work is properly cited abstract background the efficacy of colonoscopy in detecting abnormality within the colon is highly dependent on the adequacy of the bowel preparation the objective of this study wa to compare the efficacy safety and tolerability of peg lavage and splitdose peg lavage with specific emphasis on the cleanliness of the right colon method the study wa a prospective randomized twoarm controlled trial of patient patient between the age of and year were referred to an outpatient university screening clinic for colonoscopy patient were allocated to receive either a single l peg lavage or a splitdose peg lavage result overall the bowel preparation wa superior in the splitdose group compared with the singledose group mean ottawa score versus and resulted in le overall fluid in the colon this effect wa observed across all segment of the colon assessed conclusion the current study support use of a splitdose peg lavage over a single large volume lavage for superior bowel cleanliness which may improve polyp detection this trial is registered with clinicaltrialsgov identifier nct introduction the efficacy of colonoscopy in detecting abnormality within the colon is highly dependent on the adequacy of the bowel preparation despite advance in bowel preparation the process remains difficult for patient to tolerate and complete and ultimately if inadequate can result in missed lesion with published literature on missed polyp and carcinoma at colonoscopy optimal visualization of the colonic mucosa becomes critically important furthermore some evidence suggests that colonoscopy may not be protective against rightsided colonic lesion subtle flat lesion with a predilection for the proximal colon particularly those with serrated histology are becoming increasingly significant a potential factor for the lack of protection of colonoscopy proximally and stress the importance of adequate preparation background polyethylene glycol peg is a balanced electrolyte lavage rather than an osmotic agent therefore it use a a bowelcleansing preparation is typically associated with fewer fluid shift and electrolyte abnormality compared with low volume osmotic agent it ha been widely used for colonoscopy preparation on it own or in conjunction with other agent one disadvantage of the traditional l peg bowel preparation is a reduction in the quality of cleanliness with afternoon procedure which ha driven further research into timing and dosing of peg depending on timing of the procedure in our previous study the l peg preparation wa somewhat inferior to sodium phosphate preparation now removed from the market because it left a large amount of residual fluid in the colon however the use of a split dose of peg l the day before the procedure and l the morning of the procedure may alleviate some of the shortcoming of a single l preparation particularly for afternoon procedure the objective of this study wa to compare the efficacy and tolerability of single and splitdose peg lavage with specific emphasis on the cleanliness of the right colon and the influence of endoscopy time material and method all patient between the age of and year referred to the forzani macphail colon cancer screening centre in calgary alberta canada for colonoscopy in were considered for inclusion during preassessments at the clinic patient were asked to participate in the study by a nurse clinician those not interested in participating simply received the centre standard bowel preparation protocol patient with acute coronary syndrome congestive heart failure unstable angina known or suspected renal failure ascites megacolon known or suspected bowel obstruction or other comorbidities that may prevent colonoscopy were excluded patient were also excluded if they previously had a partial or subtotal colectomy or if the colonoscopy wa warranted for the evaluation of diarrhea enrollment of participant wa performed by a study coordinator a computer wa used to generate a randomization table with block of allocation concealment wa maintained through the use of consecutively numbered sealed envelope the allocation ratio wa colonoscopists and investigator were blinded to the allocation group patient were allocated to one of two group l peg the day before the procedure starting at noon for am procedure and pm for pm procedure or l of peg in a split dose procedure before am l at noon and l at pm the day before the procedure procedure after am l of peg at pm the day before the procedure and l of peg hour before the scheduled procedure time on the day of the procedure a study assistant assigned patient to their group and instructed them on the proper use of their assigned bowel preparation method patient were instructed to start a low residue diet day prior to the colonoscopy a table of acceptable food white bread white pasta dairy egg chicken beef pork fish cooked or steamed vegetable and canned fruit and food to avoid whole grain brown or wild rice oatmeal raw fruit and berry any food containing nut seed and popcorn wa included in the patient handout patient were instructed to take a light breakfast on the morning before the procedure followed by clear fluid thereafter patient were given a tolerability questionnaire that wa modified from a previously reported questionnaire to be completed once their bowel preparation wa finished and before coming to the hospital for the colonoscopy patient concern or question regarding the preparation were directed to the assistant a opposed to their gastroenterologist so a to avoid unblinding the gastroenterologist outcome the previously validated ottawa bowel preparation scale wa used to as the quality of bowel cleanliness each of the right mid and rectosigmoid colon wa rated on a point scale in addition overall colonic fluid wa assessed with a point rating resulting in an overall score range of to an excellent preparation with little fluid would have a score of to and a good preparation would have a score of to an adequate bowel preparation would have a score of or lower and a completely unprepared colon would have a score of to depending on the amount of colonic fluid colonoscopy wa performed in a standard fashion and endoscopists rated the bowel preparation quality during the procedure before any attempt to improve visualization and recorded the result on a separate standardized form secondary outcome included a tolerability questionnaire a well a patient and investigator reported adverse event statistical analysis descriptive statistic were used for baseline characteristic the ottawa bowel preparation scale produce data that are approximately normally distributed twogroup anova wa used to as for the presence of group difference in the preparation score while accounting for procedure time am versus pm the proportion of adequate bowel preparation in each group wa compared with a chi square statistic the secondary endpoint of tolerability were assessed using the mannwhitney test sample size calculation in our previous study using the ottawa bowel preparation scale an observed effect size of wa seen for a twogroup anova a total sample size of patient would be required for a twotailed alpha at and an power based on experience from our previous study an additional of patient were added to the total sample size to account for early withdrawal and incomplete colonoscopy result in total patient were enrolled in the study in the splitdose group and in the singledose group completed the study patient in the singledose group and patient in the splitdose group discontinuation were due to scheduling conflict no adverse event causing discontinuation were reported table show the baseline characteristic of the two group there were no significant difference between group in the splitdose group underwent afternoon colonoscopy compared with in the singledose group table baseline characteristic of the patient the difference in ottawa score between the two group are illustrated in figure in total the bowel preparation wa superior in the splitdose group compared with the singledose group mean ottawa score versus splitdose peg resulted in a lower and therefore better mean ottawa score across all segment of the colon assessed a well a le overall fluid in the colon this reached statistical significance for the total right and left colon furthermore the splitdose group had a higher proportion of patient with adequate bowel preparation ottawa score than the singledose group versus figure figure ottawa bowel prep score for splitdose and singledose peg lavage group by colon segment and overall lower score are better figure proportion of patient with adequate bowel preparation ottawa bowel prep score for splitdose and singledose peg lavage group split preparation for morning procedure were performed only for those procedure after am a earlier procedure were not feasible to have patient take an early morning dose of their preparation in procedure performed in the morning the splitdose peg lavage resulted in a lower total ottawa score compared with the singledose lavage mean total ottawa score versus the ottawa score in the right colon wa significantly better in the splitdose group than in the singledose group versus the difference in ottawa score between the two group for morning procedure are illustrated in table table mean ottawa score parameter for morning procedure the effect of the splitdose lavage compared with the singledose lavage is amplified in the afternoon procedure the total ottawa score wa far superior in the splitdose arm versus a were the independent assessment of the different colonic region right colon versus mid colon versus left colon versus all the difference in total ottawa score with the splitdose and singledose peg lavage for both morning and afternoon procedure are illustrated in figure figure bowel preparation quality for am earlier than am and pm after am procedure all singledose patient took their bowel preparation l peg the day before the colonoscopy starting at noon for am procedure and pm for pm procedure splitdose patient took the second dose the evening before colonoscopy for am procedure or hour before the colonoscopy time for pm procedure both preparation were generally well tolerated and completed a directed by the majority of participant in splitdose group versus in singledose group question regarding tolerability of the lavage preparation are shown in table more patient who took the single l lavage would rather have had a different preparation method compared with those who took the split dosing the mean number of adverse event experienced during the lavage wa higher in the singledose group compared with the splitdose group versus adverse event data are provided in table table questionnaire patient opinion regarding the assigned bowel preparation table adverse event group symptom score discussion administration of a peg lavage in two l do is superior to administration in a single l dose for screening colonoscopy in an outpatient population the result is an overall better cleanliness in all region of the colon a well a le residual fluid while this hold true for procedure performed throughout the day the effect is amplified when there is a shorter interval between the last dose of peg and the procedure a wa the case in the afternoon procedure where the second peg dose wa given in the morning of the day of the procedure in this situation the difference in total ottawa score between the splitdose and singledose preparation wa the greatest while there wa still a significant difference in morning procedure where the last peg dose wa given the evening before the effect wa le dramatic this begs the question a to whether patient with morning procedure should be asked to take the second peg dose hour before the procedure rather than the evening before at least in the setting of colorectal cancer screening clearly this put a significant added burden on patient with scheduled morning procedure there are a variety of reason a to why a splitdose administration of peg is superior to a singledose administration the second dose of the split preparation is given closer to the procedure time than is the single dose the result is likely a better removal of fluid and debris that may have accumulated in the hour since the first dose of the peg lavage the single dose of peg is almost always given the night before the procedure leaving several hour since the laxative wa administered for fluid bile and debris to accumulate therefore the bowel becomes le clean over time matro and colleague have recently shown equivalency for morning only and a splitdose peg preparation pm am for afternoon procedure suggesting that the earlier dose may not even be required another study found that maximal cleanliness of the bowel preparation wa achieved when the colonoscopy were performed within hour of the last laxative dose this notion is supported in our study by the superior bowel preparation in the afternoon procedure the effect wa le pronounced in the morning procedure likely because of the increased time between the second dose evening before and the colonoscopy time in our study afternoon procedure case received the second dose of peg hour priorly a better bowel preparation ha been associated with higher cecal intubation rate and higher polyp detection rate in a study by marmo et al a splitdose peg lavage outperformed a singledose peg lavage for colonoscopy the improved bowel preparation were associated with a fold increase in cecal intubation and a fold increase in adenoma detection the superiority of the splitdose lavage in the right colon shown in this study and others facilitates better identification of the serrated adenoma which tend to be flat and more difficult to detect polyp and adenoma detection rate are typically descr apr http wwwhindawicom journal cjgh

invc news new delhi world leading cardio and endovascular technology maker biotronik today introduced in india it latest and most advanced home monitoring technology for patient with implanted cardiac device such a pacemaker implantable defibrillator icds and heart failure device biotronik home monitoring is an internet based remote monitoring technology that enables physician to continuously and reliably monitor their patient clinical and device status anytime anywhere and minimize risk of any negative medical event the latest device in the biotronik home monitoring program the cardiomessenger smart is about the size of a smartphone and is highly robust more convenient and remarkably portable a compared to previous version of the device having the pacemaker wearer constantly connected to their physician this home monitoring technology enhances safety for cardiac device patient the device provides fully automatic transmission of vital information from a patient cardiac implant to their physician via biotronik home monitoring data are transmitted from the patient implant to the cardiomessengers transmitter device which u tmobile and it partner network gprs to send data to the biotronik service centre from where the data is sent to the physician home monitoring ha helped doctor world over to keep a very close look at their patient implanted device and their cardiac activity it ha helped reduced mortality episode of hospitalization and inappropriate shock and helped improve the quality of life of patient immensely it help use of the full potential of the device that preserve battery life it ha also helped reduce routine clinic follow up which can be a burden to patient and extra workload for physician these result formed basis for the class i a indication which mean this is considered a standard of best care this wa the recommendation by the heart rhythm society and is endorsed by the other professional society around the world including asia pacific heart rhythm society said dr niraj varma electrophysiologist at cleveland clinic ohio usa who cochaired this document dr varma say home monitoring ha clinically shown to have helped doctor provide improved service and helped better the health condition of patient the cardiomessenger smart facilitates the application of home monitoring result from large clinical show the following benefit of home monitoring mortality in heart patient le by hospitalization due to atrial arrhythmia or stroke le by inoffice follow ups le by risk of inappropriate shock in patient with implanted device le by another advantage of constant remote monitoring is that we a physician get a closer look at trend in different patient some patient might have a more stable heart activity with a cardiac device others may have more frequent discrepancy and episode of arrhythmia by regular monitoring data over a period of time we can understand each patient and tailor our treatment and advice according to their need and optimise device function it also help better our medical understanding and give vital data for research regular monitoring of patient wearing pacemaker and other device ha traditionally been a cumbersome task since patient are required to visit clinic at regular interval in a country like india where a patient from bihar might have had a device implanted in delhi follow up visit can be very difficult sometimes a medical event in between the visit could go unnoticed and be life threatening to the patient home monitoring ha made it easy enhanced safety and also reduced cost said dr viveka kumar senior consultant interventional cardiologist director of the cath lab at max hospital new delhi biotronik home monitoring is the only remote monitoring system worldwide with u fda and european ce approval to replace conventional inoffice follow ups and provide early detection of clinically relevant cardiac event it is the only system with fully automated data transmission no patient interaction is needed leading to the highest possible patient compliance physician can define the event they wish to be notified with via email sm or fax and view the event in order of importance regular data recording allows significant trend analysis help physician understand each patient condition and adjust their treatment accordingly the process also allows better scheduling of followup appointment which may be skipped if not needed digital technology ha drastically changed the way we live and it impact on healthcare is also profoundly visible today the indian government special emphasis on digital india show how it and digitization is inextricably linked to development digitization is bringing revolutionary change to healthcare delivery across the world including use of telemedicine to reach out to patient in remote area and make diagnosis result quicker at biotronik we believe that digital technology can be effectively used to benefit a large number of patient biotronik home monitoring system are leveraging this technology not only to improve healthcare delivery but also radically improve the quality of life of our patient cardiomessenger is the latest manifestation of how digital technology can benefit heart patient and help them live longer more productive life said mr tushar basu managing director biotronik india clinical study have shown home monitoring make patient feel more secure improving their quality of life of patient surveyed said it gave them a sense of security while believed it had a positive impact on their health mar http wwwinternationalnewsandviewscom biotronikhomemonitoringdevicecardiomessengersmartinindia

harriscurtissbcglobalnet subject the latest atrial fibrillation management strategy if you are unable to see the message below click here to view forward this email to a friend atrial fibrillation the latest management strategy straightforward answer to your question about living with atrial fibrillationthe most common sustained cardiac arrhythmiawith expert medical guidance incorporating recently updated clinical practice guideline hugh calkin md professor of cardiology professor of pediatrics director of the arrhythmia service electrophysiology lab atrial fibrillation center at the john hopkins hospital and ronald berger md phd professor of professor of medicine and biomedical engineering at john hopkins university if youve ever run up a flight of stair chased a tennis ball across the court or reacted in fright at a scary movie you know what a pounding heart feel like but for the million american who suffer from atrial fibrillation af or afib a racing heart is a way of life simple task like getting out of bed in the morning or rising from a chair can cause dizziness weakness shortness of breath or heart palpitation for these people af severely impairs quality of lifeand even when symptom stemming from af are mild the disorder can seriously impact health increasing the risk of stroke and heart failure af can be a debilitating even deadly condition fortunately it can be successfully managedbut there are various approach for treating af or preventing a recurrence how do you and your doctor choose which approach is right for you if you or a loved one ha af there are so many question do i need an anticoagulant should i be taking medication to control my heart rate will my symptom respond to cardioversion if i need an antiarrhythmic drug to control af episode which one should i take when is an ablation procedure appropriate and more it critically important to learn everything you can nowso you can partner with your doctor effectively ask the right question and understand the answer to help you we asked two eminent expert to share their expertise and handson experience with arrhythmia patient in an important special health report atrial fibrillation the current information on the newest drug treatment and research data i feel like my heart is going to jump out of my chest an arrhythmia is an abnormality in the timing or pattern of the heartbeat fwiw drinking juice is probably not the way to go if you want to have a healthy diet ounce for ounce orange juice ha more calorie and nearly a much sugar a coca cola apple juice ha the same amount of sugar a coca cola while having more calorie sure juice have some vitamin c but no one on a crystal cruise is in much danger of getting scurvy anyway fruit juice cause an unhealthy spike in blood sugar which result in wide swing in serum insulin level possibly setting the stage for insulinresistance and diabetes better to eat an occasional orange which is more filling and le prone to result in these metabolic disturbance on the other hand vegetable juice in general are significantly lower in sugar and calorie and have many micronutrient including vitamin c they tend to have quite a bit of sodium but that isnt a problem for most people unless they have uncontrolled hypertension congestive heart failure kidney disease or liver disease vegetable juice particularly in the form of a bloody mary can be the cornerstone for a healthy crystal breakfast apr http boardscruisecriticcom showthreadphptpost

rheumatoid arthritis ra in adult humira can be used alone with methotrexate or with certain other medicine humira may prevent further damage to bone and joint and may help the ability to perform daily activity moderate to severe polyarticular juvenile idiopathic arthritis jia in child year of age and older humira can be used alone with methotrexate or with certain other medicine psoriatic arthritis psa in adult humira can be used alone or with certain other medicine humira may prevent further damage to bone and joint and may help the ability to perform daily activity ankylosing spondylitis a in adult moderate to severe crohn disease cd and to achieve and maintain clinical remission in adult who have not responded well to conventional treatment humira is also used to reduce sign and symptom and to achieve clinical remission in these adult who have lost response to or are unable to tolerate infliximab moderate to severe crohn disease cd and to achieve and maintain clinical remission in child year of age and older when certain other treatment have not worked well enough moderate to severe hidradenitis suppurativa h in adult in adult to help get moderate to severe ulcerative colitis uc under control induce remission and keep it under control sustain remission when certain other medicine have not worked well enough it is not known if humira is effective in people who stopped responding to or could not tolerate antitnf medicine to treat moderate to severe chronic plaque psoriasis p in adult who are ready for systemic therapy or phototherapy and are under the care of a doctor who will decide if other systemic therapy are le appropriate important safety information humira is a tnf blocker medicine that affect the immune system and can lower the body ability to fight infection serious infection have happened in people taking humira these serious infection include tuberculosis tb and infection caused by virus fungi or bacteria that have spread throughout the body some people have died from these infection people should be tested for tb before humira use and monitored for sign and symptom of tb during therapy people at risk of tb may be treated with medicine for tb treatment with humira should not be started in a person with an active infection unless approved by a doctor humira should be stopped if a person develops a serious infection people should tell their doctor if they live in or have been to a region where certain fungal infection are common have had tb or hepatitis b are prone to infection or have symptom such a fever fatigue cough or sore for people taking tnf blocker including humira the chance of getting lymphoma or other cancer may increase some people have developed a rare type of cancer called hepatosplenic tcell lymphoma this type of cancer often result in death if using tnf blocker including humira the chance of getting two type of skin cancer basal cell and squamous cell may increase these type are generally not lifethreatening if treated other possible serious side effect with humira include hepatitis b infection in carrier of the virus allergic reaction nervous system problem blood problem certain immune reaction including a lupuslike syndrome liver problem and new or worsening heart failure or psoriasis the use of humira with anakinra or abatacept is not recommended people using humira should not receive live vaccine common side effect of humira include injection site reaction redness rash swelling itching or bruising upper respiratory infection including sinus infection headache rash and nausea humira is given by heart disease is the leading cause of death for both men and woman in the united state every year about american experience a heart attack of these are a first heart attack while occur in men and woman who have previously suffered a heart attack a heart attack occurs when the blood flow that brings oxygen to the heart muscle becomes severely reduced or cut off completely this happens when coronary artery that supply the heart muscle with blood flow become narrow due to a buildup of fat cholesterol and other substance collectively called plaque about every second someone in the united state ha a heart attack actively working to prevent a heart attack is necessary to maintain your overall health and lower your risk of heart disease making smart lifestyle choice now regardless of your age will pay off for the rest of your life a study conducted at the karolinska institute found that engaging in these five healthy lifestyle habit could prevent nearly of firsttime heart attack maintain a healthy diet choose food that are low in saturated fat trans fat and sodium eat plenty of fruit and vegetable fiberrich whole grain and limit your meat intake if you choose to eat meat select the leanest cut available limiting sugar intake is also vital to preventing heart disease a study published in jama internal medicine found that those who got of calorie from added sugar had a higher risk of dying from cardiovascular disease compared to those who consumed only of their calorie from added sugar you may also want to consider adding certain food to your diet that can help unclog artery exercise an inactive lifestyle is a major risk factor for coronary heart disease regular exercise help reduce the risk of heart and blood vessel disease while controlling blood cholesterol diabetes and obesity lowering body weight blood pressure and insulin sensitivity through regular exercise can help dramatically reduce your chance of developing heart disease and experiencing a heart attack ditch the alcohol drinking alcohol excessively can lead to serious health problem including high blood pressure heart failure and stroke if you choose to drink alcohol do so in moderation the recommended amount is no more than one drink a day for woman of all age and men older than age and no more than two drink a day for men under the age of drinking too much alcohol can raise the level of triglyceride in the blood possibly leading to high blood pressure and heart failure quit smoking a smoker risk of developing coronary heart disease is much high than a nonsmoker cigarette smoking is a main risk factor for sudden cardiac death in patient with coronary heart disease and it also act with other risk factor to greatly increase heart disease risk quitting smoking can improve your hdl cholesterol level within on year of quitting you can reduce your risk of heart disease to half of that of a smoker and within year your risk of heart disease will be similar to someone who never smoked it never too late to quit maintain a healthy weight people who are overweight or obese are much more likely to develop heart disease even if they have no other risk factor being obese can raise blood cholesterol and trigylceride level lower good cholesterol level increase blood pressure and even induce diabetes choosing healthy food and being physically active can help you lose weight and lower your risk of a heart attack many food promote heart health including avocado source healthy food team center for disease control and prevention american heart association american heart association david wolfe american heart association american heart association rtt news national institute of health american heart association the post habit that decrease your risk of heart attack by appeared first on davidwolfecom jun http wwwdavidwolfecom habitsdecreaseheartattack
