in surgery there have been certain period when advancement in knowledge and technical invention have had a marked effect on our life and the surgeon ability two quantum leap occurred in the late th century which together allowed the transition to modern surgery the first great advancement wa the discovery and use of anesthesia especially ether to enable the surgeon to work without causing pain and the inevitable accompanying shock which would be life threatening subsequent new agent and newer delivery method have eliminated the bad effect of the original drug an appreciation of the germ theory of disease led rapidly to the development and application of antiseptic technique in surgery antisepsis which soon gave way to asepsis reduced the overall morbidity and mortality of surgery to a far more acceptable rate than in previous era the next major advancement wa a the result of the spanish civil war when an understanding of shock and it treatment in traumatic injury proved to be lifesaving in the post wwii era starting in the late a combination of better anesthesia technique and shock support plus a better understand of the body hemostasis led to greater surgical advance to the point where we can now even transplant organ included in these advancement were the use of new visual tool a well a the computer and microsurgical development so called noninvasive the first heart valve replacement happen in the s it wa a rather brutal procedure and took a such a great toll on the body that the majority who needed the operation the most especially the elderly over had little chance of surviving the operation i am unawares of anyone in the being offered the procedure the operation wa done by splitting the sternum breast bone down the middle then the heart is exposed the pericardium is opened and the patient is put on a cardiopulmonary bypass machine also known a the heartlung machine this machine take over the task of breathing for the patient and pumping their blood around while the surgeon replaces the heart valve before it invention the heart continued to beat and made it difficult to place the valve a further advancement wa the addition of the use of hypothermia lowering the body temperature early adoption of this technique proceeded slowly based on the limitation of available replacement valve and relatively primitive technique for protecting the heart during surgery which were available at the time with the evolution of mechanical heart valve and gradual development in cardiopulmonary bypass the heart lung machine and cardioplegia which allow the heart to be stopped safely during surgery aortic valve replacement became accepted therapy for patient with severe aortic insufficiency and or regurgitation once the patient is on bypass a cut is made in the aorta and a cross clamp applied the surgeon then remove the patient diseased aortic valve and a mechanical or tissue valve is put in it place once the valve is in place and the aorta ha been closed the patient is taken off the heartlung machine transesophageal echocardiogram tee an ultrasound of the heart done through the esophagus can be used to verify that the new valve is functioning properly pacing wire are usually put in place so that the heart can be manually paced should any complication arise after surgery drainage tube are also inserted to drain fluid from the chest and pericardium following surgery these are usually removed within hour while the pacing wire are generally left in place until right before the patient is discharged from the hospital recovery from this operation usually take about month or more a medical procedure evolved cardiac cauterization became standard and not only could the heart blood vessel be visualized but the placing of stent instead of open heart coronary heart surgery became possible and a common treatment in only year ago the first aortic valve wa replaced by using a catheter inserted through the femoral artery and passed into the heart hospitalization wa now no more than day if there were no complication which were much le than in open heart replacement now those in the could be treated instead of facing rapid progress heart failure within a week or two the patient could depending on his heir status resume normal life these valve folded up so that they could be passed through the catheter and were then open when in the area of the valve to be replaced and anchored into position they consisted of a metal framework covered with a plastic and the valve itself wa usual from pig tissue the metal frame help anchor the valve in place the operation is called trans aortic valve replacement tavr today a new and better valve for many reason is undergoing clinical trial in the usa although it ha been in use in europe for about year it ha no metal and is secured in place by expanding it a if it were a balloon and then hardening polymer is injected to fix it in place if the surgeon doe not like it initial positioning he deflates the balloon and reposition it under the ultrasound and fluoroscope guidance before injecting the fixing agent it will be only be a matter of time when all valve replacement will be done by this le traumatic method apr http dpotpourriblogspotcom ofhearthtml

our daily life although some heart attack occur suddenly most begin slowly with only mild pain and discomfort these symptom may be taken lightly and help may not be sought in time sign of a heart attack may include the following discomfort in the center of the chest thats either constant or come and go this discomfort can be in the form of pressure squeezing fullness or pain chest discomfort is the most common heart attack symptom among men and woman discomfort in other area such a the arm neck jaw or stomach shortness of breath cold sweat lightheadedness nausea woman are somewhat more likely than men to experience the other sign of heart attack listed above cardiac arrest occurs immediately here are some of the sign sudden unresponsiveness abnormal breathing normal breath not taken when head is tilted up and checked for at least second stroke warning sign include any of the following sudden change numbness or weakness in the arm leg or face especially on one side of the body confusion trouble understanding or verbalizing thought vision difficulty in one or both eye trouble walking loss of balance or coordination severe headache with unknown cause dont wait more than five according to the center for disease control and prevention about million american adult have high blood pressure thats one out of every three adult and only about half of them have their condition under control uncontrolled high blood pressure can cause damage to the body and even become fatal an even scarier fact high blood pressure is a condition that usually show little to no symptom if you dont check on your blood pressure because you assume symptom will alert you if something is wrong youre most likely taking a dangerous chance that could cost you your life research show that over half of people with high blood pressure are completely unaware of it in severe case of high blood pressure symptom may appear sign of a serious hypertension problem include feeling confused or other neurological symptom nosebleed fatigue blurred vision chest pain abnormal heartbeat health consequence that may occur if high blood pressure is left untreated include damage to the heart and coronary artery this can include a heart attack heart disease congestive heart failure aortic dissection and atherosclerosis the hardening of artery stroke kidney damage loss of vision memory loss fluid in the lung angina peripheral artery disease risk factor for high blood pressure since high blood pressure may not show symptom to alert you that something is wrong it important to know the risk factor for developing hypertension and learn how to prevent it there are several factor that you may have no control over a family history of high blood pressure put you at a higher risk a doe aging and even sleep apnea other risk factor can be controlled these include lack of physical activity exercising on a regular basis is beneficial to your health in so many way it help keep your heart and circulatory system healthy an inactive lifestyle increase your risk of high blood pressure heart disease blood vessel disease and stroke staying active will also help you to stay at a healthy weight and improve your overall health poor diet shuffling fast food processed food and soda into your body is similar to treating it like a trash can caring for your body involves eating a healthy diet full of fruit and vegetable essential nutrient and drinking plenty of water a diet high in calorie fat salt and sugar put you at a higher risk for high blood pressure and a long list of other health problem heavy alcohol use heavy and regular alcohol consumption can dramatically increase blood pressure it can also lead to heart failure stroke and irregular heartbeat overloading your body with alcohol can contribute to high triglyceride cancer and other disease preventing high blood pressure blood pressure level vary by age race and ethnicity check in with a health care professional to determine where your blood pressure level are versus where they should be the main way to manage your blood pressure are to eat a healthy diet and control salt intake participate in regular physical activity maintain a healthy weight manage stress avoid smoking and limit alcohol research ha shown that in order to lower blood pressure naturally it important to choose food that are naturally low in sodium and high in at least two of these three mineral calcium magnesium and potassium here are several food that youll want to incorporate into your diet to help reach your essential mineral goal white bean kiwifruit peach nectarine banana kale red bell pepper sweet potato quinoa avocado h t healthy food and sport tip the post warning sign of high blood pressure and natural way to treat it austin personal injury lawyer perlmutter schuelke pllc austin tx law firm newswire april liberty county resident yearold lester berry had his power disconnected disabling his oxygen concentrator he slowly suffocated to death lester berry family found their father several day after thanksgiving berry wa found close to the phone unfortunately without power not only did his oxygen concentrator not work the phone wa not operational either berry had chronic pulmonary disease and congestive heart failure berry son stated that the electric company did know of his father illness and wa also on notice that he occasionally had financial difficulty it had been the utility prior practice to allow berry up to four month to pay while still providing power in court document the utility suggested berry did not seek or obtain payment assistance or give them any notice that he needed assistance the company further suggested berry death wa the result of an unavoidable accident it wa usual for berry to put cash in an envelope and leave it in his mailbox in rural tarkington the letter carrier then bought him a money order for his electricity the month berry died he had followed the same routine but rain got the first envelope wet berry brought it back into the house and wrote a note explaining why payment wa late and enclosing the money order once again the note wa found near his body according to the statement of claim filed in this matter which alleges gross negligence leading to the death of lester berry sam houston electric cooperative shut his power off because he wa a month behind on his bill he allegedly owed the lawsuit is seeking compensation from the court for over million this case represents such a needle death when the utility company could have extended the shut off period a they had in the past or could have contacted berry directly to ask for payment if they had they would have received an explanation for the late payment through a series of unfortunate circumstance berry lost his life said brook schuelke an austin wrongful death lawyer not involved in the case court document seemingly indicated berry had complied with all the requirement to inform the utility that electricity wa needed to sustain his life somewhere along the line something went drastically wrong wrongful death case are usually not about money or revenge they are about sending a message to the defendant that their behavior is not acceptable and that they must do all in their power to not harm another individual in the same situation indicated schuelke this death could have been prevented but for the action the utility took in cutting off berry power learn more at http wwwcivtrialcom perlmutter schuelke pllc east th street ste austin tx call view larger map clean eating is about being aware of the food choice you are making and looking for simple healthy option it mean consuming plenty of vegetable fruit whole grain and healthy protein and fat and opting for organic nongmo food whenever possible let explore in more detail why clean eating is so important and look at tip for eating clean that can immediately begin transforming your relationship with food cut back on added sugar american consume a shocking amount of added sugar every day on average adult take in teaspoon ounce of added sugar which equates to around calorie to help you visualize ounce is around the size of a deck of card of sugar every day most added sugar is consumed in the form of soft drink the many different kind of sugar additive in processed food and candy cake cooky pie and pastry sugar add calorie to food while contributing zero nutritional value aside from energy carbohydrate a highsugar diet is linked to obesity metabolic syndrome insulin resistance that can lead to diabetes hypoglycemia heart disease high blood pressure depression gout headache fatigue it important to be mindful of the amount of sugar in the food you are eating a well a the type of sugar it also help to eat food with good amount of fiber a it slows the body absorption of sugar limiting consumption of highly processed added sugar is an essential part of clean eating distinguishing between natural and added sugar in prepared food can be confusing for consumersthats why some consumer group are petitioning the food and drug administration fda to require disclosure of added sugar on nutrition label how much is okay the world health organization who recommends no more than teaspoon gram of added sugar a day ditch refined grain refined grain are le nutritious because they have been stripped of their bran and germthe most fibrous part of the plant a in fruit the fiber in grain is what slows the absorption of sugar when blood sugar level rise too quickly the result is a spike in insulin which over time can increase your risk of diabetes there ha been a lot of backlash against the idea that refined grain are le healthy especially white rice but we stand firmwhole grain are simply the healthier choice choose whole grain like whole wheat steel cut or rolled oat brown rice quinoa amaranth flax and barley watch salt intake american consume far more salt on average than the recommended mg maximum per day sodium easily hide in packaged food sometimes in surprising quantity read nutrition label carefully and choose wisely when seasoning homemade food start with herb spice citrus and vinegarand then add salt you might be surprised at how much salt you add to food while cooking a highsodium diet can lead to high blood pressure stroke heart disease heart failure choose minimallyprocessed food all food ha been processed to some extenteven fresh fruit and vegetable must be harvested cleaned and in some case polished before they make it to your local market how do you know a food ha been minimally processed a good rule of thumb is to choose packaged food and healthy snack with ingredient you can pronounce a fruit and nut bar that contains ingredient like date cherry almond and walnut in other word easily identifiable ingredientsis a good choice avoid heavily processed food with a laundry list of ingredient especially unrecognizable one pick your fat wisely in year past dietary fat had a bad rap the lowfat craze led to fat being removed from packaged food only to be replaced by sugar which a we discussed above is not a good substitute today we know that not all fat are created equal and that good fat the polyunsaturated and monounsaturated variety are essential for health industrialmade fat including trans fat should be avoided trans fat are a byproduct of hydrogenation which involves forcing hydrogen molecule into oil to turn it into a solid at room temperature and prevent rancidity good for shelf life bad for your artery on food label youll typically see trans fat a hydrogenated or partially hydrogenated vegetable oil these fat increase your bad ldl lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol which can clog artery and lead to a host of health problem what about saturated fat these are mostly solid at room temperature and are found in food like red meat butter whole milk and palm oil american generally consume more saturated fat than they should although whether saturated fat are bad for u is still hotly contested the latest report released by the world health organization ha linked processed meat with an increased cancer risk your best bet is opting for product that contain expeller pressed or cold pressed vegetable oil and better yet monounsaturated oil from avocado nut and nut butter olive and high oleic variety sunflower oil increase vegetable intake pile those veggie onto your plate most of u dont get enough vegetable every day the usda recommends cup of vegetable per day for woman and cup per day for men but go ahead and eat morewe dare you it easier than you think dress your sandwich with lettuce and tomato whip up a veggiefruit smoothie after a workout tuck a bag of baby carrot in your bag and up the amount of veggie in your stir fry there are a myriad of way to increase your daily intake of veggie cut back on the booze i cook with wine sometimes i even add it to the food wc field most of u by now have heard the report that moderate alcohol consumption may help protect against cardiovascular disease this is because moderate level of alcohol increase level of highdensity lipoprotein hdl our good cholesterol the problem come in defining what constitutes moderate drinkingwhether it one drink per day or three is contested even among alcohol researcher here are some good rule to follow stay within the recommended one drink per day for woman or two for men avoid binge drinking sorry folk imbibing your weekly allotment of adult beverage on a saturday night isnt part of a moderate drinking program just say no to fruity drink loaded with sugar cut back on meat and dairy most american eat far more meat and dairy than is recommended by the usda many of u dont know what our daily protein need are which is part of the problem the average woman need just gram of protein a day while a man need around gram a day thats le than two ounce a sixounce steak contains a much protein a a woman need for an entire day but that same sixounce steak come with increased risk from carcinogen and saturated fat unlike other source of protein such a bean pea lentil nut grain and even some leafy green vegetable weve been told since we were little to drink our milk for strong bone but many might be surprised to learn that dairy may actually leach calcium from bone and threequarters of the world is lactose intolerant best to cut back on meat and dairy consumption and up alternative source of protein like bean nut and proteinpacked veggie and grain up your fruit intake it a common misconception that we should limit our fruit intake because fruit contains sugar in our first tip we explained the importance of the fructosetofiber ratio the fiber content in fruit help the body absorb sugar more slowly so go ahead indulge in daily do of delicious fruitiness and dont forget that all natural snack like fruit bar made from fruit juice and puree count toward your daily fruit intake drink more water water is essential for every single one of our bodily function it also flush toxin from the body plain water is the best option for staying hydrated but fruit and vegetable with high water content such a watermelon lettuce and tomato can also help you stay hydrated your water need can vary dramatically depending on the season and your level of physical activity but at a minimum strive for that is eight oz glass a day use this hydration calculator to determine your specific hydration need eating clean is about taking control of your health and understanding how our industrialized food system affect our health and the environment here to a fresh start and a cleaneating future source http wwwhsphharvardedu nutritionsource sugarydrinksfactsheet http wwwhealthharvardedu blog memory taken by alzheimers could possibly be retrieved paracetamol useless in treating osteoarthritis pain paracetamol is next to useless at alleviating arthritic pain the time report a comprehensive review of existing data suggests paracetamol should not be used in case of osteoarthritis a there are far more effective treatment available osteoarthritis is now the leading cause of joint pain and stiffness in older people the review showed that paracetamol at any dose had a very low chance of improving pain linked to osteoarthritis chance despite being advised a the painkiller of first choice in current guidance in contrast the nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug nsaid class of painkiller such a diclofenac mg per day and etoricoxib or mg per day were found more likely to improve pain between and likely and were the topranked painkilling drug a potential drawback to nsaid is that longterm use can trigger complication such a stomach ulcer and in rarer case heart failure if a person is thought to be at risk of stomach ulcer additional protective medication such a proton pump inhibitor may also be prescribed nice the uk health watchdog which issue guidance to doctor is in the process of updating it guidance on drug management of osteoarthritis therefore it is likely that this latest study will feed into the process if you have concern speak to your doctor do not change prescribed medication without consulting your doctor first not doing so may damage your health lifestyle change such a losing weight and regular exercise can also help relieve symptom of osteoarthritis university in switzerland and canada and wa funded by the swiss national science foundation and arco foundation many of the researcher involved in the project reported that they were employed by or had received grant from pharmaceutical company the study wa published medical journal the lancet the uk medias report were generally accurate but largely ignored the good news about nsaid and instead focused on debating whether paracetamol should be used for arthritic pain this is a reasonable line to take due to the large number of people who use paracetamol to relieve arthritis pain both in the uk and around the world wa a metaanalysis of randomised control trial rcts looking at how effective different drug were to help lower pain linked to osteoarthritis osteoarthritis is a condition that cause the joint to become painful and stiff it is the most common type of arthritis in the uk there is no cure for osteoarthritis but it can be effectively managed the main treatment for osteoarthritis include lifestyle measure such a maintaining a healthy weight and exercising regularly medication to relieve your pain including paracetamol and supportive therapy to help make everyday activity easier the analysis found decent sized rcts with over people comparing different nsaid or paracetamol with a placebo to improve osteoarthritic pain how well the drug improved joint movement wa also assessed included nsaid that are available in the uk were ibuprofen celecoxib commonly called a cox inhibitor etoricoxib commonly called a cox inhibitor the analysis also included rofecoxib and lumiracoxib both of which have been withdrawn from the uk market due to safety concern in total people were included in the analysis average median follow up wa week with a large range from one week to one year the researcher used a statistical technique called network metaanalysis this allows direct and indirect comparison of drug for example if one study compared paracetamol with a placebo and a second compared an nsaid with placebo in similar condition this technique allows you to estimate the probability that paracetamol work better than the nsaid including these indirect comparison is useful but not a accurate a trial directly comparing one drug with another sometimes called headtohead trial this review included both direct and indirect comparison the final output wa a rank of all the nsaid paracetamol and placebo and an estimate of their ability to achieve a minimum clinically important difference in pain the minimum difference wa defined at a set point reduction standard deviation within the overall spread of pain reduction for each trial etoricoxib mg or mg and diclofenac mg per day the maximum dose were very likely to improve pain between and likely and were the topranked nsaid the withdrawn drug rofecoxib wa also similarly ranked the bottom of the ranking table wa filled with different do of paracetamol for example the highestranked paracetamol dose g per day wa linked to only a chance of helping pain to a useful level do le than g had only a chance of helping pain ranking second to last behind naproxen mg concluded on the basis of the available data we see no role for singleagent paracetamol for the treatment of patient with osteoarthritis irrespective of dose they added we provide sound evidence that diclofenac mg day is the most effective nsaid available at present in term of improving both pain and function nevertheless in view of the safety profile of these drug physician need to consider our result together with all known safety information when selecting the preparation and dose for individual patient conclusion this swiss study reviewed drug commonly used and recommended to help pain associated with osteoarthritis through indirect comparison it identified those likely to be most effective diclofenac mg day and those that are pretty likely to be useless paracetamol any dose the study looked at a large number of goodsized rcts all with more than people and covered a useful range of nsaid the quality of the rcts wa also assessed and wa generally not highly biased although variable however the review included many indirect comparison of the drug which is le accurate and reliable than direct comparison but without more direct comparison available this is probably the best we have to go on for now the main implication from the study author point of view wa clear paracetamol ha no place in the pain management of osteoarthritis on it own this finding jar with the uk current national guidance that advocate using paracetamol a a firstchoice painkiller alongside other osteoarthritis management the fact paracetamol might not be useful in the pain management of osteoarthritis doe appear to be recognised by nice the watchdog that issue guidance on medicine although the current guidance based on recommendation advocate it use for example nice report that it is in the process of updating the guidance and hint that paracetamol may be le effective than thought in nice make a point of saying on it website that an evidence review on the effectiveness of paracetamol a part of a consultation exercise showed reduced effectiveness of paracetamol in the management of osteoarthritis compared with what wa previously thought the current guideline on pain management in osteoarthritis is due to be updated in september in the meantime if you have concern about taking paracetamol for pain linked to osteoarthritis consult your doctor before changing your medication it is also important not to overlook the benefit that lifestyle change such a achieving a healthy weight and becoming more active can bring read more about how exercise and weight loss can help prevent future flareup of arthritis symptom in a paper just published on behalf of the committee dutch dietary guideline of the dutch health council in the european journal of clinical nutrition the method and result of the committee work to derive foodbased dietary guideline for the dutch population is described and discussed these new dietary guideline for the dutch are based on systematic review of english language metaanalyses in pubmed summarizing randomized controlled trial and prospective cohort study on nutrient food and food pattern and the risk of major chronic disease coronary heart disease stroke heart failure diabetes breast cancer colorectal cancer lung cancer chronic obstructive pulmonary disease dementia and depression the committee also selected three causal risk factor for cardiovascular disease or diabetes systolic blood pressure lowdensity lipoprotein cholesterol and body weight finding were categorized a strong or weak evidence inconsistent effect too little evidence or effect unlikely for experimental and observational data separately next the committee selected only finding with a strong level of evidence for deriving the guideline convincing evidence wa based on strong evidence from the experimental data either or not in combination with strong evidence from prospective cohort study plausible evidence wa based on strong evidence from prospective cohort study only a general guideline to eat a more plant foodbased dietary pattern and limit consumption of animalbased food and specific guideline have been formulated there are new guideline on legume nut meat dairy produce cereal product fat and oil tea coffee and sugarcontaining beverage three guideline on vegetable fruit fish and alcoholic beverage have been sharpened and the guideline on salt stayed the same a separate guideline ha been formulated on nutrient supplement we concluded that completely foodbased dietary guideline can be derived in a systematic and transparent way apr http hi dear welcome to hcm understanding your concern a per your query you have sudden dizziness and palpitation well there can be many reason for symptom you mention in query but in your case the symptom are probably due to cardiac problem like angina or heart failure i would suggest you to consult cardiologist without any delay doctor may order ecg tmt along with complete blood profile and checking vitals doctor may prescribe isosorbide nitrate aspirin betablockers frusamide and sedative doctor may also order angiography for now stay calm take proper rest and do not exert your body a your doctor already ruled out cardiac problem your should refer you to gastroenterologist for acid reflux disease or neurologist for nerve dysfunction for now eat light and non spicy specially at night take antacid after every meal hope your concern ha been resolved get well soon best wish dr harry maheshwari mar http wwwhealthcaremagiccom question suggesttreatmentforsuddendizzinessandpalpitation answer

hiram king hank williams hk wljmz september january wa an american singersongwriter and musician regarded a one of the most significant and influential american singer and songwriter of the th century williams recorded single five released posthumously that would place in the top of the billboard country western best seller chart including that ranked number one three posthumously born in mount olive butler county alabama williams moved to georgiana where he met rufus payne a black street performer who gave him guitar lesson in exchange for meal or money payne had a major influence on williams later musical style along with roy acuff and ernest tubb during this time williams informally changed his name to hank believing it to be a better name for country music he moved to montgomery and his music career began there in when wsfa radio station producer hired him to perform and host a minute program he formed a backup the drifting cowboy band which wa managed by his mother and dropped out of school to devote his time to his career when several of his band member were conscripted into military service during world war ii williams had trouble with their replacement and wa dismissed by wsfa due to his alcoholism williams eventually married audrey sheppard who managed him for nearly a decade after recording never again and honky tonkin with sterling record he signed a contract with mgm record in he released move it on over which became a hit and also joined the louisiana hayride radio program one year later he released a cover of lovesick blue which carried him into the mainstream of music after an initial rejection williams joined the grand ole opry he wa unable to read or notate music to any significant degree among the hit he wrote were your cheatin heart hey good lookin and im so lonesome i could cry several year of back pain alcoholism and prescription drug abuse severely damaged williams health he divorced sheppard and wa dismissed by the grand ole opry which cited unreliability and frequent intoxication williams died in the early morning hour of january at the age of from heart failure exacerbated by pill and alcohol despite his short life williams ha had a major influence on th century popular music especially country music the song he wrote and recorded have been covered by numerous artist and have been hit in various genre he ha been inducted into multiple music hall of fame such a the country music hall of fame the songwriter hall of fame and the rock and roll hall of fame mar http biographycentralblogspotcom quote i am interested about your comment about how you would prefer the heart disease to the cancer in actual fact i am the opposite a we have proved cancer is curable whereas cardiomyopathy is with u for ever i would actually prefer the cancer i am very happy with my life at the moment but would love to wake up one morning and find that there wa a drug that could give me that magic fix unfortunately although i have been offered the most up to date and innovative treatment out there i am still in heart failure and probably will be for the rest of my life you do come to term with it but you do have to live with it daily for the rest of your life ozchrissy this is my story i wa diagnosed at age with stage acute lymphoblastic lymphoma i had a survival chance and it went up to with a bone marrow transplant my son wa born a few week early by emergency csection so i could start chemo immediately i became depressed postpartum and everything else going on i wa in intensive care multiple time when the chemo did it trick and i hit remission i went for the transplant spent day inpatient in another hospital in chicago illinois had more chemo that took me to the brink of death before they could infuse the bone marrow once i finally wa able to go home it took several month before i had enough strength to take care of my newborn remember i just had a baby we had hired help and family member living with u to help at night we own a construction company and no money coming in if my husband didnt work all day i couldnt go out in public for a year if i had to go to the grocery store i had to wear a mask i couldnt drive for over month it took a year for my hair to start growing back and i have some permanent alopecia i had many side effect from the chemo drug i had a little liver trouble after the transplant but that cleared up they had to use the big gun and those gave pretty big side effect i wont go into the gory detail but it wa very unpleasant painful and scary at time ironically i never actually thought i would die i just wished i would the only thing that kept me going wa that little boy i had to get back to the worst fear for me wa me dying and having my motherinlaw take care of him lol now for those of you who may have just read this keep in mind that wa year ago and the treatment is significantly different now if you know someone who ha to have a bone marrow transplant it will not be like what you just read thankfully for me i actually see chf a livable changed my diet and my expectation of what i can accomplish and just enjoy life for however long i can i am not afraid of dying but dont worry i am not suicidal either i just look at it very differently now my opinion is there are worse thing than death arent you sorry you asked ozchrissy i really am a very happy calm easy going person who just enjoys the simple thing in life and im happy that the sun is shining today here may http wwwicdsupportgrouporg board by kevin barnes at some point in your life you have experienced pain in your body pain is not a disease on it own but it is a signal that your body ha a medical condition that need treatment it is common for one to make an offcounter purchase of drug that relieve pain but it is advisable to visit a doctor for an examination instead of overlooking pain you can consult a pain doctor houston professional for advice assessment and treatment there are several pain that you should not ignore a this article discus one of the pain that you should not overlook is severe morning headache a mild headache can go unnoticed but a severe headache denotes an acute health issue such a a brain tumor the condition is rare therefore you should not think of a brain tumor every time your head hurt in the morning the incidence of a primary brain tumor is usually below one percent at time you may experience a stomach irritation that occurs between the navel and the breastplate it is usually in the form of a burning sensation and it indicates several medical condition including ulcer this type of pain ha other complimentary sign such a blood in the stool and getting a relief each time you take a meal having a painful discomfort and a swell on one leg is a probable indication of a blood clot sometimes when one travel on plane or car for a long time the blood tends to clot in the leg the same happens if one rest for so long or after having a recent surgery swelling in both leg denotes a more complex condition such a a congestive heart failure it show that you should never ignore a swelling that occurs on leg but you should see a specialist a painful irritation in the back at night is the other health issue to watch the irritation is usually so severe that it wake you up while it is possible to rule out wearing and tearing of the body a the main cause of the pain having a history of cancer or fever for a person having such back pain necessitates a visit to a specialist there is a medical condition that result in the hardening of the artery and one of the main sign is having pain that penetrates on your back you should never ignore this kind of a discomfort since it might result in a heart problem you had better prevent extensive complication by taking the ideal measure on a timely manner one of the early indicator of diabetes is having a feeling of pin and needle in the foot a lot of people live with diabetes since they tend to ignore the feeling what follows after the feeling is numbness of the foot making a prompt visit to a specialist after having the pin and needle in the foot enables one to manage diabetes at it early stage having the discussed sign doe not necessarily mean that you have the medical condition that are associated with them however it is only a doctor who can confirm the nature of the resultant medical condition that the pain indicate therefore you should make a visit to a specialist to have the pain examined about the author if you tina turner burlington nc after day of lying in a hospital bed fighting every day to survive a yearold burlington north carolina boy got a lifesaving heart transplant a video of albert jeffries iv finding out this week that a heart wa available for transplant wa posted to a facebook page by his mother and his stunned reaction to the good news ha helped the post go viral albert wa born with dilated cardiomyopathy a heart disease that cause the heart main pumping chamber the left ventricle to be enlarged and weakened decreasing it ability to pump blood he almost passed out his mother tina turner told abc news friday about the moment albert first found out late wednesday of the organ availability he could not believe the news whats going on whats going on he say in the video that his doctor filmed of the moment his mother told him he had a heart available they got my heart they got my heart turner a nurse at unc hospital where her son wa staying had found out earlier in the day that the hospital finally had a heart transplant available for her son she wa at the nail salon a per her son request to give him some space when she got a call from her son telling her the nurse werent giving him food she called to figure out what wa going on and the nurse told her they stopped albert from eating because he wa prepping for heart surgery when she said he prepping i lost it i knew he had a heart turner said a woman at the nail salon sitting next to her filmed her reaction to the phone call i wa screaming and cry people who saw me were screaming and cry she said i wa so overwhelmed with emotion in that moment all the doctor appointment the sleepless night and the holiday spent in the hospital meant nothing to turner because they were not going to stop until he got that heart at several time in albert life it appeared that the odds were against him going into icu when he wa and and going into heart failure around christmas in but turner described how his positivity helped him fight on i always tell my kid not to have fear to be strong she said this kid is the one who kept me strong during this last lengthy span he wa in the hospital for day and counting he contracted double pneumonia and his kidney started failing but he wa able to persevere turner said all these year he took the disease like a champ she said before the surgery on wednesday night albert listened to his heart beating one last time he underwent surgery late wednesday night into early thursday morning the next morning his mother recorded him waking up and saying i feel like a new person albert is on the road to recovery and his heart is fully working now turner said he should be out of the hospital in the next couple of week she added she said albert is looking forward to going back to school and finally getting the chance to run and play sport that he wa never able to do before he is my hero she said copyright abc radio all right reserved mar http march am edt current clinical trial are evaluating stem cell therapy for condition ranging from eye disease to aid discovery in stem cell science over the past decade are finally starting to reach the clinic current clinical trial are evaluating stem cell therapy for condition ranging from eye disease to aid these trial are going on in the united state europe canada japan and elsewhere but australia is lagging behind while we remain fairly competitive in fundamental research we are slow to translate our discovery into new therapy this concern wa expressed in the australian academy of science report released today called the stem cell revolution lesson and imperative for australia it contains a series of recommendation from young research leader in the field on how australian science policy can help fasttrack stem cell research here researcher are often asked by patient or their relative when stem cell treatment will be available for certain medical condition ten year ago the answer would have been that there are no new treatment yet but we are working to develop them today we are forced to answer that clinical trial of cell therapy for particular condition are going on but not in australia we have an obligation to ensure that australian patient their family carers and physician are not left behind in the stem cell revolution stem cell therapy human embryonic stem cell which can become cell in any tissue of the body were first discovered in today embryonic stem cell treatment trial are underway for macular degeneration a common form of blindness spinal cord injury juvenile diabetes and heart failure embryonic stem cell therapy are being trialled for macular degeneration a common form of blindness embryonic stem cell therapy are being trialled for macular degeneration a common form of blindness then there are the induced pluripotent stem ip cell that japanese scientist shinya yamanaka discovered which won him the nobel prize in ip cell are made from adult tissue and have many of the defining property of embryonic stem cell they can be made from skin or blood cell of any person after yamanakas discovery japan cell therapy regulatory framework wa modified to fasttrack product from these new stem cell into the clinic a a consequence therapy using induced ip cell which enable close tissue matching of stem cell transplant to patient to prevent graft rejection are now in clinical trial there only ten year after their discovery more trial will begin very soon for instance year of research on midbrain dopaminergic neuron the cell lost in parkinson disease ha paved the way for upcoming trial of stem cell replacing these lost neuron there are also a large number of human trial in progress using mesenchymal stem cell which are extracted from bone marrow fat or other tissue capable of modulating the immune system and inflammatory response these stem cell have the potential ability to treat arthritis autoimmune disorder graft versus host disease in bone marrow transplant patient and a number of other condition neural stem cell derived from either foetal or adult brain tissue are also undergoing testing in human for rare inherited disorder of the brain or more common condition including spinal cord injury it unlikely these early stage trial will produce cure for any of these condition indeed they might pose a many question a they answer but it is essential and significant that these trial are moving forward because the lesson we learn from them will guide u towards the design of the next generation of cellular therapeutic gene therapy and drug discovery today genetic modification of stem cell with precision can provide cell therapy that can permanently correct serious genetic disorder human embryonic stem cell can become cell in tissue in any part of the body for year progress in gene therapy wa almost totally blocked by safety concern around the relatively crude technology for introducing genetic alteration into patient cell but technological advance have enabled precise correction of genetic defect within a cell this avoids offtarget modification that can cause cancer and other serious toxicity new treatment using combined gene and cell therapy are undergoing trial now the california institute of regenerative medicinelists about ten new human study including in aid blood disease and cancer then there is a third stream of stem cell research that although perhaps le visible to the general public ha implication well beyond cell therapy this is the ability to derive pluripotent stem cell from patient with genetic predisposition to disease or to introduce disease mutation into stem cell via gene editing we can then use these diseasespecific stem cell line to generate the cell type affected in a particular disorder to study what go wrong with them in the lab for instance we can study how a gene that cause epilepsy affect the electrical property of human nerve cell once we develop these cell culture model we can use them to screen candidate drug to correct the deficit in the affected cell this technology will enable u to reduce dependence on animal model which dont always replicate human disease and will reduce the risk of testing drug on living human subject these advance have the potential to speed the discovery of new medicine to rapidly eliminate candidate drug that might cause toxicity in the clinic and to save million from the cost of drug development to ensure australian patient have timely access to new stem cell therapy for intractable disease we must maintain our excellence in fundamental stem cell research but we also need to develop new and better mechanism to support collaboration between academia the private sector and philanthropist with the aim of translating discovery into cure http theconversationcom stemcelltherapiesareadvancingbutwillaustralianpatientsbeleftbehind mar http margiesjournalblogspotcom stemcelltherapiesareadvancingbuthtml

so the last post i wrote ended with a comment of me overcoming some chronic illness in my life unfortunately i have allowed a few label to be placed upon me by the medical profession to explain the aftermath of very traumatic medical experience in my life so let me first recap and go back a few year and bring you all up to speed i wa admitted to the hospital with graf dysease hyperthyroidism in during my admittance i wa informed that i wa in the final stage and at the point where my internal organ were beginning to shut down a wa told by the admittance nurse in the hospital i actually collapsed on my way into the hospital and wa put in a wheel chair a i answered the necessary question i have little recollection of much a time blurred in and out for me for a couple of day now how did i get here in this dire state of being how did i not realize how sick i wa this is how i remember it in my faded memory i recall not feeling right a little more nervous than usual i believe i let that voice in my head take control because i had lost control of my sensibility graves dysease is about hyperactivity in the thyroid and my whole system wa a mess of nervous energy i walked and walked something i used to do a a child to get away from the arguing and violence between my parent i lived in my head at that time i remember moment of weakness but i would just sit for a while and then continue walking i lived alone in north van and i had isolated myself from family and friend i remember going for a sauna one day and feeling a though my heart wa going to bust out of my body i lay down for a long time before going back up to my apartment that incident wa very scary and got me to thinking sensibly for a moment i realized that something wa wrong also i wa losing control of my bowel movement i would sit and cry because i did not know what to do fortunately it wa christmas time and my family invited me spend the holiday with them in langley i made the decision then that i would call a family meeting and tell them about my situation it wa boxing day and i had just attempted to walk up the stair to take a nap my heart began pumping a though i wa in a race i lied down for a moment and went back downstairs and told my daughter and my niece that i need to go to the hospital they took me to a clinic the next day and the doctor who wa filling in for another doctor knew immediately what wa wrong with me he called the hospital to tell them that i wa coming in and had my family take me there asap i wa diagnosed with congestive heart failure caused by being in the final stage of graf dysease i woke up and a very stout nurse with short dark hair wa standing over me asking me if i wa in pain i said something like i felt like a truck had run over my chest she commented that that wa what it wa like when your heart wa a few time larger than normal she briefed me on how to inject myself with the morphine that wa attached to my hand gave me some water and i drifted off to neverland i felt like i wa living in someone else world i wa in a glassed room across the hall from icu it wa mostly quite at least i think it wa i felt like i just wanted to lie there forever and let everyone around me decide what my life wa to be so what happened to help me mover forwardstay tuned may http surreypsychicblogspotcom walkingindarknesshtml

view more job san ramon calif june prnewswire bioventrix inc an emerging medical device company dedicated to the minimally invasive treatment of heart failure hf announced today that it ha received certification for ce marking it revivent tc transcatheter ventricular enhancement system following a myocardial infarction or heart attack the revivent tc system implant proprietary microanchor pair to exclude scarred myocardium from the healthy tissue of the left ventricle lv the restoration of the lv to a more optimal volume and conical shape ha proven to enhance cardiac performance and significantly improve a patient quality of life the certification for ce marking is not only an important milestone for the company but also for those who treat heart failure said mr kenneth miller president and chief executive officer of bioventrix more importantly it transforms the spectrum of treatment by offering a minimally invasive therapeutic solution for the previously ignored ventricle by making this critical treatment available we are giving physician an important additional resource that they can utilize in conjunction with existing valvular and vascular therapy making guidelinedirected medical therapy gdmt even more effective moreover it provides access to efficacious and tolerable therapy to many frail patient who previously would have no option continued mr miller more than patient will become eligible each year for this device implant said mr miller heart failure remains an epidemic worldwide and the ce marking certification validates the need for a novel therapy for heart failure patient suffering from left ventricular dysfunction added dr lon annest chief medical officer of bioventrix there is no doubt that lv volume reduction is an important therapy a it directly impact the parameter that determine prognosis and survival such a lv volume and ejection fraction the impact of the revivent tc system is achieved by transcatheter access to exclude the ischemic portion of the left ventricle from the healthy tissue continued dr annest this empowers heart team in europe who currently have a backlog of patient and soon in the u to ensure optimal clinical outcome by minimizing the risk compared to conventional surgery said dr annest at year followup patient have made remarkable improvement in their quality of life by additionally the clinical benefit ha been proven to extend life for patient with a significant reduction of lv endsystolic volume index and improvement of lv ejection fraction left ventricular volume reduction is especially critical for the survival of a patient a other study have shown that significant lv volume reduction can directly prolong a patient life the revivent tc system is the only interventional therapy that can consistently achieve this survival benefit in heart failure patient about the revivent tc system and the live le invasive ventricular enhancement procedure placement of the revivent tc system via the live tm procedure obviates the need for more invasive surgery instead small titanium anchor are placed along the outer surface of the heart and along one of the interior wall via a closedchest endovascular approach the anchor are then pulled toward one another effectively excluding the scarred and nonfunctioning heart wall ventricular volume is immediately reduced a a result of the exclusion by a much a percent click here for corporate video with animation about the live tm procedure the world only reshaping left ventricle therapy the live tm procedure is based upon a welldefined law of physic called the law of laplace which describes the relationship between the radius and pressure of the lv and it resulting wall tension increased wall tension is the underlying cause of lv enlargement worsening heart failure symptom and ultimately patient death reducing wall tension is key to preventing further lv enlargement and treat the progression of the disease the revivent tc system placed via the live procedure is uniquely designed to directly reduce the lv radius which in turn decrease wall tension and interrupt the ongoing destructive process of heart failure michler r et al insight from the stich trial change in left ventricular size after coronary artery bypass grafting with and without surgical ventricular reconstruction j of thoracic and cardiovascular surgery october jjtcvs data available on file wechsler a et al clinical benefit twelve month after le invasive ventricular restoration operation without ventriculotomy annual meeting of the european society of cardiothoracic surgery oct vienna austria jun http wwwbiospacecom newsstoryaspxstoryidfull

for some patient with type diabetes treatment with intense bloodlowering medication may do more harm than good this is according to a new study published in the bmj for some patient with type diabetes antihypertensive medication may raise the risk of cardiovascular death the researcher including mattias brunstrm of the department of public health and clinical medicine at ume university in sweden found that antihypertensive drug may increase the risk of cardiovascular death for diabetes patient with a systolic blood pressure under mm hg while almost in people in the u have high blood pressure or hypertension the condition affect around in american with diabetes putting them at higher risk of stroke heart disease and other cardiovascular problem a such people with diabetes are often prescribed medication to help lower blood pressure the american diabetes association recommend a systolic blood pressure target of le than mm hg for patient with type diabetes the most common form of diabetes though a target of le than mm hg is recommended for some patient if it can be achieved safely for their study brunstrm and his colleague bo carlberg also of the department of public health and clinical medicine at ume set out to investigate whether the effect of antihypertensive medication vary dependent on a patient blood pressure prior to treatment increased cardiovascular death risk for some diabetes patient the team conducted a metaanalysis of randomized controlled trial involving a total of participant that looked at the cardiovascular outcome of people with diabetes who were receiving blood pressurelowering medication the vast majority of participant had type diabetes and subject were followedup for at least month the team looked at the blood pressure of participant before treatment and assessed the cardiovascular effect of antihypertensive medication the researcher found that participant whose blood pressure wa higher than mm hg before treatment had a reduced risk of stroke heart attack heart failure and allcause mortality among subject whose blood pressure wa le than mm hg prior to antihypertensive treatment however no cardiovascular benefit were identified in fact these participant were found to be at greater risk of cardiovascular death commenting on the finding brunstrm say our study show that intensive blood pressurelowering treatment using antihypertensive drug may be harmful for people with diabetes and a systolic blood pressure le than mm hg the researcher stress that because most study participant had type diabetes their result may not apply to people with type diabetes or those with diabetes who have normal blood pressure additionally they point out that antihypertensive medication is crucial to most people with diabetes who have systolic blood pressure above mm hg in practice it is important to remember that undertreatment of high blood pressure is a bigger problem than overtreatment add brunstrm still the team say the finding could have important implication for clinical guideline for diabetes patient with high blood pressure noting that many country are due to review such guideline in the next few year it ha been discussed to recommend even lower blood pressure level for people with diabetes maybe a low a say brunstrm we are hoping that our study which show potential risk of such aggressive blood pressurelowering treatment will come to influence these guideline earlier this month medical news today reported on a study detailing the creation of insulinproducing ministomachs which researcher say could offer a new cellular therapy for diabetes click the star to rate this article type diabetes blood pressure drug may be harmful for some patient public patient based on rating health professional feb http wwwmedicalnewstodaycom article php

originally posted by krom if we adopt this pragmatic approach which is fine and ignore the philosophy ontology you are still left with explaining how race is useful to science so far no race realist ha ever managed to explain what use race ha take for example medicine race ha no utility whatsoever these big group that we characterize a race are too heterogeneous to lump together in a scientific way if youre doing a dna study to look for marker for a particular disease you cant use caucasian a a group theyre too diverse naggert arbitrarily dividing human into caucasoids negroid and mongoloid is not useful in medicine since these grouping are too heterogeneous keith norrisgroups that selfidentify a a given race may share biologic characteristic that originated a a result of shared ancestry for example person of african descent in the united state who selfidentify a black or african american are more likely to have certain biologic trait that were ancestrally protective in africa such a heterozygosity for sickle cell disease which help to protect against malaria or the newly described apol gene which protects against trypanosomiasis science of course the allele that conveys malaria protection in heterozygote cause sickle cell disease in those carrying two copy and person homozygous for the protective form of apol are at increased risk for kidney failure thus in setting where malaria and trypanosomiasis are rare these biological trait are disadvantageous and may impart adverse health consequence other example of biology correlating with race include the disparity among racial group in the incidence of adverse effect noted with the use of angiotensinconverting enzyme ace inhibitor a class of drug commonly used to treat hypertension and congestive heart failure when these drug are used there are higher rate of angioedema in black than nonblacks and higher rate of medication discontinuation owing to druginduced cough in both black and asian more recently colleague and i reported racial and age difference in mortality rate for person with endstage renal disease treated with dialysis most u minority especially at the higher end of the age spectrum paradoxically showed increased longevity clin j am soc nephrol further cassianne robinsoncohen at the university of washington and colleague found that lower serum vitamin d concentration were associated with an increased risk of coronary heart disease among white or chinese participant but not among black or hispanic participant jama the role of race in medicine these and related finding clearly support the presence of racerelated variation in disease risk disease progression treatment response and treatmentrelated side effect a such there remains an important role for race ethnicity a a marker for ancestry and often for culture a well a other sociodemographic trait in characterizing patient with respect to medical care these variable can be helpful in understanding key aspect of health belief health behavior access to care and likely response to therapeutic intervention at the same time we must be mindful that generalization filtered through the lens of race ethnicity and other sociodemographic factor should not be used indiscriminately in the setting of increasing admixture within and across racial ethnic group in a diversifying united state there is a lack of concordance between today patient and traditional racial stereotype fortunately genomic data are already beginning to predict disease risk and treatment response and advance will no doubt continue to improve their accuracy the ultimate goal is to arrive at a point where medicine becomes so personalized that it is driven from a fingerprint of one biologic makeup not from racial typecasting we are still several step away from such a reality for now the inclusion of race and ethnicity in medical research like age gender and other characteristic inch u closer to a system of personalized medicine that will truly embrace the multiple dimension that influence our health and wellbeing keith norris is a nephrologist at the university of california los angeles he wa the founding principal investigator for the first nihfunded national translational research network dedicated to reducing health disparity and he currently serf a the editor in chief of ethnicity and disease and a an associate editor for the journal of the american society of nephrology http scholargooglecom scholarqjalkqgqmigzaa medicine race problem http wwwhooverorg research medicinesraceproblem apr http wwwpoliticalforumcom the u food and drug administration fda ha issued a new alert about the potential for increased risk for heart failure in patient taking the type diabetes drug saxagliptin onglyza astrazeneca pharmaceutical lp and alogliptin nesina takeda pharmaceutical the fda announced that new warning will be added to the label of the two dipeptidyl peptidase dpp inhibitor drug cautioning that they may increase the risk for heart failure particularly in patient who already have cardiovascular or kidney disease health care professional should consider discontinuing medication containing saxagliptin and alogliptin in patient who develop heart failure and monitor their diabetes control an fda statement note if a patient blood sugar level is not wellcontrolled with their current treatment other diabetes medicine may be required combination product containing the two agent are also affected including saxagliptin and metformin extended release kombiglyze xr astrazeneca pharmaceutical lp alogliptin and metformin kazano takeda pharmaceutical and alogliptin and pioglitazone oseni takeda pharmaceutical the move follows an fda internal safety review of two large cardiovascular outcome trial of patient with cardiovascular disease and a recommendation for the label revision by the fda endocrinologic and metabolic drug advisory committee during an april hearing at that meeting the panel expressed greater concern about heart failure for saxagliptin than for alogliptin but because the mechanism is not clear and the two belong to the same class the majority opted to recommend the warning on both label result of the two study saxagliptin assessment of vascular outcome recorded in patient with diabetes mellitusthrombolysis in myocardial infarction savortimi and examination of cardiovascular outcome with alogliptin versus standard of care examine were first presented at the european society of cardiology meeting in and later published in the new england journal of medicine in the saxagliptin trial which included patient with type diabetes and established cardiovascular disease or who were at high risk for cardiovascular disease there wa no overall risk for cardiovascular event but there wa a increase v in the rate of the first event of hospitalization for heart failure and a potential increased risk for allcause mortality risk factor included a history of heart failure or kidney impairment in examine which included a total of patient of patient receiving drug were hospitalized for heart failure v of patient receiving placebo although the difference wa not statistically significant hazard ratio heart failure wa not an endpoint of the study apr http healthunlockedcom diabetesindia post fdawarnsofheartfailureriskwithtwodiabetesdrugs

while valentine day includes the giving of beautiful heart shaped box a well a other wonderful delight if you have received a box full of chocolate i hope it wa the best kind it seems too good to be true but remember that not all chocolate is bad for u eating chocolate especially dark chocolate ha known health benefit it ha been linked with a decrease in blood pressure and improvement in the ability of the body to respond to the hormone insulin can chocolate be good for you dark chocolate contains high level of flavonols that exert antioxidant property and emerging evidence suggests a potential benefit of a variety of flavonolrich food and beverage on cardiovascular event in a doubleblind randomized placebocontrolled clinical trial in patient with congestive heart failure researcher flammer and colleague compared the effect of commercially available flavonolrich chocolate with cocoaliquorfree control chocolate on endothelial and platelet function they demonstrated that flavonolrich chocolate acutely improves vascular function and inhibits platelet function in patient with congestive heart failure the proposed mechanism includes the activation of nitric oxide and antioxidant antiinflammatory and antiplatelet effect which in turn may improve endothelial function lipid level blood pressure and insulin resistance while this research report didnt say how much dark chocolate need to be consumed to achieve result a separate article say just gram calorie of dark chocolate is good for the heart it basically only take calorie of dark chocolate a day to lower the blood pressure of the participant in a study published in the journal of the american medical association participant consumed gram of polyphenolrich dark chocolate for a period of week and saw their systolic blood pressure decline by point and their diastolic blood pressure decline by point this change occurred without change in body weight or other relevant factor white chocolate doesnt generate the same benefit during the conventional chocolate manufacturing process from fresh cocoa seed to the final product the concentration of flavonols is markedly reduced the term dark chocolate is misleading nothing about the color of the chocolate indicates the flavonol content for example the process of adding alkalipotash to cocoa nib also known a ditching enhances the taste texture and appearance of the cocoa eliminating the bitterness along with most of the active flavonols alkalization also result in a darkening of the cocoa producing a very dark chocolate that is essentially devoid of flavonols fermentation and roasting also have a detrimental impact on the flavonol content of food in addition the concentration of flavonols may depend on the origin of the raw cocoa milk chocolate ha the lowest flavonol content compared with cocoa powder and dark chocolate the caloric content of commercially available around kcal g may cause weight gain which is itself a risk factor for hypertension dyslipidemia and diabetes while a heart shaped box filled with bite size piece of fruit and vegetable isnt exactly screaming love the best step in enjoying chocolate in moderation is to exercise follow a heart healthy diet to enhance cardiovascular health enjoy chocolate in moderation and dont eat the whole box only in moderation part of the information in this article come from a research article titled chocolate for cv health whats the evidence the post chocolate is good for you appeared first on hormone health fitness feb http hormoneshealthandfitnesscom chocolateisgoodforyou

clinical rotation is always going to be valuable and an asset but this is some of the most important nonsurgical information that people can posse while not a surgeon a cardiologist is still a specialist for medical matter of the heart and can create implement and help manage different treatment option for patient two of the most popular career for those that complete the cardiovascular fellowship washington dc are interventional cardiologist and electrophysiologists both of these require additional time and training after the initial fellowship but are rewarding and absolutely more necessary for larger number of people needed to fill all of the open position within the field though it is difficult and time consuming to become a cardiologist the end result is not only a
