reposted from dr mercola http articlesmercolacom site article archive saltintakeheartfailureaspxxcidnonleadsaltintakeheartfailurefacebookdoc by dr mercola close to million american have heart failure while more than case are diagnosed each year if you have heart failure it mean your heart isnt pumping a well a it should be and a a result your body is probably not getting enough oxygen in other word you have a weak heart oncesimple activity like walking or carrying grocery may become difficult and you may also experience fatigue shortness of breath fluid buildup and coughing because heart failure is associated with fluid buildup a lowsalt diet is typically recommended excess sodium may cause your body to retain water and so the conventional thinking go may worsen the fluid buildup associated with heart failure this dietary dogma is touted a fact but in reality you may want to think twice about slashing your salt intake if you have heart failure a new research ha linked it with an increased risk of death cutting down salt intake might worsen health of heart failure patient researcher from rush university medical center in chicago followed more than heart failure patient for an average of three year both their health status and salt intake were analyzed it turned out that those following a lowsodium diet were percent more likely to die or require hospitalization for heart disease compared to those who didnt restrict their salt intake among those restricting their sodium intake percent died or were hospitalized for heart problem during the study compared to percent of those with no salt restriction the researcher concluded in symptomatic patient with chronic hf heart failure sodium restriction may have a detrimental impact on outcome it possible that restricting salt could backfire by altering a person fluid volume lead researcher dr ramus doukky told medical xpress the idea is sodium restriction lead to a contraction of the fluid volume in the body and that turn on certain hormone which try to retain fluid in the body and may potentially accelerate the heart failure process heart benefit of salt restriction increasingly questioned the heart benefit of restricting salt intake have been questioned for some time in a systematic review of data involving people also found evidence wa lacking to recommend salt restriction among people with high blood pressure or normal blood pressure salt restriction wa not significantly associated with overall mortality or cardiovascular mortality among those with congestive heart failure meanwhile salt restriction wa associated with increased mortality risk an update to the review published in also found there is insufficient power to confirm clinically important effect of dietary advice and salt substitution on cardiovascular mortality among people with high blood pressure or normal blood pressure yet another metaanalysis found that people with heart failure who limited their sodium intake had a percent higher risk of death than those who did not some study have shown a modest benefit to salt restriction among some people with high blood pressure but the evidence doe not extend to the rest of the population so whats really going on for starter there a huge difference between natural salt and the processed salt added to processed food and salt shaker in most home and restaurant the former is essential for good health whereas the latter is best avoided altogether sally fallon morell president of the weston a price foundation stated a study from indicates that people need about one and onehalf teaspoon of salt per day anything le trigger a cascade of hormone to recuperate sodium from the waste stream hormone that make people vulnerable to heart disease and kidney problem this is proven biochemistry too little salt may be dangerous the u food and drug administration fda and the food safety inspection service fsis recommend limiting your daily sodium intake to le than milligram mg they advise a further reduction to mg just over onehalf teaspoon for people who are age and older africanamerican or who have hypertension diabetes or chronic kidney disease this encompasses about half of the u population however there are very real risk from eating too little salt and populationwide recommendation to restrict salt intake to very low level could in fact increase rate of a wide range of disease for instance in one study a lowsalt diet led to an increase in insulin resistance which is a risk factor for type diabetes and the change occurred in just seven day research published in jama also found that consuming le than mg of sodium per day may increase your risk of dying from heart disease a lowsodium diet is even linked to increase in ldl cholesterol and triglyceride and an increased risk of death for diabetic another population thats often advised to restrict their sodium intake there also hyponatremia in which your body ha too little sodium causing fluid level to rise and your cell to swell hyponatremia is most common in older adult and athlete whose sodium level may become depleted by excessive sweating and drinking too much water this swelling can cause a number of health problem from mild to severe at it worst hyponatremia can be life threatening leading to brain swelling coma and death but mild to moderate hyponatremia ha more subtle effect that you or your health care provider may not even connect with a sodiumdeficiency problem including nausea vomiting and change in appetite headache confusion hallucination loss of energy fatigue urinary incontinence nervousness restlessness and irritability and other mood change muscle weakness spasm or cramp seizure unconsciousness coma your sodiumpotassium ratio another factor that can have a significant impact on whether salt will harm or help your health is the ratio between the salt and potassium in your diet your body need potassium to maintain proper ph level in your body fluid and it also play an integral role in regulating your blood pressure it possible that potassium deficiency may be more responsible for hypertension which is a risk factor for heart disease than excess sodium imbalance in your sodiumpotassium ratio can lead to hypertension and the easiest way to achieve this imbalance is by consuming a diet of processed food which are notoriously low in potassium while high in sodium processed food are also loaded with fructose which is clearly associated with increased hypertension risk a well a virtually all chronic disease this may also explain why highsodium diet appear to affect some people but not others according to a federal study into sodium and potassium intake those at greatest risk of cardiovascular disease were those who got a combination of too much sodium along with too little potassium according to dr elena kuklina one of the lead author of the study potassium may neutralize the heartdamaging effect of salt tellingly those who ate a lot of salt and very little potassium were more than twice a likely to die from a heart attack a those who ate about equal amount of both nutrient while potassium is found in many food commonly consumed in the u including fruit vegetable dairy product salmon sardine and nut only percent of u adult get the recommended daily amount of mg the easiest way to achieve an imbalance in your sodiumtopotassium ratio is by consuming a diet of processed food which are notoriously low in potassium while high in processed salt according to the fda percent of american sodium intake come from processed and restaurant food when you reduce processed food in your diet youll automatically reduce your intake of processed salt a well how to improve your sodiumpotassium ratio if you eat a lot of processed food and not many vegetable there a good chance your sodiumtopotassium ratio is unbalanced if youre not sure try a free app like my fitness pal which allows you to enter the food you eat and then calculates the ratio automatically it generally recommended that you consume five time more potassium than sodium but most american get two time more sodium than potassium if your ratio is out of balance ditch all processed food which are very high in processed salt and low in potassium and other essential nutrient eat a diet of whole unprocessed food ideally organically and locally grown to ensure optimal nutrient content this type of diet will naturally provide much larger amount of potassium in relation to sodium when using added salt use a natural salt i believe himalayan salt may be ideal a it contains lower sodium and higher potassium level compared to other saltsit can be difficult to get enough potassium from diet but the best way to do so is to increase the amount of vegetable you consume green vegetable juicing is an excellent way to ensure youre getting enough nutrient for optimal health including about to mg of potassium per cup some additional rich source of potassium are lima bean mg cup winter squash mg cup cooked spinach mg cup avocado mg per medium other potassiumrich fruit and vegetable include fruit papaya prune cantaloupe and banana but be careful of banana a they are high in sugar and have half the potassium of an equivalent amount of green vegetable it is a myth that you are getting load of potassium from banana the potassium is twice a high in green vegetable vegetable broccoli brussels sprout avocado asparagus pumpkin swiss chard and beet green top tip to prevent heart failure and other heart problem there are many strategy that can protect your heart no matter what your age please dont wait until you experience heart attack symptom or heart failure to take action because by then it may be too late do so now in order to prevent any longlasting damage eat unprocessed saturated animal fat and ignore the medium a you will benefit from these fat many may also benefit from increasing the healthy fat in their diet to to percent of daily calorie avoid sugar including processed fructose and grain if you are insulin and leptin resistant it doesnt matter if they are conventional or organic a a highsugar highgrain diet promotes insulin and leptin resistance which is a primary driver of heart disease minimize your intake of salt from processed food and instead use natural himalayan salt to flavor your real food exercise regularly people who engage in at least minute of moderate exercise or minute of vigorous exercise a week had a percent lower risk of heart failure than inactive people use a combination of highintensity interval training strength training stretching and core work avoid excess sitting aim for three hour a day or le of sitting and try to take step a day in addition to your exercise program regularly walk barefoot to ground with the earth when you do free electron are transferred from the earth into your body this grounding effect is one of the most potent antioxidant we know of and help alleviate inflammation throughout your body manage your stress daily one of my favorite tool for stress management is the emotional freedom technique eft feb http onepercenthealthblogspotcom proven a lot of people bought into standing desk only to now learn they arent healthy for you either quote if there anything scientist know about the best type of desk for an office worker longterm health it that they dont really know anything according to a new analysis of the scientific literature on the matter after closely examining of the highest quality study about workplace intervention to reduce sitting time which include standing pedaling and treadmill desk researcher concluded that there simply isnt enough data to say whether any of the alternative are better that just plopping in front of a standard desk a number of study in the past had found that planting your bum in an office chair for hour at a time can up your chance of heart failure disability and even shorten your life collectively the data spurred a trend for alternative workstation that are aimed at reversing those negative effect boosting calorie burning and improving overall health but the reviewer say it when you think about a massive heart attack you probably imagine someone who suddenly clutch their chest and collapse this is not always the scenario even with a large heart attack although some heart attack are more dramatic than others a heart attack is always serious whether a heart attack is mild or severe you can improve your odds of living the longest healthiest life possible if you know what to do what cause heart attack all heart attack occur when circulation of blood to the heart is blocked if the blockage is not rapidly opened heart tissue will die from a lack of oxygen most often a heart attack also called myocardial infarction mi is a result of coronary heart disease chd coronary heart disease is a narrowing of the coronary artery which bring blood into the heart muscle coronary heart disease is most often caused by atherosclerosis a buildup of fatty plaque on the artery wall narrowed coronary artery reduce blood flow to the heart muscle and can cause chest pain angina especially during exercise or stress in addition blood clot form more easily in a narrowed artery damaged by fatty plaque a blood clot can completely block blood flow causing a heart attack and lifethreatening heart damage angina is not a heart attack but if it doe not go away with rest or after taking nitroglycerin it is a sign of a developing heart attack what is a mild heart attack a mild heart attack affect a relatively small portion of the heart muscle or doe not cause much permanent heart damage this is because the blockage in a coronary artery occurs in a small artery that supply a small portion of the heart muscle doe not completely block blood flow to the heart or last briefly it is a common misconception that a mild heart attack is not serious even if the area of the heart affected is small a heart attack can result in permanent heart damage and lifethreatening problem that affect you for the rest of your life including heart failure an abnormal heart beat arrhythmia and a higher risk of a second heart attack what is a massive heart attack a massive heart attack affect a large portion of the heart muscle or cause a large amount of heart damage this can happen if the blockage in a coronary artery occurs in a large artery that supply a large portion of the heart completely block blood flow to the heart or last for a long period of time a massive heart attack can result in collapse cardiac arrest when your heart stop beating and rapid death or permanent heart damage a massive heart attack can also lead to heart failure arrhythmia and a higher risk of a second hear apr http drrajivpasseyblogspotcom mildandmassiveheartattackswhatshtml

medical id of the national heart lung and blood institute which sponsored the study the researcher think that this study will clearly have an impact on patient care for those with hypertensionthis is a very big deal say dr mark creager president of the american heart association and director of the heart vascular center at the dartmouth hitchcock medical center in lebanon nh i believe that this study will serve a a roadmap towards saving a significant number of livesabout onethird of u adult have high blood pressure high blood pressure is a major risk factor for a variety of health problem including heart attack stroke and heart failure most blood pressure chart recommend that high blood pressure patient reduce their systolic blood pressure cardiologist consider this to be the more important of the two reading from a blood pressure measurement to a maximum of the study set out to determine whether lower systolic blood pressure might be even better researcher recruited more than adult with high blood pressure and at least one other risk factor for heart disease ie being a smoker or having high cholesterol the subject were slip in half half of the doctor attempted to get the systolic pressure down to in some patient the other half attempted to reduce the systolic pressure to the study wa supposed to continue until well into but it wa stopped recently when a panel monitoring the result found in a preliminary analysis that it had already produced significant result it wa concluded reducing systolic blood pressure to or lower reduced heart attack stroke and heart failure by almost a third and the risk of death by almost a quarter gibbon say rt center of indiana vice president of the american college of cardiologythe study acknowledged it may be difficult for patient to hit the lower target about half of those who have been diagnosed with high blood pressure fail to reach the current target of we have a long way to go in improving public awareness about high blood pressure making sure it detected and appropriately treated creager say but study such a this really reinforce that we need to take important step to raise public awareness to make sure that heart go out to you i have been there but i want you to know thing can get better they dont usually get better all by themselves though it doe take some work and i know it can seem hopeless and endless at time but it really can get a whole lot better it ha for me i wa so sick i had a stroke and kidney failure congestive heart failure anemia the whole yard i am now married got my hair back kept my kidney they are functioning normally got full function of my hand back and im happy i work out teach guitar wrote a book go out and have fun with friend i can even get an a on dance dance wwwcorviamedicalcom tewksbury mass march prnewswire corvia medical inc a privatelyheld medical device company that developed a firstinclass transcatheter structural heart device to treat heart failure today announced that it ha received investigational device exemption ide approval from the fda for a multicenter study of the company interatrial shunt device iasd for the treatment of heart failure the company also announced that it ha entered into an exclusive optiontopurchase agreement with an undisclosed strategic partner treating heart failure patient especially those with preserved ejection fraction continues to be a challenge a current pharmacological treatment are ineffective commented martin leon md director of the center for interventional vascular therapy at columbia university medical center in new york and chair of the company scientific advisory group we expect the result of the reduce laphf i randomized study to confirm the significant clinical benefit demonstrated in the observational study and will show clinically meaningful improvement in nyha functional class exercise capacity and quality of life for this patient population the reduce laphf i study is a prospective multicenter randomized controlled study to evaluate the iasd system to reduce elevated left atrial pressure in patient with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction also known a diastolic heart failure the study will enroll patient at up to site in the united state and up to site outside the united state the ide approval and strategic funding solidify our commitment to advancing our breakthrough therapy for patient suffering from chronic heart failure said george fazio president and ceo of corvia medical we look forward to providing physician a technology that is designed to facilitate continuous and dynamic decompression of the left atrium and address the debilitating symptom of heart failure he continues we are especially pleased to have the support of a strategic partner with bestinclass global resource a we move this novel treatment toward international commercialization about the corvia atrial decompression system the corvia atrial decompression system is the world first transcatheter device designed to treat heart failure with preserved ejection fraction hfpef after creating a small opening in the atrial septum the corvia implant is deployed forming a passage between the left and right atrium that enables the left atrium to decompress with the aim of lowering left atrial pressure by facilitating continuous and dynamic decompression of the left atrium the corvia system aim to improve heart failure symptom and quality of life decrease heart failure hospitalization rate and reduce the overall cost burden of managing heart failure patient for more information please visit http treatmyheartfailurecom the corvia atrial decompression system also known a the interatrial shunt device iasd is not available for commercial distribution in the united state about corvia medical inc corvia medical inc formerly dc device inc is dedicated to revolutionizing the treatment of heart failure with firstinclass transcatheter structural heart device privately held the company is backed by third rock venture general catalyst partner accelmed lumira capital and an undisclosed strategic investor for more information please visit http corviamedicalcom medium contact mar http wwwprnewswirecom newsreleases corviamedicalreceivesideapprovalforreducelaphficlinicalstudyannouncesagreementwithstrategicpartnerforexclusiveoptiontopurchasecompanyhtml

newswise april depression is a known risk factor for cardiovascular disease but a a person depression improves or grows worse their risk for heart disease ha remained largely unknown but now a new study by researcher at the intermountain medical center heart institute in salt lake city found that effectively treating depression can reduce a patient chance of having a stroke heart failure a heart attack or death in fact effective treatment for depression can reduce a patient heart risk to the same level a those who never had shortterm depression the study found our study show that prompt effective treatment of depression appears to improve the risk of poor heart health said heidi may phd a cardiovascular epidemiologist with the intermountain medical center heart institute with the help of past research we know depression affect longterm cardiovascular risk but knowing that alleviating the symptom of depression reduces a person risk of heart disease in the short term too can help care provider and patient commit more fully to treating the symptom of depression she said the key conclusion of our study is if depression isnt treated the risk of cardiovascular complication increase significantly dr may presented her finding at the american college of cardiology scientific session in chicago on april researcher havent completely understood whether a shortterm encounter with depression affect a person cardiovascular risk forever or how change in the symptom of depression over time affect cardiovascular risk dr may and her team found answer to these question by studying data compiled in intermountain healthcare depression registry a database of more than patient there little publicallyavailable data about this question dr may said but now with the help of intermountains depression registry we have the ability to start answering some of these difficult question the intermountain medical center heart research team compiled information from patient who completed at least two depression questionnaire over the course of one to two year patient were categorized based on the result of their survey a never depressed no longer depressed remained depressed or became depressed following each patient completion of the last questionnaire patient were followed to see if they had any major cardiovascular problem such a a stroke heart failure heart attack or death at the conclusion of the study percent of patient who were no longer depressed had a similar occurrence of major cardiovascular complication a those who had no depression at all percent those who remained depressed however and those who became depressed throughout the study had increased occurrence of major cardiovascular problem their rate were and percent respectively treatment for depression resulted in a decreased risk of cardiovascular risk that wa similar to someone who didnt have depression a for the practical application of this study dr may said the research indicates that effective treatment for depression decrease the risk of having cardiovascular problem in the short term but further study is needed to identify exactly what that treatment should include what weve done thus far is simply observe data that ha previously been collected dr may said in order to dig deeper we need do a full clinical trial to fully evaluate what weve observed because of the complex nature of depression it hard to say whether depression lead to risk factor associated with cardiovascular problem such a high blood pressure high cholesterol level diabetes or a lack of exercise or if it the other way around result from the study indicate that change in depression symptom may also cause immediate physiological change in the body which in turn cause major cardiovascular problem to occur in the short term but future study are needed to further answer these question other researcher involved in the study include kimberly brunisholz phd benjamin horne phd brent j muhlestein md tami bair rn donald lapp md adam b wilcox phd and brenda reissbrennan phd aprn intermountain medical center is the flagship facility for the intermountain healthcare system which is based in salt lake city apr http todaysseniorsnetworkseniorhealthblogspotcom improvingsymptomsofdepressioncanhtml
